Ratings.comment: Dr. Kraft is passionate and highly knowledgeable, but her arrogance often overshadows her expertise. She carries a god complex, making the class feel more about catering to her ego than learning. The coursework is doable, but dealing with her attitude is frustrating. If you prefer a more approachable professor, I'd recommend looking elsewhere.

This is a tyrant that is disrespectful and cunning for no reason. Hard work has never scared me however she does. If she doesn't click with you she will withhold things from you and disrespect you on the daily. She has a GOD complex. I don't appreciate her sarcasm because it is mean spirited and I'm not surprised that she made so many students cry.

I really did not agree with her style of teaching. She's one to be testing your patience with a lot of sarcastic remarks that don't land very well. There was nothing inspiring about the professor. I felt that if she considers you a threat, you will be a target in a bad way. I felt that most people fear her rather than revered her.

Nicole is very knowledgable about her field and it shows. She cares about her students and always tries to make herself available. The tough part is that her class is a "flipped classroom"; you do the reading and learning outside of class and then apply it in class discussions and projects. Readings are LONG, but you can get by with skimming.

Kraft made me want to reconsider being a journalist.  She is disrespectful and gaslights her students, and made me cry multiple times.  I am going out of my way to make a schedule that does not fit in my work schedule just to avoid having Kraft as a professor.  She points out your insecurities and makes them higher just to make herself feel better.

Nicole pushes her insecurities onto her students and it is very obvious. If you are interested in TV production or anything besides being a writer, she loses all respect for you. Don't waste your time in her office hours because she has an attitude and will make you cry like she did to me at least 6 times. I had to go to therapy because of her.

Nicole's lectures and real world application make her a great professor. Her abrasiveness and fakeness make her hard to love though. I learned a lot from her, but she also made me cry many times and question quitting the program. Her "encouragement" is copied and pasted to each student and she does not hold back from judgement.

Nicole has to be one of the greatest professors I have ever had. The amount of information you will learn is incredible and current, and she makes it very easy to make connections between class material and everyday events. SO INCREDIBLY UNDERSTANDING... I cannot stress that enough. She will do her best to connect with her students. AMAZING!

Nicole truly wants what's best for her students. She has incredible connections and wants her students to succeed in the journalism world. She does assign readings and projects, but none of it was too difficult.

If you'd like a professor that assigns random work that you don't know about until the night before, doesn't especially teach with her "inverted classroom" style and selects favorites yet absolutely despises anyone who reaches out for help, then by all means take this course! Heavy group work, meaningless readings and a hellish finals week.

Nicole Kraft was one of the best professors I have EVER had. She required alot of work in and out of class, but she laid the material out in a manner that made it very easy to keep up with. In class, she encouraged everyone to participate and offer their input to the class material. Nicole was also more than willing to help at the drop of a dime.

Dr. Kraft was an amazing professor that was very accessible and it was very appreciated given that we're in the middle of a pandemic. I have never learned more than I have from this class and it was refreshing to be in a class where you feel like the professor cares. Harsh feedback sometimes though so get ready to have some tough skin.

Nicole is kind of terrifying, but probably one of the most considerate professors I've had during this pandemic. Make sure you do the readings before class; you'll need it for the quizzes and for life, too. I enjoyed most of what we learned, it really prepares you for the real, journalistic world. It's important to keep an open mind in this class.
A great teacher who genuinely cares about her students. Also plays good music. Highly recommend taking her class.

Nicole is demanding but she is fair and cared about her students. You won't feel like your just chasing a grade, you'll have a sense of purpose in Kraft classes. If you want to become a better writer, you won't regret taking her class.

Do you want to learn to be a writer? Take Nicole's class. Do you want to learn to interview? Take Nicole's class. Do you want to learn to get connected to people who will help your career? Take Nicole's class. I've taken classes just to work with her and have never regretted it. You won't either. No professor will ever care more about you.

Nicole Kraft is one of the best teachers in the School of Comm. She understands the needs of students and tries her hardest to be flexible. Unsure where all the hate comes from. She's open and she's honest. If you're doing something wrong she'll let you know. Don't take her criticisms as attacks, because she just wants to see you succeed in life.

COMM 2221 was one of the most difficult classes I have taken at OSU but everything Nicole does is to help you become a better journalist. She expects a lot but she also goes above and beyond to help you get there and help you succeed. She has insane connections and so much firsthand knowledge. I learned and grew more in her class than any other.

I loved Nicole as a professor. She gave plenty of opportunity to receive a good final grade and was always extremely helpful. I actually enjoyed her lectures a lot, she kept them upbeat and interesting. By far one of the best professors I have had in college thus far.

I had Nicole for Sports Media. LOVED the class and she was a GREAT professor. Field trips, guest speakers, great discussions and fun assignments that we could actually get published She even let us cover an NHL game with her. She worked to help every be successful. I had no experience like it at Ohio State. Wish I could take this class again.
She was tough but I learned a lot. She prepares you for the real world. She also has great connections and will help with internships. Take her. You wont be sorry.
Nicole is the best professor I had at Ohio State. She is tough but cares more than any professor I had. You learn tons and she makes it fun.

Nicole is raw and authentic. She isn't there to just give you an A. She is there to make you career-ready and the A comes throughout the process. She is willing to work with her students and wants to get to know them on a personal level. The first half of the semester I hated her, but I realized she was actually helping me and my attitude changed.

Already regret taking 3404 with her a month in. She acts as if she is our employer, and we are to respect her as if she is our boss. This is a 3 level class- calm down lady! I don't want you to know all about your personal life, and you don't need to "reach" me.  Picks clear favorites, told a student he was her pet.  "hands on" but over the top.
Don't go in thinking it will be easy but it is totally worth it. You will get out of the class what you put into it. I would take any class with her again.

Com 4202. In office hours, she was not much help. Gave me anxiety attacks over grading, biggest pet peeve was that she would give you a chance to fix your articles and said if you follow any of the feedback comments given on articles, you'd get credit, which was untrue. Expect to give a lot of effort and time for little to no academic reward.

every day, you show up with constant anxiety about what random assignment you're missing. She assigns so much work and if for some reason she doesn't like you, you're done. i wish nicole the best but i would rather change my major than take another class of hers.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS UNLESS YOU ARE A JOURNALISM MAJOR. For those of us that this class is required, but are not journalism majors, it just doesn't make sense. She's a nice lady with good intent, but her "inverted" classroom style is confusing and doesn't have the effect that she thinks it does. Also, she considers this class to be a "job"....

She gave me multiple anxiety attacks over the course of two semesters, two of which were in class - and the second time, she said I was "out of control". She was the reason I changed my major - I didn't want to deal with her again. If you enjoy teachers who push you to the brink, this is for you. Otherwise, leave while your sanity is still intact.

She's great! There's a lot of work, but it's all relevant to the class as a whole. There's a quiz every week, 2 exams, 2 big projects, and 8 other assignments to help with the larger projects. She's pretty tough but only to make you understand the material better. She also goes out of her way to make sure her students are okay out of the classroom.

Nicole is very good at making you see the other side of things, playing devil's advocate with almost every point brought up. She provided very many opportunities to engage out of class and earn extra credit. She is funny and really has a passion for what she does as well as helping her students. Very sad she is not teaching 2221 this semester.

Nicole at first is pretty intimidating, but she just wants to push her students to be their best. At times the class seems overwhelming, but if you put in a solid effort there should be no problems getting a good grade.

She's just amazing. Helps you with everything, insprational, won't just push you out there without helping. It's not about the grade, it's about the learning. She has experience, she's tough but only to help you. Take a class with her you won't regret it, especially if yo'ure hoping to be a journalist.
Nicole is great! She was clear about instructions and the syllabus is very clear. This was the second semester of using iPads and it was awesome. I learned so much in this class!

My class was the very first class of hers to be taught on Ipad which turned out to be awful. I felt like the amount I put into the class was not shown very well in my grade. I felt like she stated her opinion a lot on what she liked and didn't like(ex:majors). When she said she was there to help you she was but wasn't able to relate it to you.

Nicole is great. If you show that you're actually there to learn and engage, you'll be fine. She'll invest in you as much as you invest in the class. You're gonna work hard, but you're gonna learn a lot.

The 1st week of class I thought that she was energetic and that it was an engaging class. However, she was extremely immature and consistently made it clear what students she liked and did not like. Students constantly complained about this. She would explain a project in class and then severely penalize grades for things not mentioned. Don't take.

I really liked Nicole the first week of class, but for some reason she really disliked me. As hard as I worked, it just seemed like I could never do anything right. I felt that I was continually belittled in front of the class and she had no respect for me. After she almost made me cry in front of the class, I dropped it. Then I changed my major.

I had Professor Kraft for 421 and 422 and can't wait to take 602 with her. She was absolutely helpful, inspiring and I learned so much from her. I have come to look to her as my mentor and could not recommend a teacher more than her. You will enjoy and look forward to class with Nicole!
Professor bends over backwards to provide professional/career opportunities.  You will get your feet wet - this class is the most applicable to the real world that I have taken at OSU.

The most useful class I have taken at OSU. Nicole takes time to get to know her students and helps give advice on your future career. She is encouraging and realistic about the field. The assignments are relevant and interesting. Take advantage of visiting Hoof Beats magazine for possible future internships.

Nicole was the only good journalsim teacher I have had at OSU. Not only does she KNOW what she's talking about, she will be there to help you in the future-internships, references, etc. She is the editor of a major harness racing magazine, so she knows what she's talking about. Follow her directions, and you will be glad you took this class!

best class i have taken at osu.  she's really opinionated, but is willing to work with anyone who asks for help.  genuinely cares about everyone leaving with the ability to write magazine articles and KNOWS WHAT SHE'S TALKING ABOUT. : )

shes very insightful, interested, and passionate.  she is strong minded, and blunt, but her straightforward honesty is refreshing.  this class prepares you, and for those of us so close to graduating, this is the kind of class we need

If you want an easy or even enjoyable GE, do not take this class. She is a ridiculously harsh grader for the level of class. Expect to lose points for trivial things and get unhelpful feedback. It's almost impossible to get full points on things unless you can read her mind. Avoid unless you want to spend way too much time on a low-level GE class.

Emily Davidson deserves nobody's respect. Somewhere between her God-complex and consistent flexing of her PhD, she finds time to unfairly treat students. She is power-mad and overly-critical. I was a model student, active participant, and exceptional writer, but Emily treated me unfairly and disrespectfully.

emily's lectures were usually pretty boring, but she broke down the material in ways that were easy to understand and keep track of, since it's mainly theories and whatnot. i thought the class was interesting, and she could be funny at times, but also it was really just us sitting there for an hour taking notes. easy a for sure.

DO NOT take this course because its is absurd for how hard it is just being a GE course... The professor is terrible she like to get into tiny details while researching and paper writing hat is not even needed. No matter how hard you work you would still end up getting a bad grade.

She was such a strict grader for a GE class and her comments on every paper were very unclear, harsh, and rude. She would take weeks to grade a paper when you needed feedback from the previous paper to write the next one. Do not take this class.

Genuinely one of the hardest classes I've taken in my college career, and it's only a GE credit. Dr. Davidson is an incredibly hard grader, so you need to be very careful as she is not forgiving. All the assignments build off each other in the class as well, so if you don't have a good start it can be difficult to succeed. I can't recommend it.

I would not recommend this class to anyone. I am a double major in Comm and English and she never gave me an A on a single paper. She was such a hard grader and was not helpful at all. Every single assignment was extremely difficult and I would spend hours on one of the papers to get a 75 at best.

Great professor who's extremely passionate about what she teaches. Be careful as each paper builds upon the next so you want to make sure your first paper is very solid. Please do the reading and study for the comprehensive exam or you will fail it. It's not just definitions it's applying textbook theories. Large part of exam is comprehensive exam.

Dont recommend at all. Way to tough of a grader for a GE credit and the feedback is rude. If you like writing, shell change that quick! All the papers rely on the last one so if you dont do good on the first one its pretty much downhill from there.

She has a PHD in English (already a reg flag) and definitely grades with it. If you don't like English don't take her she grades tough and unrealistic. When she gives feedback on your papers its rude and has attitude with it. Not too much work but there is a paper to write every other week. She takes this gen ed class way too serious. Wouldn't reco

Dr. Davidson is a great professor! The weekly quizzes and discussion posts are quite easy, and the hardest thing about the class is the weekly paper, but even that is not bad at all. The lectures are super interesting, and I think she is a great lecturer. Despite being an online, asynchronous class, I really enjoyed it. I recommend her & the class!

I really enjoyed this class. It had its challenging moments, but was easygoing for the most part. She emails back very quickly, & is always ready to help. She is very understanding & will work with you. Make sure to read the readings thoroughly, & really participate in the discussion boards.
Too many boring papers over the same topic. Takes a very long time to grade and is harsh at grading.
Papers, speeches, and discussions have a lot of rubrics. Give the score slowly. Very strict on reference and format.
Excessive amounts of busy work in this class.

The professor himself is great- fun and competent in the material. His class- not so much. The entirety of the grade is exams, which are placed nearly back-to-back with an insane amount of readings you're supposed to have memorized for each exam. He hands out extra credit completely random and at whim. Very poor communication.
Dr. Appiah was wonderful at lecturing! Great online class to take.

I really enjoyed this class. Despite it being online, I could sense how passionate Dr. Appiah was about the content he was teaching. Exams come straight from the reading...so power through them. There are not a lot of points offered in the course so make sure you do well on each one to succeed. Also, take advantage of the extra credit!

Dr. Appiah does not know how to teach an online course. Weekly 5-7 articles (upwards of 25 pages each) we were expected to read, along with 2+ hour lecture video. 2 big exams where questions are all specific to the articles. Spent 10+ hours making a 30 for 30 video for final project and got C for things not mentioned in instructions and no rubric.
Osei is a great guy. Lectures can be a bit lengthy but the topic is interesting. Weekly discussion posts on the lecture and readings. A final, midterm, and final paper.

Entertaining lecturer. Exams are challenging. Readings are long, wordy studies. Takes forever (weeks, sometimes a whole semester) to upload grades. He won't tell you your grade if you ask. Your final grade is two exams and a research paper. He gives a lot of extra credit but didn't put it all in. I wish I could give a better rating.
Professor Appiah is a great professor and is very nice. His class is very easy if you watch the lectures and do the discussions at the end of every week. If you do those things you will pass.
Osei was great in my COMM 4445 class. He is funny, down-to-earth and really takes times to explain course concepts.

Osei is an excellent professor who really takes the time to explain things well. All you do is listen to the lecture and do discussions. He makes everything make sense. He is really nice. My only complaint is that his TA grades everything and he will take off points without telling you why, and when you ask he won't tell you. Give me my points!

He is the greatest professor in the department at OSU. I had him when I first transferred and was eager to enroll in many more classes. 2 papers and an exam - that's it. Ask for help, he is extremely caring and understanding. He is funny and the GOAT at basketball. He will play you for extra credit. He left the biggest impact on my life.

This guy is hilarious and he hands out extra credit like candy. This class was definitely a highlight of my semester. It's not hard, but you also definitely need to review a little before the test. Graded on two exams and a final paper. Be sure to go to class so you can enjoy his funny stories and get in on those extra credit points.

Osei is really great and passionate about Advertising and the communication field. He is super enjoyable to listen to but honestly I scrolled through pinterest during lecture and pulled out a 94. Study his study guide topics and you'll do great on the exam

Appiah is the best professor I've had at Ohio State.  He is so funny and down to earth, and makes his lectures relatable and interesting.  Although he doesn't hardly ever take attendance, I always wanted to go.

This class is easy. He wants you to pass, plain and simple. He makes a study guide before each exam, and tells you basically what's going to be on it. He worked at Nike in the marketing department, so he knows what he is talking about. Plus he plays basketball and volleyball with students for extra credit.
Great professor! Easy class. He obviously enjoys his job and meeting new people. I definitely recommend him.
Great class, great prof!

This was an OK class. He's very funny, but gets off topic. Attendance isn't mandatory but he doesn't post anything online and in class he tells you exactly what questions will be on tests. I guess you could read the textbook and still pass the tests, but if you went to class you'll do better. Also he gives lots of extra credit.

Professor Osei is pretty funny and you can learn things on his lecture. He relies on his two TAs and they almost took charge on everything like midterms and finals for whole class. Every American student loves Osei but for an international student it's hard for me to understand all his lectures. Also, his tests are tough for me and my grade is suck

Dr. Appiah is very funny and his class is enjoyable. No attendance taken but he doesn't post notes online. He also offers A LOT of extra credit usually when people don't show up. His midterms can be a little bit confusing but you can get an A if you show up and do the work. He doesn't always reply to emails though which I thought was very annoying.
BEST teacher at OSU hands down! who doesn't love Osei? But very relatable and his work is easy and not too complicated

One of my favorite teachers at Osu! He is so funny and down to earth. He gives real world examples that help you remember class info. You get to watch movies about Mcdonalds and Nike. He worked at Nike too which is pretty neat! Easy exams multiple choice and short answer. I studied and got A's and High B's and i typically don't test well. EC avail.

He talks about himself a good amount. He is funny which helped. He knew a lot of info...But if he doesn't have a TA. Then he is super unorganized. The class material was clear but he was terrible at responding to my emails personally. Gives a lot of extra credit which was nice.
Osei is a boss!! Great class very interesting. Exams were tough! Doesnt post his notes online go to class everyday!

I had Osei for COMM 4445 and COMM 2331 and he was one of the coolest professors I've ever had.  His exams are pretty easy and if you pay attention and go to class, there is no way you wont pass either class.

Osei is the best teacher ever! He is so hilarious, we sometimes get so off track with all his stories. The material is easy, and he puts everything on power points; but you can only get the notes if you go to class. Exams are pretty easy if you study. Overall, he is the best professor I've had.
Osei was the man. His lectures were a pretty entertaining mix of stories and actual material. If you show up to class, the book is unnecessary. Easy A.

I believe it was the first day of class that he rambled on for a few minutes about his life and what it was like for him to grow up in California and how he doesn't like Ohio because it is cold and how he has never wanted to work/have a job. It was entertaining...and it was accurate...he does not want to work...

Very easy going guy, and so is his class.  He favors black people, but whatever.  He hates the winter weather in Ohio so every two weeks he flies back home to California so the TA just pops in a pointless video to entertain the class on days he is absent.  Pretty easy.  Taking notes on a laptop can be beneficial!  Must be nice to be Ossei. "ah-say"

Do you want to hear about how he played bball with Snoop Dogg, "could've" played in the NBA, worked for Nike, Apple, and a top ad agency in the world and hear at least 1 super innapropriate comment every class? Then this class is for you. It takes him over 3 weeks to grade scantron exams, and he never answers emails. 2nd class w/him & hes annoying.
This guy is pretty good. Sometimes the test are hard and there is nowhere to keep track of the grades but overal he makes class interesting enough to attend.Only class I am yet to skip.

Osei can run circles around students half his age. He used to be a great basketball player back in CA; he is blessed with excellent athletic abilities. A great teacher and a scholar. handsome enough to be a hollywood actor; can wow the ladies and make them faint like nine pins in a bowling alley. Too bad he got married at ISU--a dream professor.
Osei is great makes class anjoyable, he is funny and relates class to real world experience not what the text says.  Great class gets everyone involved and makes for a great learning environment

A certain boy wonder like me entered Appiah's class from a foreign country way back at ISU.This guy is awesome, I thought, why don't we have more teachers like him back home? I felt blessed to be his student. A stanford and cornell educated basketball master. Bravo, bravo, bravo.It was a pleasure to learn from you.
Very interesting class. Lots of chances for extra credit. Dr Appiah knows his stuff and is very intelligent.

Osei definitely made this class for me; he also has a lot of useful info because of his time in the industry. Extra credit is offered in class so attendance isn't mandatory but it's definitely worth it. Also some questions on tests come from lecture notes that can't be found in the text. If you need a GEC or it is required don't fear.

He gives you time to get all the note on the slide before he move on. His tests are really straight forward and not hard, but usually about 15% of the test is based on stories he talks about in class that you wont find in the book. Easy A, you don't have to attend all the time, and the TA is this really hot blonde chick.
Osei made the class interesting and worth my while to go. Definitely one of the best profs I've had at OSU and would definitely recommend taking him if needed.

Osei is one of the best professors I have had at OSU.  He is an EXPERT in his field of work having experience at Nike and I am pretty sure he worked at Apple.  He keeps lecture entertaining and knows so much about Strategic Comm. Principles.  The man went to Cornell and Stanford! He is a genius.

Sub-par. There are much better teachers. He knows so much about the subject, but doesn't know how to teach it. He inserts useless stories and talks on his opinions and his research while his TA's do the majority of the work in the class.
Great teacher, really funny.  It's a good class, but there is a lot of reading.  Class attendance isn't required, but you'll actually want to go.

I thought that "Strategic Communication Prinicples" was going to be really boring, but he made it really interesting. He obviously has lots of experience in this area and he was really good about keeping class interesting. His TA that wrote the test wasn't very helpful, but that wasn't Osei's falut. Take his class, its awesome.

Fun teacher gives extra credit for answering questions during class! tells lots of jokes and brings his real world experiences into the classroom and relates them  only problem is some things on study guide/exam are not in book or lecture and you have to go find it online

He is a great Professor. He teaches the class in a way where it is fun and interesting. His exams are a bit difficult for the material he teaches, but as long as you come to class your grade should be no lower than a B.
He doesn't post grades which I found annoying because his TA was really bad. Fun teacher, but exams hard.

Very nice guy and fun classes. Only problem i have is that he makes his tests too hard for the material covered. Makes each question have almost 2 identical answers for multiple choice. Does a horrible horrible job of answering emails too. But overall a good instructor.

He's cool. Very interesting material and a great teaching style. Every class was fun. He's a little elusive though and difficult to meet with. Luckily the tests are easy and don't require a lot of elaboration outside of the regular class time.

Osei was a fantastic comm professor!  He literally brought the subject to life through extensive use of example commercials. Made a 1hr48min class SO fun and interesting. Offered lots of extra credit, and tests were of medium difficulty; nothing you cant do if you study the inclass notes. Oh, and he is absolutely hilarious. You will love this guy.
Class was not difficult overall, however it is tough to get ahold of him outside of the classroom. Go to class and you should get no lower than a B.

Maybe the best professor I have ever had. It was actually fun to go and sit in lecture for an 1hr30. He knew his stuff, he was funny, class was interactive. The tests were based alot off of the text so you need to read in this class, but there couldn't be a better prof for this class. A+++

Wonderful teacher! Definetly knows his stuff! I went to class ever time we had it, and was always glad that I did. He was very helpfu and always willing to further explain things if you needed it. I HIGHLY recomment this teacher, it was a great experience!

Very intelligent professor who is definitely an expert in advertising.  He has a way of making even the most boring topic interesting.  It is amazing that a class can be so fun while being so informative.  I would take any class that he offered, I don't care if it's Advertising 22431.
Amazing! Osei is hilarious and so interesting. He makes the material fun by applying it to real life. What other teacher lets you watch Superbowl commercials in class?!  great, fun, easy class!

This guy was freakin' awesome!  Very intelligent, clear, concise, helpful, funny, fun, and and all around good prof.  Class wasn't that bad either, very interesting stuff, and he definitely knows what he's talking about.  Take any and all classes that you can with him, you won't be sorry!
Good stuff
He's a wonderful teacher.  I highly recommend taking him.
Easy- take it.  Book not necessary, just study the notes from class.  Funny guy who has an impressive resume.

This man is interesting and knows his stuff.  He has lots of experience and teaches on a level that students can learn from and WANT to learn from.  He is straight forward with his tests and if you read the book and study you will have no problem  I would highly recommend this class!

I don't know how anyone could give this prof a poor rating. He's the best I've ever had! His past experience in the industry makes him extremely knowledgeable. His stories and way of teaching make him entertaining! I want to take every class he teaches!
Advertising & Society - great class, never a dull moment!
Great Professor! She has P.H.D- (“passed w/ HIGH difficulty”) 🤣🤣

Her class is super accessible to students. In her hybrid class basically every class is available in person but you can just join online no questions asked. It is mostly big projects but you have a lot of time to complete them and they all relate to each other so you can reuse a lot of material. Lectures very engaging too.
Amazing class and professor!!! I learned so much and would suggest this class to anyone.
Easiest A imaginable. The "required textbook and reads" are no needed to pass the actual class. All quizzes are online. Graded super light on basically everything.

Marla is hands down my favorite professor I have ever had. She is SO caring and understanding about everything. She pushed back the deadline of almost every assignment if we told her we were stressed. She cares a lot about her students, and imo was a very easy grader. The only prob was the quizzes, bc you have to teach urself the material.

Professor Carano was a very nice professor who cared a lot about what students had to say and respected their opinions. The class is not very difficult and does not require much work. My biggest issue with her is the amount of time it took her to grade. It felt like I would already have submitted 2 more essays before she even graded the first.
W Professor gave extra credit and was so helpful and curves

While this is one of the easiest classes I have taken at OSU, there is a lot of work. Nothing that cannot be done and you are basically given an A as long as you do the work. The class is very straight to the point, and she is an incredibly caring teacher. Just stay on top of your work and you'll be fine! :)

Marla Carano is an AMAZING professor. She is inspirational and genuinely cares about every single one of her students. Go to her office hours! She is so helpful and will bend over backwards to help ensure your success. I took this class as 2nd level writing course but was blown away at how much I actually improved upon my communication skills.
Super fun, would absolutely recommend
Tom Stewart has been a very good influence on me during my college career. He is very well loved by all of his students and cares about their well being and education fully.

Easily my favorite professor I have had so far at The Ohio State University. Lectures are completely engaging, the course material is applicable so often in real life, and Tom is a genuinely caring, respectful, kind, and funny person.

Only class I look forward to being a stem major, so that should say enough. He is such a great lecturers and makes a topic like public speaking come s natural through his life lessons. Classes are broken down into 3 speeches, two easy exams and participation points. Absolutly love coming to his class even if I have class on south campus!

Tom consistently only uses 25-40 minutes of his 55 minute lecture period which I rather enjoyed. Also, you only have to do 4 speeches throughout the whole semester and its in small lab groups. Plus he gives tons of extra credit and double points for just showing up to class (especially on bad weather days!)

Tom does a great job at explaining the different aspects of public speaking in an engaging and comedic way. He gives you all of the tools you need to be a successful public speaker in any situation. His class has been one of my favorites so far. He is a great person and instructor!

Truly made public speaking a piece of cake. Literally. He brought cake to class a couple times. Giving the presentations in recitation was super laid-back, and Tom really reassures you over and over that there is nothing to be nervous about. Public speaking is a breeze for me now because of this class.

If you have to take a public speaking class, have no fear. This was as good as a public speaking class gets. You only present to 15 people MAX in recitation, and Tom tells you all the points you need to hit to get an A. I wasn't fond of public speaking before this class, but by the end of the semester I didn't even get nervous before my speeches.

This was a great class to learn more about PR in a hands on sense. We worked within our own communication firm (group project of students) to assist a local business. Turn in dates are lenient and there are guardrail throughout to make sure you are successful.

Tom is literally the sweetest and funniest professor I've had at OSU so far! He makes class fun and doesn't take it too seriously (in the best way). His teaching style is very effective and class time in AGRCOMM 3130 is spent productively. There's little work, and some days Tom will just decide to give bonus points for showing up to class.

For a public speaking class it was actually enjoyable. He really cares about all of his students and only wants the best for them in and out of class. Gave a little bit of life advice in each class. Even brought in cake for the whole class on Halloween!
Amazing class, even more amazing prof. He truly cares, and that is easy to see in his willingness to make the class as good as possible. LOVE TOM
A fantastic professor who truly cares about his students and gives many opportunities for extra credit and extracurricular fun.
I love Tom Stewart and everything he offers to the classroom, BEST public speaking class. He truly cares about his students and their success.
Caring, kind, and inspiring.  Tom is the best professor i have ever had! Very easy speech class, highly recommended.

Great teacher who always made lectures interesting and fun to attend! Very easy to talk to after class and outside of the classroom.  Really cares about his students- not only while they're in the class but after in life as well.  Recommend anyone to take this speech class.

Super cool guy who made class fun to come too. He joked around with his TAs all the time and they were just as good as Tom. Didn't have to put that much work into the speeches and we only took the final and midterm as a technicality, so he made sure they wouldn't trouble us.

Tom was easily my favorite professor I have ever had. His lectures are fun and he almost never goes the full time. He really wants his students to succeed in all forms of life, not just in public speaking. He really helped my fear of public speaking. He's always trying to give us life advice and he's truly a hilarious man.

Tom's class was by far my favorite that I've ever taken at Ohio State. Tom and his two TAs provided solid, useful information that may have just cured my fear of public speaking and I will use for years to come, but also fun and enjoyable lectures. You can genuinely tell that Tom wants you to succeed and will help you in any way that he can.

Hands down best professor i've ever had! I took 2 classes with him this past semester and they were my two favorite classes. Lectures are super enjoyable and he wants nothing more than to see his students succeed.

Best class I have ever taken at OSU. I would take it again. I recommend this class to anybody looking to take a fun class about public speaking. He made it easy to get over fear and I gained valuable skills I will actually use in life (which is unheard of, right?)

Tom is truly and inspirational dude. He has no skin in the game. He has an AMEX black car and a $70k Jag. (Sorry Tom if it was more, I didn't stick my head in to see the trim package.) He truly shouldn't be bothered teaching any of us, but he does so for love of the game. The perfect teacher to give levity to any questions you have in life.

Tom is a great professor and an even better person. He teaches lessons that can be reflected on throughout life. He is happy to help with career advice and suggestions, and is an incredible contact to have! He is humble and genuine, truly rare characteristics for someone who has experience the success that he has.
I. Love. This. Man. Best class and professor at Ohio State, by far. He will remember you for years after your class. A very good teacher and a great friend!
Tom Stewart is the best prof I have ever had at Ohio State. He teaches you life lessons that you will use throughout your whole life.
Tom is the man, best professor at OSU by FAR!!!!!

Tom is the best professor ever! He calls his students the customers and is willing to help his students whenever they have a question. It was a very interesting class that I looked forward to going to every time we had class. I definitely recommend taking this class with him!

Tom is THE BEST! He cares about every student, and treats everyone like the customer that they are. He teaches very well and makes everything easy to understand. Take this class! You will learn more than just public speaking!
this guy is the man

Tom Stewart is easily one of the best professors at ohio state. He doesn't just teach you about public speaking-he teaches you about life. He treats you as a customer who is shopping for a product and treats himself as a customer service representative. In his mind if you aren't learning something and enjoying yourself then he isn't doing his job.
Awesome class, take it.
easiest class have to go w/ in class quizzes but awesome class
Best class everrrr.  :)
Great class, professor, and TAs.
Tom is the most awesome professor at OSU. He really makes public speaking fun. I really didn't want to take this class but he actually made me like it.
excellent....one of the best at OSU..genuinely cares for helping students succeed

This guy is an awesome teacher, he's very helpful and like for students to actually learn rather than just sit there and stare at him.  The speeches are fun, and you look forward to going to every class.

Had long chapters to read each week. Contained weekly 1 hour+ lectures that was required to watch, chapter-based assignment, & quiz (drops 3 lowest), a multiple-choice mid-term & final with 1-2 short responses. Have to put time aside to teach yourself, flashcards help, lots of EX. Not best at responding, TA's grade everything. Can definitely pass
As long as you do the weekly discussion posts and quizzes, you should do fine. Tests are difficult but I still got an A overall while getting a C on both the midterm and final exams.

She uses honorlock and it would flag me for literally everything, you have to set aside a lot of time on your own to study the material since the tests are comprehensive. The tests are also hard and so is the grading for being a GENED class about communicating. Some extra credit but it does nothing.

Quite difficult for an online introductory course. It is clear that many students do not do well because extra credit is simply handed out. Assignments are set to be posted every week Monday mornings and are not posted on time. Lectures tended to be unnecessarily long and unclear.

I was nervous about this professor before, but after taking this class, I was genuinely content. If you are taking her online Comm 1100, be ready to do discussion posts and watch lecture videos. I would take notes as well and MAKE SURE TO STUDY EFFICIENTLY FOR THIS CLASS. Do not do things last minute.

she's certainly passionate about her craft!! i enjoyed the course content, but imo it says a lot about you as a professor if you and your TA's feel required to give the class 10-14 points back on an exam. "you guys should review your studying and learning habits"... ok.
awful and hard class, boring

If you want a professor who cares more about you cheating than your mental well-being, take this class! Genuinely believe this class is a social experiment because how is it possible to make an introductory course this hard. Dr. Partain if you read these reviews, sorry not sorry.

Dr. Partain seems like a nice person, but makes an intro class so unnecessarily hard. She is more focused on students cheating than students understanding the content. As someone who is passionate about the communication major, this class discouraged me and made it unenjoyable. I appreciate the extra credit she gives, though.

This is the worst professor I have ever had. I am a senior and I would never take a course with her again. This class was mandatory as a communications minor and as a 1100 class I felt like I was taking a 5000 level class (which I have taken and has been much easier). Just be prepared for a lot of busy work. Do not take if you don't need to.

Laura Partain is the only professor I've reviewed here. She is the worst teacher I have ever had. She is focused on hurting students. Way too paranoid about cheating. Her lectures add nothing to the book (not sure if she understands the content) mind you this is 1000 level. I think she also lied about the content of an exam but I do not have proof.
Ruined my life
Bad, very bad. I should have seen her grade before I chose a course. There's no point in having a lot of homework and a lot of grading. Points deducted for no reason.

A weeks work consists of 2 chapters of textbook reading, a comprehension check after the two chapters, an quiz of the 2 chapters, 2 different lecture videos that require you to watch 75% for credit that can be an hour each that has meaningless unorganized talking, and then a written response where you compare the lecture to the readings. AVOID.

I really don't think teaching is the right profession for her. Disorganized, extensive readings that barely relate to the overall theme of the class. Very lazy grader, gives little feedback but gives harsh grades. Spends way too much class time talking about her personal life, not professional at all. Also the most millennial person I've met.
The most terrible professor ever. She never check the content of homework and just provide a grade rapidly. She never provides even one useful feedback.

The class was asynchronous due to her being injured. Weekly work included watching about 1.5-2 hours worth of lectures, smartbooks for two chapters, weekly quiz, and up to two discussion boards. Midterm and final were online and were many points. Extra credit opportunities at the end of the semester. Would be much harder if it was in person.
Took class online because she was injured. Class would be much harder if it was in person like it was supposed to be.

Don't get me wrong Melissa Foster is truly a nice person but in this class you are just another number to the TA graders. There is a required 20 point quiz every week along with a 2 page APA formatted dissucssion post that must have peer reviewed research along with replying to two classmates with additional APA formatted peer reviewed articles.

TAs are incredibly harsh graders. This course requires too much work for an elective. Generally I would stay away from this professor. She is nice and cares about the class, but honestly it is difficult to perform up to TA standards and you are just a number.

If you take this class online its very easy as professor Foster would have a discussion paper and quiz due each week which both were very simple to complete. She would drop the 3 lowest scores on your quiz and discussion paper.

This class wasn't terrible. There were weekly discussions based off of the weekly lectures, which were an hour or less, weekly discussions which were counted as exam grades which is really helpful for people who are bad test takers or overly stress about exams drop 3 lowest. Class was easy if you turn in work, never communicated w/ professor

Class wasn't awful, but she was incredibly cold when dealing with me after I had a death in the family and missed a couple assignments. The discussions are long and require some research but they're useful and helped me learn about how to do academic research. Fine course I guess.

Although the assignments are clear and well put together. Professor Foster was incredibly rude in my emails I sent to her. She does not come across as someone who wants to help you in any way. I would avoid taking any of her classes as she does not offer any leniency even when the issue is outside of your control.

Tough grader with unconvincing evaluations. Refuses to provide explanations for her evaluations and decisions as a professor, and deliberately deducted points to prevent students from achieving high grades. Essays that underwent multiple revisions often received the same scores as those that did not, indicating unclear grading criteria. Avoid.

Very easy class to take online and professor Foster gives simple assignments that require you to watch lectures and use them to complete quiz's and weekly dissections. Loved that there was no finals or any midterms and she also drops the three loswt quiz scores and discussions.

She is a very tough grader as most assignments have had an average of around 70-75 (this is a GE theme course). Her feedback is helpful and clear but don't expect an easy A in the class. The weekly tests are also difficult but the weekly discussions (completion grade) are a great grade booster. She's intelligent and passionate about her work!

She treated her 2000 level as a 5000 level class. I'm an okay writer and typically get As on papers, but for the first few assignments in her class, I got Cs. It was irritating how tough her grades were and how she kept saying it was a "high-level writing course" when a 2000 level GE should not be harder than my 3000 and 4000-level major courses.

Professor is stuck up and extremely difficult to deal with. Class is very liberal oriented in the beginning then levels out to a non partisan view. Assignments lack clarity. Rubric is arbitrary. DO NOT email her at all. Quizzes are free 100%. Discussion posts are mini essays. This class is easy if online and if you are a quality writer.

Context, her late policy is clear, no late work, no exceptions. Sent a quick, "Can I retake a quiz", expecting a no, which is fine.

Her response was that I, "may not be accustomed to the current college environment." Just felt very disrespected, if this is how she responds to all requests that are out of her norm, I wouldn't have taken her class.
Very tough grader and rude. I do not recommend this course or professor.
Rude and hardest grader for a GE course

Dr. Foster is an evil. Avoid her. She grades very roughly. I dropped from A to B+ only after the first week! She usually deducts students' points without any reason. 19% of students (38 of 200) dropped Communication 2850 after the first week.
Run! She is a very strict grader. If you do not want a GE course to hurt your GPA, run!

The class is fine overall with easy-to-understand lectures and quizzes that directly come from the lecture videos. There is a two-page discussion post due every week which is a lot for the topics that are assigned for each week. If you do not have a lot of free writing time, I do not recommend taking the course during a busy semester.
evil

Course was easy overall and I ended with an A w/o having to put in too much work. Weekly quizzes are easy if you just skim lecture videos. You have a two pages/ 4 minute video discussion due every two weeks does not take long to complete but she grades them unnecessarily tough. Even if you follow the rubric she'll find places to take off points.
Really nice person, cares about her students. She is a really tough grader, but if you do the work it's really not too much. Easy GE, nice lady.

This class was pretty straightforward. It included a weekly quiz, weekly lecture videos, and a 2 page discussion post every 2 weeks. It is a pretty easy class if you do your work, but I noticed the lectures did seem to get a little political.

The discussion posts were graded very hard, without a lot of feedback. I took the asynchronous class, which involved weekly quizzes and about an hour and a half of online lectures each week. She is very open about her political views, which was odd considering the class is supposed to teach us how to be objective when evaluating sources.

For an online asynchronous class, it was more work than my other classes. Quizzes every week which were okay and then writing assignments due every week and the essays are super toughly graded. I didn't really feel like I learned anything and the class was strangely political

Dr. Foster is a great professor, if you do what you are supposed to do. Most of her courses require a decent amount of writing. However, they are not painfully difficult. Watch the lectures and you will do fine. She answers emails fast and is happy to respond to any questions you may have.
Somehow found a way to incorporate her hatred for Donald Trump into almost every week's lectures and really pushed her liberal views for a class that shouldn't even be political.
Overall watch the lecture videos and you will get an A there is also is also 40 points of extra credit
For a Gen Ed course that was online this class was a lot of work. There are three long lecture videos, a quiz, and a video discussion board due each week, with midterm tests every three weeks.

I hated is how disconnected the professor was. There were weird grading criteria that the TA used to grade my stuff that was not mentioned in the guidelines. She ignored me when I reached out for help. She could not just quickly say, "yes, the TA made a mistake, you're right". TA was unresponsive and continued grading weirdly. Never again.

Lectures were easy to follow with lots of great examples. Her assignments were pretty straight forward; you write an essay (2 pages long), comment on two people's, and take a quiz every week. She even drops your lowest three essay and quiz grades (6 total). As long as you make time to watch her lectures and write these essays, you'll do just fine.

I dont want to say this to be mean but please dont schedule with this professor. Every week there is a quiz which isn't the bad things its the 3 lectures she puts into one and then on the quizzes it was 5 questions and for 25 point so it was very hard to study. Her lectures are very hard to understand the way she talks and all exams are cumulative
Professor undeniably pushes a leftist agenda, while completely bashing the right. This class is was more political than it needs to be.
Just stay away from this professor. Does not care about students AT ALL. She grades your papers as if your are supposed to be some super star writer right off the bat

There were weekly papers in this class. However, they were relatively short and I found that I was able to complete them in an hour or two. Weekly opportunities for extra credit, as well as a longer paper that could be done for a lot of extra credit as well. No exams.

She's a very sweet professor, however LOTS of papers with the lowest three getting dropped. Interesting class but would not recommend to someone who struggles writing papers, her prompts are sometimes also very broad but overall a good class.

Assignments are pretty easy as long as you stay on top of them. Lectures are relatively short, but sometimes weren't even necessary to watch as most, not all, information was laid out in lecture slides. Weekly opportunities for extra credit. Very nice as long as you are polite/respectful.

Melissa Foster is one of the best professors I have ever had. Her lectures are easy to follow because she actually cares about the information she is sharing. There are several two-page papers that you have to write throughout the course, but she does this in place of exams. She also drops your 3 lowest essay and quiz scores.

I am honestly very surprised to see so many bad reviews. She cares so much about the class and makes attempts to connect with each student. She is very passionate and knowledgeable on what she teaches, and is genuinely one of the best professors I've had. She is very flexible and makes class fun but starting and ending each with an easy activity.

The homework assigned by this professor is often irregular, with due appearing suddenly. There is no possibility for her homework to be postponed, and the grading standard is very strange. I feel that the grading is also unfair. She doesn't want students to get high marks. I think she's the most difficult professor I've ever had.

I took this course entirely online and it honestly wasn't that bad. The weekly lectures and quizzes can be a pain, but you can tackle them at your own pace. There's also a weekly paper, but they're one page max, so you can pound one out in an hour tops. Professor Foster is witty and tries her best to make her lectures interesting.
Really sweet professor who actually cares about her students.

I took this class for my major and I really enjoyed it. She gives you lots of forgiveness and the assignments are relevant to the content. She is also very personable which can be tough through a screen.

LOVED taking this online course. No textbook or exams, just watching about 30 minutes of lecture per week, a weekly quiz, and a weekly one-page essay. I needed to take this class as a prereq, and Foster makes the material enjoyable, fun, and easy to work with. She's also fun and cool. STRONGLY recommend... seriously a very very VERY easy A.

Mediocre at best. She sometimes gives clear grading criteria, other times she doesn't and your grade will most likely suffer because of it. Her lectures are pretty dull, quizzes and tests are fairly straightforward. Doesn't really care about the students, just kind of goes through the motions because she has to it feels like. Fairly disappointed.

Dr. Foster released all of the modules for the entire semester from week 1, so you could work ahead at your own pace! The course was pretty interesting and extremely organized. There were no exams, just weekly exam essays that were only one page long. Very well run for an online course.

Melissa Foster is one of the most average professors I have had. She does her best at making the lectures relevant to the current times and tries her best to be funny. That being said, her "lectures" consisted of her reading PowerPoint slides and there are no tests in this class, instead "Exam Questions" as she calls them. Not a terrible professor.
Professor Foster gives great lectures, and. can sometimes be funny. However, she is a very hard grader. You could meet all the. requirements on an assignment and still get a lot of points off.

Dr. Foster is an incredible professor. I have taken her for 2 classes at this point. Her lectures are very understandable and her Canadian-ish accent is fun. Her grading is firm but she always provides plenty of feedback prior and after assignments to make sure you are doing the assignment correctly. She is very available and offers extra credit.
Do not take this class. Assignments are due at noon and she grades very harshly. She assigns a crazy amount of reading and lecture videos that take so much time.

Had a near perfect GPA, this 2000 level class destroyed that for me. The worst part, she gives zero feedback and claims she is “passionate about her students achieving”. It's all an act, nothing more than a con.
Don't take this class whatever you do.
I made an account to give her a 1/5 so that should tell you how she is

She was fine. Her lectures were interesting and the homework was like any other asynchronous class. My main issue was that you actually have to read the textbook for exams. The textbook is like A LOT too.

Never take it. Discussion can be deducted ( responses not deep). Each of the three exams can determine a big grade (four points can drop you from an A to B). Essays are heavily scrutinized, and a number of students I know, have been turned in to COAM.

She is absolutely awful, never take a class with her. The tests are extremely hard, no matter how you prepare and study you most likely will not do good. So so so many movies/films to watch and she is a hard grader. Gave us homework and quizzes over Thanksgiving break. Never ever take a class with her.

The lectures and online content do not prepare you for the exams. She grades unnecessarily harshly and does not provide much study help on the exams. I am a straight-A student and I studied for probably 2 hours and got B's on all of my exams which is ridiculous for an intro to communications class. This class was just unnecessarily difficult

Very kind, accessible, and helpful professor. However, the class is awful for a GE. The papers were graded roughly by TA's with no feedback to improve. You can't view exam answers/what you got wrong even after your grade gets put in so I had no idea what to work on for the future. Lecture slides aren't posted. I pulled an A only by doing extra crdt

I actually enjoyed the course lectures Dr. Grady put together, you could tell her passion for the content. Tough grading with the 2 papers assigned but all expectations were laid out at the beginning of the semester. Overall it is a tough course, fun content and read the textbook front to back.

They make you write long and stupid papers, grade them toughly, and don't even give specific feedback on them. The worst thing I had to do was write a 3-4 page self-reflection that was only worth 10 points. The lecture videos are so long even though this content can be explained in half that time. Such a meaningless class.

Don't take this class if you want an easy A, or an easy GE theme. This class is asynch, but that didn't make it easier at all. There's two bigger written assignments that were graded harshly, and took forever to grade. Discussion posts are weekly and are not that bad. And, Exams had pretty low averages for a Comm class. Not an easy course!

I cannot say this enough, please DON'T take this class. The content itself is easy but she makes this class hard for no reason. Lecture videos are excessively long, harsh grader that gives no comments, tells you that your paper lacks detail even though it's at or exceeding the page limit, and assign stupid 10pt self-reflections that are 3-4 pages.

Definitely do not take this class with Dr. Grady if you can avoid it. She is an incredibly harsh grader whose feedback on why she took off points is incredibly vague and always just tells you to "add more detail" even though the papers are already at or exceeding the page requirement. Getting grades back takes months.

I would not recommend taking this class. She'll take off several points for no particular reason/vague reasoning. If you ask for more detailed feedback, Dr. Grady will just tell you to go to office hours. You'll basically never know what's expected of you. There are multiple busy work assignments that are graded too harshly. Exams are also rough.

Worst professor I have met. Don't take her class. It takes almost a month for papers and exams to be graded. She gives NO feedback except keep saying like "write more details and examples". She requires us to discuss more in office hour instead of giving feedback by email or Carmen. It's ridiculous because it causes lot of inconvenience.

Sara was the worst professor I've ever had. I learned nothing in this class. The exams sound easy because they are open book, but the book and the lectures contradict themselves. It would take a month for papers to be graded and 3 weeks for the online, multiple-choice exams. Gave no feedback on papers and emailing her accomplished nothing.

Chip is a cool dude, but his class is BORING. The class is mostly a discussion on readings and you must participate. There is no final which is nice but there is a quiz due before every class, and it's heavily based on the readings. And you only get 5 minutes on the quiz. Don't be surprised if you end up falling asleep during his lectures.

Chip is really kind, but he cares more about content then students. There is a quiz before every class and the Assignments take forever. If you are just taking this class to get an easy A, its not. you will work for it. The class was very thought provoking though.

Chip is a great professor, he makes the classroom a conversation more than just a lecture hall. The material he covers is great and really has you think about the world of media and communication. I learned a lot from him. Tests and assignments are a little hard but if you put in the time you will do well.

Chip is simply one of the best professors I had at OSU but his class is not for everyone. There is a lot of reading and technology use is frowned upon. But if you are interested in communication or politics, this is a must-take. A course that will truly change your worldview if you put in the effort. Don't skip class (random attendance sign-ups).

Had Chip for Political Comm, never had him for a pre-req course. I loved his class though. Interesting, intense material. People think he's tough, but guess what: he treats his students like adults and wants to make class a discussion, not a lecture. Considerable reading and discussion to expect, but absolutely a get out what you put in course.

Do not take his classes. The class material could be incredibly easy to understand, and he tries to make it sound more complicated to suit his ego.  His tests are unnecessarily difficult and I feel like he does it on purpose. He doesn't get enough love from his department so he takes it out on the students. Stay away from him.

"Chip" may be the worst professor at Ohio State. He is so condescending and full of himself and made the class harder and more boring than it ever needed to be. I looked up his rating before I took the class and he seemed okay but trust me he is not. I hated every second I spent in this class and was beyond glad to see the last of him.
He is funny!

"Chip" is resentful his research can't earn grants and takes it out on students by taking a entry level class full of athletes and people who are just trying to get into the major way to seriously. He makes things unnecessarily difficult and believes he is the "cool" teacher but is unhelpful and screws students over on exams and quizzes. Avoid him!

Chip is great. He really understands theory, but his has a background political communications and often uses political examples for class. This could be helpful in a class with 600 students because everyone has a basic knowledge on political issues. He DOES NOT post lectures note online, so read the textbook & going to office hours &/or see a TA.

Chip is a really nice guy and knows how to explain the material and give good examples. He doesn't give out extra credit and there are only 3 exams, 10 quizzes and 5 CREP experiment points but the material is common sense and easy to grasp. He also gives you a chance to take everything a second time and get the average of your scores.
he took this class waaaay too seriously for a 100 level Comm class.  offers no extra credit and averages your exams and quizzes instead of taking your better score

there is NO opportunity for extra credit and the exam questions can be a little tricky. Make sure you read the questions in entirety. Chip is a good guy but You must come to class to get notes because he wont give them out for any reason. Make a friend in his class so you can give notes to each other. You have to have the book to pass quizzes.
Relatively easy. Need to attend class for notes. Need textbook for quizzes. Exams are somewhat harder than they need to be, but not impossible.

The questions on the exams are right from the power point notes. If you go to class or get the notes from someone it's an easy class. You also are allowed to take exams twice and average the scores. Overall he made the class interesting and I would take him again.

"Chip" is pessimistic and not helpful when it comes to students individually. Lecture notes are ridiculous (grammar, length) and he doesn't have the ability to clarify. He puts most of his work on his TA's and will ramble during lecture- hard to focus. The class is too large for him to care.CERTAINLY made this course more difficult than needed

He was a nice guy who explained the concepts really well and made the subject interesting.  His exams were straight forward from the material and were not trying to trick or mislead, just test your knowledge

At first the class seems difficult but after the first text it's very predictable. The quizzes and exams are straight out of the textbook and notes. Make sure you go to class because he doesn't post his notes. Overall the class really isn't too bad.

He's really funny and makes lectures pretty interesting and fun which made me look forward to going to class. Very interactive with the students during class and clarifies the material better than the textbook does. The book is necessary for both the exams and online quizzes.

He makes class pretty interesting. You don't need to attend because basically the same stuff is in the text book, but he makes it so easy to understand. He's very organized so taking notes is easy. Tests are simple as long as you reread notes and text.

Great teacher. Explains things very clearly and makes the material easy to understand. Shows lots of video clips for examples. Need to attend lecture for notes, and need to read book for easy 5 question quizzes. Tests are not too bad as long as you study your notes and pay somewhat attention in class. Overall pretty easy and enjoyable class.

While he doesn't force you to attended class in order to get credit or anything, you really ought to go to get a good grade. Even though I am a Comm major, I was not looking forward to this class, but Chip really made it interesting and enjoyable. Great professor. Study your notes and the tests will not be difficult.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Does a great job relating course material to the life of a college student. Funny. Exams are super strict but overall pretty easy. If you go to lecture the class is actually pretty  interesting.

Chip is a great guy! BUT he makes things much more difficult than they need to be! His exams are pretty difficult for a 100 level class. If you have the chance, take the same class with a different professor! He NEVER puts his lectures online. Class is Mandatory if you want an A on his 33 question exams worth 100 points.

Relatively difficult exams but quizzes are very simple. Class can be boring, however, he tries to incorporate as many real life examples as possible. This definitely increases the level of entertainment, as well as helping clarify concepts.
One of my best profs. I really enjoy lectures because they are always interesting, relative, and include brief moments of comedy
Very entertaining lecture but it is intro to Comm Theory so be prepared to think. Extra credit opportunities. Very nice guy.
Very straightforward on what he will test you on. Have to go to class since everything he tests you on lecture material. Very Easy

Chip's one of the best pure lecturers I've had at OSU. Class discussion just sort of happens on its own, as opposed to being forced. His exams aren't hard, but can be tricky if you don't take solid notes.
Not a hard class.  He keeps the class interesting and uses the  book a great deal

He's a really nice guy, but his tests are really hard. Be prepared for a lot of studying and memorization. Go to ALL the classes, read the textbook, and empty your brain before the class starts because it is a TON of information.
he is very humor and his class is very clear, easy to understand, take notes, and review them after class, you will get an A
Likes to keep class humorous

In the first two weeks, I was so confused, but after taking the course and because he used real world examples, surprisingly, I ended up liking it a lot. You can apply this class to your life and he is a down to earth professor!
Oh Chip. Chip has a great personality, but the class has a lot of outside readings and work and I found the exams fairly hard considering it was only a 200 level class

You figured if you went to class and kept up you would do well however for the exams you just have to guess from all the material what questions are going to be on it. There are no study guides which sucks. He's a nice guy but his class is a little confusing just because there is no structure, also the lecture are uber boring
nice enough guy, but this class is painful to get through.  most boring lectures every.
I felt like I was being tricked with this class. I went everyday and took every note, and still failed. I felt confused all the time. Definately not my favorite class.

Chip was definitely not one of my favorites. If you looked at a layout of what you were going to learn beforehand and compared it to how he covered it in class, you'd have no idea they were the same. Takes himself way too seriously, and his lectures are less interesting than watching paint dry. Still got a B+ though.

Chip was a great public speaker. He delivers his messages thoroughly and clearly. You should go to class as there are pop quizzes. Also, tests can be difficult, but most of the tests are straight from the textbook so I would read that!

I loved chip. He is a very good lecturer and is very helpful with any questions you may have. You must go to every lecture and take very good notes. His quizzes are a joke, his tests aren't too bad if you study hard for them, and he gives 3 extra credit percentage points. Work hard and you will do fine.
Makes up for the simplicity of the content by using ridiculously tricky and technical wording on the quizzes and tests. Take detailed notes in lecture and of the readings.
Great teacher, excellent layout, funny and laid-back but knows when to be serious... if you want the A in this class, you will have to work for it, but you can do it!

Overall pretty good teacher. His exams are 45% of your grade so you better study up. The exams seem to be pretty tough also for the fact he words them very technically. But overall not the worst class in the world.

Good teacher... he was easy to understand... the class is basically a 2 hour lecture so its hard to keep it interesting but he did a decent job... pop quizzes at the end of some lectures so stick around... copy down the notes from the powerpoints and study them and you will do fine
Very full of himself. Not very helpful.
good professor. Not incredibly easy but teaches well and gets you prepared for his tests.

Chip is a great professor. His class isn't mandatory, but I would suggest you go to it, for quiz purposes as well as his explanation of the material. He is very clear about what hes talking about. He gives quizzes at the end of the class period, so if you go to class DONT LEAVE EARLY! the tests are pretty tricky, but not impossible.

This class was one of my least favorites ever. The material is dry, the professor has a very "I am professor, you are student" type attitude. Don't expect ANYTHING less than to sit and listen for an entire lecture. Final review is five pages long...This teacher isn't the worst but be prepared to teach yourself the material.

Not a very good professor, but lecture was extremely boring, but you had to go because notes were not posted online.  Made the class a lot harder than it had to be, and pretty much set everyone up to fail.  There was a big curve on the exams and the opportunity for extra credit, which was 100% necessary to pass the class.

Chip is a great professor and really knows what he is talking about but his tests are extraordinarily difficult. It's a 200 level class and should not have been this hard. There is up to 3% extra credit and two pop quizzes. Go to class and read the book. Hard work but there is a nice curve.

Chip is a really nice guy and seems genuinely interested in teaching but his tests are far too hard. There is opportunity for extra credit and the class is somewhat interesting but way harder than it needs to be. Take the class, read the book, and pay attention in class (most important)!
Lectures are pretty interesting.  Lots of theories to learn.  Exams are pretty difficult but he curves the grades a little.  Pretty good professor, I just didn't enjoy the class that much.
Lectures are extremely boring, most people feel asleep during it.  Does not post notes online, so you have to go to class. Don't really have to read the book but it would be helpful.
Lots of note taking and two pop quizzes..
Makes a seemingly boring topic interseting.  Very good speaker/ teacher.  Is genuinely interested in what he is teaching--great experience overall!

The class was interesting and engaging.  It often opened with a discussion about a particular study that would then segway into the lecture.  Prof. Eveland is a perfect instructor for the course because this is what his research is focused on.  He also gave a couple students the opportunity to help him and his TA with research which was rewarding.

This class isn't a cake walk, but it is doable if you're willing to put in the time and effort. The required class projects were a bit ridiculous; my group's paper was 31 pages. He is a nice guy though, very fair.
extremely interesting. Conversant and knows the material inside out. Great communicator - almost Ronald Reagan :).

Interesting class, although "CHIP" is so stuck on himself that his lectures consist mostly of his own outside research and journal articles that have nothing to do with the material covered in class.He arrived late to class and often left early.Definately not what I expected from someone of his caliber.
He explains concepts very well and very clear. Goes over numerous examples to ensure clarity. The class was not bad at all.
basically a stats class where the computer does the work for you.  not too hard, i never went and did well.  just make sure you go to recitation
No Comments
interesting, easy

Persuasive Communication is based around a book written by an OSU professor, and that book kinda sucks. Its like a less clear version of my AP Psychology book. I was able to get 100% on all but 1 paper by writing them in just one day and putting through grammarly. Prof Annen was great about responding to emails but doesnt really do announcements
Easy A, but overall didn't learn a thing. Nice professor. Take this class for an easy pass!

I think that Kaylea definitely cared about the success of students in the class but I don't feel like I took away anything from this class. I was forced to focus more on very specific rubric criteria rather than focusing on becoming a better speaker. I might have misread the course description but I wish I would have taken a different course.

Doesn't understand that I have more things to do than the things in her class. Gave a test over 11 chapters with only 25 questions. Textbook also seems extremely useless for a public speaking course. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!
Class materials not organized. She is a tough grader. Not very caring.
Do never take her course.
hard time
BAD EXPERIENCE
grades hard
too much homework.
I will never take her class again. I gain my first C in my life in her class.

It is a GE course. I think she grade so hard on GE course and she rejected to reply to our questions before the due date. From my perspective, GE is more about expanding my knowledge. And the purpose of assginment is helping us understand the textbook better. Therefore, there is no reason to reject to answer questions before the due date.
She assigns a lot of homework. There should be a TA for her course

Her goal, as stated at the beginning, was not to make us perfect speakers, but to make us better and more comfortable at speaking. I think she did that very well! I was literally never within the time limits, but still got a good grade.

Good and nice Teacher. Just make sure to read the textbook since some of the material on the exam will not be taught in class, and stay on top of material since there are pop quizzes. Also on the 2 papers and final presentation make sure to follow the rubric. Not the easiest class, but if you put in the work you will do fine.

Very friendly and outgoing, but relies too heavily on an unnecessary textbook. Midterm questions pulled straight from it, so required reading to pass. Midterms also overly difficult for a basic public speaking class. Allows students to give speeches on their own interests and offers great feedback. Tough attendance policy.

Kaylea is awesome! She is very nice, funny and knowledgeable. The lectures are relatively short, and interesting. She relates everything to real life which is nice. She definitely cares about your participation in lectures and wants everyone to understand material. The exams are hard, but if you read the textbook you will be fine.
Don't take it if its for an easy A. She grades way to hard.

I took this class as a pilot where the tests were online. If you take this class make sure you take the one where the tests are in class, friends said it was SO EASY.
