One of the best professors I've had at OSU. Holt really cares about teaching and keeps lectures interesting with his great sense of humor and seriousness when need be. Best professor I've ever had at any university. This professor genuinely wants his students to LEARN rather than just memorize concepts and play a system. BEST prof. EVER. Dr. Holt prepares you for the real world. Youll learn more from this class than any other. The course consists of 3 exams & a press conference. He prepares you well for both. THE best/most interesting professor at OSU by far. The only class I have ever had where I paid attention every second. Highly recommend!

He wants us to succeed, which is why he pushes us, and honestly, I haven't ever had a professor that cared that much. Loved his class and would definitely recommend taking his classes

He is by far one of the best professor's I have ever had. He is experienced and insightful. He's funny, inspirational, and pushes students to be the best they can be. He calls us future professionals, and treats us as such, not like children. You have to work for the grade,  but that's not what matters. Take a class with him, he won't dissapoint.

I took this class because it is in the Legal Foundations of Society minor, and because there is no textbook.  The experience I got was something I never would have expected. An awesome teacher truly dedicated to his craft and even moreso to his students.  My favorite teacher I had this semeseter.  Easy assignments no exams, mostly group projects.

SEI.Subject: COMM
SEI.Class Name: Violence in Society and Violence in the Media

SEI.Subject: COMM
SEI.Class Name: Violence in Society and Violence in the Media

Ratings.comment:
Professor Kevin
Gives extra credit if you
Write him a haiku
Kevin was my professor during the pandemic. Best thing to happen to me during the crisis.
Kevin was the worst. 0/10
Professor Kev is Awesome ! Took us out on a field trip to the beach in Florida and had class in the ocean.

Prof Kev was very chill. Had some heartbreak during the semester so he lowkey got jacked and stopped caring about our attendance which was awesome. Taught us a lot about life though. One of those kinda men that you want standing beside you on your wedding day.

If there was ever a professor that treated students like family, it was Kevin. He brought fresh Brooklyn bagels to every Monday class. It's refreshing that someone cared about our learning. I hope Ohio State hires more instructors like him--they should have him teach a professional development class to the other teachers. Quizzes are hella hard.
Dr. Kev is one of my favorite professors at OSU. Hes super helpful in office hours and really cares about his students success. A really inspiring guy.
Kev is super awesome! Love this guy
My guy Kev is as good as it gets. He is so kind to all of his students and just loves to get to know each one personally and goes out of his way to be helpful. Take this guy if youre able!!

I'm really enjoying Dr. Liu's social media course, she's a great professor. The lectures and readings are interesting, and the assignments are all very reasonable. Uses Honorlock but allows open book, and gives some extra credit too. Would take her again! :)
Lectures were very engaging and interesting. Got off topic occasionally but it was always pretty funny so I'm not complaining.
He truly cares about his students and I would recommend him. you do have to try in the class to get a A

Dr. Grizzard is one of my favorite professors I've had at Ohio State. He truly tries to make lecture as fun as possible with really cool example videos and he's super funny. He makes everything easy to understand by giving real life examples or drawing on a whiteboard. Would definitely take another class with him.

Dr. Grizzard is a great lecturer! The class is long and can drag on at times, but he tries to keep you engaged, and he's genuinely passionate about the material. There aren't many assignments, and you can use your notes on just about anything. You're graded for attendance, but you have a number of excused absences. The textbook feels optional.
I took stats with Dr. Grizzard and he really helped us understand the reason behind the tests we do. He was very aware of the needs of the class and helped us all to succeed. Great class!

Great professor and great class! I was a bit nervous prior to the semester because of his rating here and I wasn't particularly interested in the subject, but he truly was kind, knowledgeable, and cared about his students. The first exam is the toughest and he will tell you that, but it gets WAY easier after so stick with it!

I'm not sure why people are dogging on Grizzard so much but I think he's pretty good. I've had him in the past and I like him more now than I did before. His online class is straight to the point - just do the work and you'll get an A. His quizzes and exams really aren't that difficult and they're open note. Content is easy to follow too.
Professor Grizzard's lectures are great, he explains things very well and the quizzes are easy as long as you actually pay attention to the lectures.

Avoid this professor. I took this class for fun & it was exactly the opposite. The material isn't exactly difficult, but he makes getting a decent grade hard. Multiple times, he forgot to upload course work to Carmen. When all students failed the assignment due to his carelessness, he did nothing to remedy it. He refused to drop the assignment.

Worst prof I have had in my 3.5 years at OSU... More than 1/3 of the class failed the first midterm, decided adding a 2 point curve would make us feel better. He also never posted on the syllabus or on carmen when the final exam was going to be until THREE DAYS BEFORE IT OPENED. Avoid this prof at all costs unless your looking to fail.

The professor is an incredibly boring lecturer. I watch lectures and take notes every week and still managed to get a D on the exam. After adding a curve, over 50% of the class still had a D or lower, he had the audacity to say the exam was "doable." If you are looking for an interesting elective, don't take this course. 60% of exam q's were math.
Do yourself a favor and do NOT pick this professor. Take that advice or leave it, but I'm warning y'all now!

THIS IS HONESTLY THE WORST CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN. ONE THIRD OF THE CLASS FAILED THE FIRST EXAM AND HIS SOLUTION WAS TO ADD JUST A TWO POINT CURVE ONLY AFTER EVERYONE COMPLAINED. MOREOVER, HE DIDN'T ENTER THE CORRECT WEIGHT OF THE EXAM UNTIL A WEEK AFTER EVERYONE TOOK IT! SO EVERYONES GRADE DROPPED DOWN EVEN FURTHER BECAUSE OF HIS INCOMPETENCE
He is not a reasonable professor at all. Switches up his grading as he pleases and the tests are far too hard for the material learned in class. Good luck.

Hes really funny, but can be unclear about what is important for tests. He seems to care how his students perform, and is really nice. I wish he would give more detailed review sheets, though. The lectures can be kind of boring, but I can tell he tries to spice it up with humor and interesting videos.
very nice...

Ashley is an awesome professor. She communicates the material very clearly and makes its easily understandable. As long as you show up to class and participate and pay attention, you should do well in her classes.

Ashley is a great professor and very caring. The class is very straight forward which is great since it is online. Be prepared to give speeches and get comfortable infront of the camera. She is very accommodating to student needs and very helpful through email. I would definitely take her again!

This was a very fun and interesting class, but the professor made it that way. I feel like had I taken it with another professor, it wouldn't have been as interesting. Overall very easy and she would pull up a lot of Youtube clips to help illustrate the point she was trying to make, which is always very helpful.

Super friendly. If you show up, you will pass. Some of the theories are confusing but she comes up with great examples to help explain them more. She also starts out each class with an open ended question, which I found really unique.
Super nice and super easy assignments if you pay attention

Ashley is the best prof I've had at OSU. Took her comm class and took another one of her classes just to have her again. Exams aren't hard. A few easy papers, grades really easily. Super nice, makes class fun.

Took her public speaking, so of course participation matters most of all. Gives you freedom by allowing you to pick the speech topic. The only thing that makes her class difficult is the speaking in front of people, but you get used to it. Make friends with classmates, its easier to speak in front of them that way!

Took as an 8-week summer session. Provided note-taking guides for most chapter readings. Lectures were few, pre-recorded by another instructor. Grading was slow, communication wasn't fantastic. However, grading wasn't harsh. Do the work on time and you'll be fine.

I never heard anything from this professor all semester. She must have had the TA's do all of the work. I know nothing about her. Also was less than a point from an A in the class, but she didn't round up.

Easy, interesting class. The modules are straight forward and interesting for the most part.  The exams are proctored and difficult compared to the weekly content. If you try you will get a good grade.

Since this was an online class, I didn't interact with the professor much. The class was well organized and she would respond to emails in a timely manner. There was a bit of reading to do for this class. The exams were proctored so be sure to focus on the lectures and do the required reading to grasp the material.

Since this was an online class, I didn't really interact with Professor Moyer-Guse. The class is pretty straight-forward: weekly discussion boards, reflections, and content quizzes, and 2 exams. Do the work and you should end up with a good grade.

COMM 3444 was a very well organized class and professor Moyer-Guse was fair in grading and listened to students. Wish the lecture slides covered more ground, but the tests aren't hard. All in all Moyer-Guse is a good professor.
Very hard to get an A in. Only graded on weekly quizzes and tests. You must read the textbook because her exams have a "reading studyguide" that are speciifc to texual content.

By the mixed reviews, she must teach better in person than online. She seemed personable but slow to grade and respond. One assignment each week & two exams didn't give any opportunity for recover if you struggle on either of the exams & it will affect your entire grade. Exams were hard. First class in almost four years that I didn't earn an A.

I was nervous to take her class because of the strict "no technology" policy others spoke on. But she was SUPER laid back, super kind and really great. She let us use our computers for notes and had a really fun atmosphere. Overall, really easy class. She gives detailed lecture notes and good feedback.
Pop quizzes. Heavy lectures. Very boring. Extremely slow grader. You won't get grades back for over a month. Would not take her again

I showed up late for my final in her class.  First time I've ever done that.  I walked up to her with about 90% of the class already gone, and she said "I don't care about why you're late, just relax and take your test."  I'll never forget that.  She could have said no due to anti-cheating measures and sent me away.  But she didn't.  Respect.

She doesn't allow cell phonestabletslaptops in class. This class was easy just make sure you come to class because the materials in class are the ones that comes out in the exams. Would def take her again.

Very strict no technology policy in a 200 person class. She kicked someone out of class yesterday for using their phone. Easy class, weird grader. She takes off points at random, it seems. I won't take another class with her.
Lectures were suuuuuuuper long and pretty dry.  But, as long as you receive your class participation points and study, you'll be well off.

Even though she posts slides online, half of the lectures aren't even on the exams. The class is extremely easy, though, so it's not hard to get a good grade. You don't need a textbook since all the readings you need are online. As a person she's very friendly, but it would have been nice to relate class readings to the lectures more.

I have taken classes with her two semesters in a wo, and I can honestly say she is one of the best comm professors to take a class with. She takes questions in class, will explain things to you and will be flexible with you. I really like taking classes with her.

She was so great! The class was super interesting and relevant if you are at all interested in media and/or kids. The powerpoints and notes she provides are directly correlated to the exams which are easy if you study for them using the slides and readings. She is one of the nicest professors I have ever had! Take the class!

She makes the notes very clear in class, gives lots of examples that makes things a lot more understandable. There were 3 exams, but as long as you study your notes and the book outline she gives you (you don't have to read the book other than going over whats on the study guide), and go to class, you'll be fine.
She is a great teacher! The subject material is boring but she delivers it well. If you go to class and read the chapters you will do great in her class! I would love to be in her class again!

Best professor I have ever had!!!  I had her for two classes in one quarter and she made life simple!!! Tests are easy just as long as you go to class!  Very helpful; lectures can be boring but she teaches the material very very well! Take her!

People really need to give her a break.  She is actually really nice, and as long as you study and go to class getting an A shouldn't be that hard! Yes, it is boring but so are half the other classes I take.

Managed to make the simplest concepts (survey methodology) hard. Ignored all emails during the quarter & passes everything off to TA's. Its obvious she doesnt know what she is doing b/c her long-winded examples made no sense to the few who listened. I lost brain cells bc of her..She made me want to switch majors & stab myself in the eye all @ once
Terrible teacher. Extremely, Extremely boring and she sucks. Failed many graduating seniors. Do not take this class with this teacher
don't take this class with her as your professor.  She makes no sense, just reads from slides then tests your on material that had nothing to do with lecture and makes grading impossible.
If I ever become a professor and have to design a class, Professor Bonus is who I aspire to be.

My absolute favorite professor. I've taken two of his courses and LOVED both of them. If you have the opportunity to take any of his courses DO IT. He really makes you interested in what you're learning and offers endless support and ways to communicate with him. Seriously, I cannot express how much of a great professor his is.

Professor Bonus is one of the best professors I have ever had. He is caring and truly care about his students. He made sure to always live meaningful feedback in every assignment. His lectures were clean and straight to the point and his homework was 100% helpful.

This was a pretty good professor to have online! Very clear with assignment due dates, making participation very consistent. Sometimes the class material was repetitive, but everything was easy to understand for the most part. Professor Bonus makes it very clear that he is open for any questions to clear up any confusion. Pretty good!

By far one of my favorite professors. He is funny, easygoing, & informative. Even though class isn't mandatory, you will want to go. Each class is a long lecture, but it is actually enjoyable & he always gives you a 10 minute break. You get graded on very few things, so you do not want to flunk anything. I hope to have him as a professor again!

James (Alex) is my favorite professor and I would definitely love to have him again. He genuinely cares about his students and wants you to do well. He doesn't make tests or homework unnecessarily hard. He is willing to help as much as possible to get you an A. Still have to study for exams a bit but they aren't difficult, uses quiz questions.

Take Alex if you can. He cares about his students and wants them to do well. He makes the class discussions interesting and is a really nice and funny person. He's also gorgeous. If you put a decent amount of effort in there's no reason you shouldn't get an A.

Alex really cares about what he is teaching and will help you if you need it. He is a great person and wants you to do well. There are no tricks, just go to lecture do the homeworks and you will get an A as well as a lot of useful information on researching in communications. Take Alex if you can.

Professor Wade was awesome. The textbook for the class was online and free to use through canvas. As long as you do the discussion posts and quizzes you'll be fine, the quizzes are also open note. Two exams and two papers, both easy. Just do the assigned readings and you'll pass.
Professor Wade is a great! She is knowledgeable and helpful in the subject material and is a very clear lecturer and made class easy to navigate through.

Took this class online as an elective (Critzg Tv ARTEDUC 2700 24).Professor makes essay's unnecessary difficult. I spent  more time on assignment, essay papers and discussion questions then I did combined for 3 of my other classes. If you work and expect to get your assignments/essay complete in a reasonable time DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!

The class is easy enough, but I feel this professor added unnecessary steps and difficulties to a relatively unimportant class. Also beware she's incredibly strict on deadlines and doesn't have a lot of compassion for students who may be struggling outside of class barring extreme circumstances with proof, something I didn't appreciate.
Never fixes or critiques your papers for you to improve on the next one. Has a ton of homework and mandatory lecture. AVOID AVOID AVOID.

Dr. Wang is so caring. She makes me want to cry in every class because of her sweet nature. She brought us cookies, bagels, coffee, and candy on Valentine's Day. She cares about what she is teaching, but it can be boring. Pick a good group for the project or you will hate the class. Pretty easy grader and exams I do not anticipate to be very hard.
She sincerely cares about students' learning and growth. The class is well organized. I've learned so much through her classes and the hands-on project. Exactly what I need for my current internship.

Joyce is such a nice woman. Literally one of the nicest professors I've had at OSU. She's inspiring and accepting and really wants her students to succeed. She gives TONS of extra credit opportunities. The class itself is boring and not fun, but she's super understanding and sweet. She's also very knowledgeable!
Brilliant and inspiring. I changed my career goals because of her classes!

She's very nice and gives a lot of time for students to work in class. She cares about her student's opinions and wants to help. I found her difficult to understand but she tries very hard to keep lecture interesting for us.

I'm taking two courses with her right now. Really enjoy her style. She is very clear about her expectations and truly cares about the intellectual and career growth of her students. I'm getting a lot out of the classes.
Excellent professor! After taking this class, I have learned so much and hope to intern or work for a media research company. She goes above and beyond for her students! THANK YOU, Dr. Wang!

She is one of the most involved professors I've had. She takes the time to get to know you and is extremely nice. She presents the material in a very simple way. Can't wait to take more classes with her!

Dr. Wang is amazingly helpful and she really tries to make the class a rewarding and intellectually stimulating experience. She encourages students to actually learn to apply principles instead of learning how to fill out a template.

One of the most enthusiastic professors I've had in 4 years! I went to her office hours and it is clear that she is passionate about her work. She was a little hard to understand at times, but she makes up for it by trying to help every student learn the material. A great professor, I'd recommend her class!

She is the best teacher that I have had at the University in four years. It is a required class, and there are alot of theories, but she makes the class interesting.You will get as much out of this class as you put into it.She goes out of her way to help students.I definitely recomend her as a professor. She is super cool!

She is one of the nicest instructors I have ever had.  She is smart, passionate about communication research, and obviously enjoys teaching.  Yes she has kind of a thick accent, but if you dont understand her, you can tell her and she wont get offended. This class was so easy!

The worst professor ever. She seems to be super nice, but the class was horrible. She changed requirements halfway through the quarter and spent a whole day discussing a topic that she didn't even test us on. Unbelievably frustrating.

Crystal clear and straightforward about what she expects. The class is required and I'm not interested at all, but she makes it relevant and interesting. She is warm and caring, and really wants the students to do well. The class can be boring sometimes but that's not her fault. One of the best professors I had at OSU.

She is a really sweet lady and genuinely wants her students to do well. She is a pretty easy grader on the "homeworks", but you should read the book and study a fair amount if you want to do well on the exams. Some true/false questions are tricky so make sure to read through them well!

She is a really nice person who is passionate about the subject but the class sucks. Its really easy but its torture to sit through those lectures, we get out early every day though.  Attendance is MANDATORY which sucks, its 9% of the overall grade.  projects are easy and exams are decent.  Could have been a very interesting class but its just OK
she's great
Very passionate and intelligent professor. Also very caring for students. I'm learning a lot from her and really enjoying the class!

SHE IS TORTURE. you can't understand half the stuff she says and although she is trying hard to make the class interesting, it just makes it tedious to sit through the lecture while she takes 10 min. to spit out a joke. Very nice lady but i wanted to shoot myself when she went off on nonsensical tangents that probably made more sense b4 translation
He is very knowledgeable in the field and has great insights! The structure of his class is a little unorganized, but overall he is a great person to learn from!

Dan Farkas is an incredible professor and person! His class changed the way I write and prepared me for a career in the PR/Communication field. He runs his class as a business, unfortunately in the real world there are no second chances. Attend class, take advantage of his working classes and ask questions. If you do that, you'll do great!

Professor Farkas seems like a great guy outside of class and I'm sure he is knowledgable in the field of communications, but his skills as a professor aren't great. I got useful info from his lectures, but it was hard to use for assignments, it didn't correlate with what we had to do. Very disorganized and cost me my grade for this class.

My biggest mistake of my college career was taking his class. He is so unorganized, acts like he cares when he does not. Will give you a huge assignment with little instruction and will mark off many points for little errors. He makes it hard to get an A, which is the most unfair thing to do to a student trying their best. Please double think this.

Just like other reviews, he is a respectable guy and was helpful for our class but his lectures were hard to follow, unorganized and his teaching is all over the place. However, he was pretty rude if you don't turn in idea assignments. There's moments it seems like he wants us to write how he likes, not for the course itself

This man's ego is through the roof. Told us that none of us are going to make it in the industry because we "don't care enough" and proceeded to walk out of the classroom at the beginning of a lecture. Rude, uncharismatic, and irrelevant to the industry. Even when he does lecture, it's a mess and unorganized.
Professor Farkas is a respectable man. However, he is a very tough grader. He is unclear, unorganized and his lectures are all over the place.

Farkas is the best prof in the comm school hands down. I took my first Farkas course my sophomore year and this is now my third one. I actually search his name when finding courses because he is that good. He has a highly respected background in various comm professions and gives the best REAL WORLD advice. His lectures are the reason I found a job
Very unclear and all over the place. Although he seems like a nice guys so I gave two stars.

Farkas was one of my favorite professors this semester. I had him twice and I would take him again! He actually cares for his students, and he makes lecture interesting and understandable, even though it was all online. He really prepares you for the real world.

I think Farkas was a great professor and I intend to take another of his courses in the upcoming semester. Comm 4337 was not difficult for me, if anything it was my group members that made the class seem difficult but professor Farkas was almost always available to offer feedback and he was very easy to reach. I would definitely recommend taking!

Professor Farkas is very funny and has passion and a background for the subject matter he teaches. With that being said, this was a difficult course. The instructions were unclear at times and knowledge of the AP style is mandatory if one hopes to pass the class.
Basically a remedial English course. Vague assignment descriptions. No logical flow between topics.

Pros: Funny, nice and understanding guy. He keeps lectures interesting. Willing to help and give feedback. Working classes for him to look at your stuff before you turn it in. Cons: You CANNOT skip class. Not everything he talks about is on slides. Vague grading criteria for assignments. Tough grader. Must know AP style well to get a good grade.

Dan is a great prof! Although his assignment guidelines can be vague, he is very helpful and will answer any question you may have. Attendance is not mandatory, but it will be very beneficial for your success in the class to attend.

Farkas is a cool guy but seems to be all over the place with everything. The projects are vague on the descriptions and if it is not up to exactly what he wants, expect to get a horrible grade. Class is fine but through out the course I and others had no idea what was going on in this class. His views on career sucess are not fitting with my own.
really vague in the assignment descriptions

Farkas came to OSU with a lot of experience in PR, journalism, and broadcasting. His experience shows in his expectations of his students. Be prepared to spend a lot of time editing your work! His lectures are enjoyable, he's a really funny guy. Come to class, pay attention, ask for feedback. You'll do fine in the class.

Even if you have a perfect or almost perfect score in everything else in the class, if you get a B on your final project, your grade will be unsalvageable. In addition, I don't understand why I got the B because none of my communication with the Professor was responded to. The rubric is unclear and the TA was awful.

Professor Bonus is one of the best Comm professors I've had! He is really caring & is really great at teaching! There is an assignment each week (either a worksheet or quiz), and they are really easy. The final project is also really easy and only took me like 2 hours to do. You'll really like him!

This class was actually so interesting and not an overwhelming amount of work. He explains the material extremely well and actually wants everyone to succeed. There is usually only one assignment due every week and they coincide with the lectures. The material is easily accessible and organized.
Thoughtful class layout that's easy to navigate. Course content communicated really clearly and the assignments were excellent for reinforcing material. Great class.

There is a project that kind of builds on itself all year, if you stick on track with that, complete weekly article readings and watch lectures you should come away with a good grade. I did not interact with this professor beyond feedback on assignments but he seemed very accessible and the class was pretty easy. It can kind of get dull at times.

SEI.Subject: COMM
SEI.Class Name: Mass Communication and the Social System

Ratings.comment: Her class is pretty organized and easy to manage. Her assignments are kind of tie consuming so do not procrastinate. I would say she is a bit of a tough grader, but not to the point where you would fail the class. She's easy to get in contact with, so feel free to email her with questions. I didn't hate the class, but I would not take it again.

I wasn't the biggest fan of the textbook, and you have to read it in order to do well on the quizzes & exams. The lectures were okay; I wish they aligned more with the textbook though. The papers aren't too difficult & they are graded pretty lightly. The exams are on the harder-side, but they are open note.

Easily one of my favorite professors here at tOSU; I'm taking her again this sem. Her lectures are very interesting & easy to follow. There are readings each week, but exams are open book; I managed to get an 100% in the course by skimming most readings. Also, the tests aren't cumulative so it applies directly to what you learned that week. 10/10!
My class was asynchronous with modules to complete each week. The content was delivered clearly and expectations were reasonable. She was very understanding and kind, I would recommend.

Overall an okay professor, but this class had some ridiculous demands for an asynchronous course. Multiple lecture vids., multiple lengthy readings required every week. Exams were decently hard compared to the content we covered. Not easily accessible and doesn't really go out of her way to ensure that students are engaged.

Class was overall easy, just time consuming. Multiple lecture vids, textbook readings, quizzes, and a discussion assignment every week. 2-3 hours of work every week, which isn't bad, but not great for an introduction class in my opinion. Lynch is helpful and the class is easily navigated, however.

I have taken all three of the courses Dr. Lynch offered this past year (COMM3558, COMM2540, and COMM3513) and each course was a blast. I learned so much from watching her recorded lectures and the research project at the end of COMM3513 is so much fun. I cannot recommend Dr. Lynch enough - she is amazing!

Asynchronous, taken for Comm Minor. Prof. Lynch covers a lot of topics beyond the reading, which covers most of the information on the exam, though they can be a bit tricky, as well as some of the weekly quizzes. Weekly work is fairly consistent and I found the lectures to be relevant and interesting.
Well organized class and honestly not much homework. Easy enough most of the time. Weekly quizzes can definitely be a little annoying sometimes. Exams were mildly challenging.
Overall Dr. Lynch was nice, but I didn't enjoy the class.

I loved Dr. Lynch. Her class is relevant, and she mixes up the readings to keep things interesting. The workload is fair, as are the exams. The class is much easier if you use Dr. Lynch as a resource. She is so friendly and helpful. She has changed the course since last semester based on students' feedback! Definitely a painless online class.

As an online class, there is a bit of work to do, but it's not bad, just a bit of reading. Professor did a great job explaining topics and encouraged students to use their own experiences to understand concepts. Would love to have her again.

Lynch seems really chill! The weekly assignments, readings, and lectures are not bad at all for an online class, especially since it is her first time teaching it in an online format. Material is easy, but for some reason, I did somewhat poorly on the midterm exam, which is odd because all the other assignments and materials are easy. She's sweet!

For an online course it was pretty difficult. The average on open note (non-proctored) exams were around a high 70%-low 80%. Her projects and directions were often very unclear and confusing. There were a lot of readings and lectures every week that you can't do well without takin in-depth notes on. I wouldn't deem Dr. Lynch as very caring either.

Most least accessible prof I have ever had. If you work independently this may be a good prof for you. Cancels office hours often, moves them to zoom sometimes. Her tests are really hard, not sure where half of the questions came from. Watch all lectures do all reading. Way more work than a 3 credit hour class.

Professor Lynch makes a class about social media dreadful. Her weekly modules consist of at least 3 different readings with 2 lecture videos and then a discussion each week. In her syllabus, she mentions that posting and responding within the hour it's due, you will not receive full credit. Very tough grader and difficult exams. She isnt personable
Great teacher. Lectures are interesting and worth attending. Just show up to class and its and easy A. Try to take her if you can!
This class is extremely easy. With that being said, the lectures are worth going to. She is very caring and interesting. One of my favorite professors at OSU.

Dr. Lynch is such a nice, dorky woman and you can tell she takes her position seriously. The class isn't hard, but also don't skip out on reviewing for her exams or you might get yourself in a little trouble. Weekly online homework assignments as well as response questions and two exams. Can get extra credit by doing C-REPs. Highly recommend!
He is a really chill guy. Enjoyed his class.

Professor Francemone was great. He responded to emails fast and his grading was clear. Every week was essentially the same assignment, watch the lectures, take a quiz and write a 1-2 page paper. Then the next week you read other students and replied to them. No exam which was nice.

easy class. his lectures are pretty boring, just goes through slides that he posts, so you dont really need to go to class. you write about the same thing all year, so everything builds on each other. easy open book quizzes every so often and two presentations. would definitely recommend him

Seems like a good guy but lectures are very boring in my opinion. There was no class or group participation so it didn't really make the class super enjoyable, but if that is what you're looking for then take this class. Very fair grader, and workload is average.

The class was pretty interesting and the lectures weren't too bad. There's a quiz and DB almost every week but they aren't too hard if you pay attention to the lectures. He's a fair grader but your lowest DB/quiz grades are dropped. Overall, it's an easy class and Proff is helpful.
Large assignments about every other week usually. Very good when it comes to grading. Online lectures aren't bad and pretty informative.

I loved this class, Dr. Bushman is famous in the psych world and cool guy to have as your teacher. A lot of the studies he cites are his studies! His lectures can get a little boring at times and has a tendency to over explain, but he makes everything easy to understand. Definitely take this class if you get the chance he's such a sweetheart.

Prof. Bushman is such a caring and intelligent teacher. He posts the slides online, so attendance isn't required, but he is a great orator and has interesting lectures. The homework and tests are pretty easy, but that isn't to say you do not learn a lot in the class because you do. I would love to take him for another semester for sure!

I would take this class with Brad again if I could. The content is so interesting, and he cares about what he is talking about! Although majority of your grade is based off 2 exams, this class was very investing and I highly recommend him. Best class I've taken at OSU so far. Also, if you do the weekly quiz, you're guaranteed a 100%.

If you keep up with the readings and lectures, it will be pretty easy. I think a lot of people will complain about the exams, but they honestly were not bad. Most of the questions came straight from the weekly quizzes and there's an outline of exam topics, so it was easy to study for. Make sure you read the syllabus well! He does not stray from it.

Brad Bushman is such a wonderful professor and guy. He is funny, genuinely cares for his students and knows so much about his subject. His class is very stress free and he is just the best overall. A wonderful professor 100% recommend.
I really love this professor. He is very passionate about what he teaches, and he knows what he is talking about. His lectures are also very interesting and engaging.

Brad himself is a nice and sweet man. This class was bad though. Every week you have a quiz worth 5 points which is not too hard. The tests were awful though. Very specific questions that require intense studying. There are not a lot of points in this class so tests are important. 1 paper which is easy if you're good at writing research papers.

i really loved this class, despite what others are saying. you spend no more than 2 hours per week doing his work and the lectures are super interesting. beware of the exams because you must watch the lectures to do well, but again, there are only 2 and the rest of the work is very minimal

super disrespectful and treats his students like he is way beyond above them. Does not care if you fail and will not offer ANY extra credit. The 2 exams hold the majority over your grade so if you do badly on one be prepared to have to drop the course.

I took this class online--it was really well organized, Professor Bushman's lectures were clear and straightforward. The class wasn't super difficult either. There's just one final paper and a midterm and final exam. As long as you actually watch the lectures and take notes, you'll be fine! Definitely not a bad GE course.
DONT TAKE THIS CLASS! I WARNED YOU

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! If you are part of SLDS I encourage you to find a new professor because he will not accommodate for you. He did not want to give me double time on my quizzes and exams and was very rude about it I had to drop his class and take another class

Good professor. I took the class online, but didn't feel left behind or lost like I do in some of my online classes. There is a lot of reading in the class, and the exams are definitely more difficult than you might expect, but manageable. He was really good at replying to emails, which is very important for an online class.

Gives great lectures every week (avg 25 min), a paper about a concept in the lecture, and small McGraw HWs. Three exams that you'll have to look over notes for, which weren't too difficult since he tells you what you need to study. Prof was also very kind and gave me extensions as needed. Highly recommended!

I enjoyed Comm 1100 with Dr Bushman and will try to schedule him again as I accomplish my communication minor. He is well respected, and a somewhat famous guy in the field of social sciences. He's very kind and patient, lectures are very relaxed and fulfilling. My grade in this class felt well earned, it is not a ton of work but it is challenging.

I really enjoyed professor Bushman! He really knows what he is talking about and ties it into real life. Lectures can be boring to listen to, but he posts the slides. His tests are hard because it really relies on you having a solid understanding of the concepts but he gives you study tools. As long as you take good notes and study its good!

The lectures were enjoyable, but did seem to get somewhat off track at times. Dr. Bushman was not very approachable, he would reply to emails in a very short manner, forward to TA's, but would not correct my grade. The exams and the lectures didn't really line up. There are weekly writing assignments, but the exams are worth a lot of your grade.

Don't take this class if you want a good grade and GPA at the end of the semester. The worst teacher ever in my life, no extra credits, tests is extremely hard, lecture was so boring, not care about students at all! Definitely try to stay away with this horrible teacher!!!
The worst professor I ever had in the osu. His lecture are fine but the exam are super hard. And he doesnt care about the students feeling.
His Classes are good and interesting but the text is so hard.
PLZ do not come to this class. U will feel hopeless

This was my FAVORITE class! He was the best professor ever! The lectures were very interesting and he taught the material very well. The textbook is very useful because it's exactly what he says in lectures. He is the author of the textbook! Few extra credit opportunities. Exams were fair, questions mostly came from tophat, slides, and textbook.

Dr. Bushman is a solid professor, and the course is a great introduction to communication and social psychology. I throughly enjoyed his lectures and found the content engaging and relevant. There are short weekly papers (one page) along with three exams.

Dr. Bushman is such a well respected guy. It was an honor to learn from him. You gotta watch the lectures and do the readings. The exams are pretty difficult even after studying. But I really loved his class

One of my favorite professors that Ive had, hes really nice and makes the content interesting/easy to understand. Workflow is consistent and not overly difficult, as there is an essay and short quiz most weeks. Downside is that exams are somewhat difficult, but do the reading before lectures and before the exam, and prepare in advance.
there is a short essay to do every week but it's no big deal. Exams are considered okay if you read the slides from lectures and the book. Overall this is a good class for GE.

Prof Bushman is truly the most caring professor I've ever had! As long as you communicate with him, he can be very accommodating and you can tell he truly cares about his students. Just make sure you watch the online lectures and you can pass without too much difficulty!

I agree with both the good and bad reviews. Bittersweet experience, the class is crazy hard but I lucked out with my grade. I feel like its easier to do bad than good but the bigger issue is the title. I feel like perhaps he makes it so hard because comm 3442 isnt an as respected class to take oppose to a different open elective.

Really narcissistic. He comes across as someone who has his students back but is essentially non existent when you need help and is cold and short with you. Tried to comfort the class on doing poorly on the midterm by announcing the majority of us did bad as well in his lecture. Shouldnt that tell you that maybe what you teach isnt on the tests?

Pretty misleading, from lectures you think youd know whats on a test but open it up to something completely different. Hes someone you want to like because hes funny but as an actual professor hes not the best at teaching and is actually not understanding at all which you wouldnt expect in the beginning. Regret taking this class. Never again.

Overall good professor. I would go to every lecture you can and read the chapters to keep up with the content for exams. Shows videos and examples throughout class so it's not so boring and he's pretty funny. No extra credit and 3 exams were kind of tough. Weekly assignments graded by TA, but he seemed to care about his students.

I really liked Brad! Lectures could be boring and usually were spent by him showing a ton of goofy videos that sometimes didn't really seem relevant. Tests could be kind of difficult and didn't really have study guides. Overall, he was a pretty good and caring professor.

I think Brad Bushman is a nice guy, however, his class was unnecessarily hard. Your final grade is based on four exams, so if you do poorly on one your grade is kind of screwed. He doesn't offer any homework or extra credit and I felt like he didn't really care if his students did well or not.
I liked his class, but youll have to read the chapters before the lecture. He only goes over half of the material in lecture and the other half is from the reading.

Brad Bushman is such an angel. He's very funny and passionate about the material he teaches, and lectures were always very interesting. Attendance is not mandatory, and if you read the textbook, do the tophat review, and the quiz yourself questions in the book, you can probably pass without going. I went just because his lectures are interesting.

My class was a hybrid, so every Monday we had an online essay instead of a lecture. For the essays, you have to read the chapter of the book he assigns, and sometimes find real world examples. Those weren't fun. The exams are easy, and if you pay attention in lecture he tells you what you should focus on, and gives you the short answer questions.

I loved this class!! Wasn't mandatory but if you go and pay attention you will do well because he gives great examples and is awesome at applying the concepts. most papers and assignment were graded by TAs so the grading is a little difficult they expect specific things. However, tests are in class and if you do the guide you will surely flourish
Boring lectures. He doesn't seem to have anything interesting or significant about him. More interested with hoping on the latest SJW bandwagon than actually being a force that brings about change.

He's a really cool dude, and he really cares about how you learn the material. I would love to take another class by him. Barely studied and did well on all the exams. There's 3 and homework is extremely quick and easy.

He forces his beliefs on you. He says "he cares" about his students, but really if you ask for help or email, he is short and rude and tells you to your TA. My TA saw me a lot because I had so many questions. I went to every single lecture, all he does his talk about his OWN studies. This class is all about him. He's arrogant, just STAY AWAY!

If you come to class every day, you can easily ace the exams without ridiculously studying. Two-three hours the day before the exam is plenty. If you don't come to class, though, and you want an A, you should expect exam-prep to go very differently.
You can tell he genuinely enjoys teaching, which makes a BIG difference.

He is the best professor I've had. He is extremely kind and helpful and made a huge class seem small. It's easy to skip because it's a massive lecture but I never missed one because no lecture was boring. Would definitely recommend his classes.

I had Dr. Bushman for Psych 3325 and he is one of the best professors on campus. Period.  He took several teaching classes to ensure his tests are fair and understandable. There are no tricks. He is very kind (takes students to get bagels) and is always accessible and approachable. People underestimate his class though, but there is a curve.

Favorite professor by far. Obviously loves what he does and loves to talk about his personal experiences as an experimenter. Even though it's a giant class he tries to get to know his students and really cares about how you do. If you don't enjoy this course it is your own fault because he makes it very easy and fun.
Professor Bushman is amazing. I really enjoy his class.

This is my favorite class this semester! The material is interesting, and Prof. Bushman tries to keep the students intrigued with comics and opportunities for class participation. He very clearly lays out what to expect on exams, classes, and quizzes in the syllabus. If you read the assigned readings and review the PP's - the exams are fairly easy.
Best professor I've had so far. Super clear and very fair grader. Always implements a curve so 25% of the class gets an A on each exam. Highly recommend!
Just look at his accomplishment!
He was really helpful when I asked him to clarify some information. I took both Comm 1100 and Comm 3442. He was really interesting with Comm 3442 and I would recommend that class to anyone!

I enjoyed his teachings. He expressed his beliefs but never tried to force someone to believe what he does. He's just passionate about his research and I am mature enough to separate my beliefs from his without criticizing the way that he teaches. I enjoy his lectures, though his powerpoint are a bit disorganized at times.

Overall, not the best experience I've had with a professor.  His lectures are based on his own beliefs, and many times he will force those beliefs on students; with the justification of "studies show that..."   Exams can be a bit vague and the class average, at one point, was around a D+ without a curve.  Stay away... far away...
The tests are easy if you go to lecture and do the assigned readings. He takes questions from both. Easy to understand and tries to relate the material to what is going on in the news.

This guy is not nice. Do yourself a favor and do not take this class from him.  He is super arrogant and into himself.  He responses to emails are rude short.  He does not care about his students because the class is so big.  The tests are though.  He is extreamly smart, too smart for his own good.  KEEP AWAY FROM THIS CLASS!!!

Lectures are almost pointless except for the entertainment value. His power points are confusing and not helpful for taking online quizzes. He meets his students for bagels but seems disinterested in what they have to say. He also comes off as arrogant and quite rude. He's accomplished a lot but he will make sure you know about it.

This class is not too difficult if you study for exams. Like others have said, it is never clear exactly what will be on an exam. Most of the lectures do not contribute to you actually learning the material. A lot of video watching, when you're not quite sure why you are watching it. Forces his own personal views on class. Highly do not recommend.

Bushman was the best professor I have had at OSU. He is clearly passionate about the material and tries to make it relatable to students. I love the way he tries to make a giant lecture feel personal. I didn't buy the text book and still received an A. I definitely recommend his courses!
He's very interested in the material, but his enthusiasm  didn't motivate me. Not as easy as it could be.

Not recommended Gen Ed.  He is a really nice guy and tries to meet all of his students in a 515 person lecture. Tests are pretty difficult especially if you don't have time to study for them. Helps a lot if you go to class but not mandatory and has all ppts on carmen.  You can succeed in the class if you do all the readings and focus

Super cool and interesting professor. Funny, good guy, buys you bagels if you let him. Should easily get a B if you go to class, if not just look at the study guide before the test and you should still do fine. Online quizzes are easy and you get 3 attempts. Rest of grade is C-REP and you get all the points just for participating. Enjoy

It was his first time teaching the class, so it was definitely difficult at first but it got better. I found class very interesting. I reccommend going to class, although its not mandatory, because not everything is on the Powerpoints. Plenty of extra credit opportunities. He tries to get to know his students by inviting 5 every out to get bagels.

Make sure you come to every class! He really knows what he's talking about. He once showed us a study that had been published in The New York Times that I had read before. It ended up being his study! Despite being a 300+ person lecture, he would treat 5 students to "Bagels with Bushman" at Brennan's on High Street. I recommend --but go to class!

Didn't really care for him. Exams are tough (not as tough if you attend class regularly) and not many other points are offered besides the exams (80% of the final grade) Rambles a bit in lecture and I was never sure what material he talked about in lecture would actually be on the exam.) Study guides he provides are lengthy and didn't help much.

The class wasn't easy, but it was incredibly interesting.  Dr. Bushman is an amazing scholar, and great teacher.  If you go to class and take good notes, it's not hard to do well.  He uses a curve (that doesn't punish you) in case the class doesn't do well.  I would recommend taking the class if you actually plan on attending.
major cool points for playing "Friday" by Rebecca Black during class.
