Ratings.comment: Took 4665 with Prof. Bond back in my last semester Spring 2023. One of the best COMM professors ever! The class was essentially based on essays about research papers that were expanded upon during class. No attendance required but worth it since he went over good reading techniques and promoted awesome conversations. Would def take his class again!
Never attempt to argue with him even if you are right
Attendance isnt mandatory but he does quizzes daily for points for the people who do attend.

Pretty average overall. First paper is difficult because he hasn't yet figured out a proper maximum word count. Unclear about how to write essays for his class, but is overall an easy grader. Exams are all short answer and essay questions, but there are only two.

Dr. Bond has three PhD degrees and he gives amazing lectures. He is very knowledgeable and inspirational. I did not have any exams but two long papers and one presentation. The course will inform you how to do research and prepare you for graduate school.

Dr. Bond was one of my favorite teachers at Ohio State, had him for two of my Comm classes ( Comm 4554 as well). Fantastic teacher, gives great lectures and very approachable in office hours. Expect to do the readings he has a Top Hat quizzes ( for attendance and reading purpose) but they are not difficult questions. Not exams, highly recommend him
I find his lectures impressive, if not depressive. He encourages random "MCAW!" bird calls from the side of your mouth every now and then to break up the monotony of the everyday classroom.

Dr. Bond was excellent!  The in class lectures were relatively boring but the book readings were interesting.  There were no exams and he was super helpful when I went for help during office hours.  Would definitely recommend this class to comm majors looking for an easy A.

Bond is great. We had two papers (5 pages), a midterm, final, and some random participation points (which is basically signing your name on a sheet on random days he picks). He is a clear instructor, tests are fairly easy. The papers aren't hard, but do require some thought. He is very willing to help. Would take him again! also no textbooks!

It was Professor Bailey's first semester teaching so yes, in the beginning things were a bit disorganized. But! She's a pretty easy grader, gives good feedback, answers emails fast, and her assignments are applicable to Strat. Comm majors. I took 2321 and 3334 with her and liked them both. Would recommend as a communications professor to want.

Professor Bailey is a kind person but is very unorganized and not clear with due dates. You work on a group project all semester but have a lot of busy work that's unrelated to the project. Some extra credit opportunities are available.

I had to drop this course bc my other classes were slowly dragging me out(only took it for a commtech minor), so I am taking it next semester, however, David is super kind and keeps lectures engaging(remembers names fast). David does not post lectures so you have to attend class(type your notes). Test heavy, but pure memorization, so go 2 class.

took this class online and it was super straightforward/easy. i'm convinced everyone complaining just doesn't watch the lectures or take notes and then gets pissy that they didn't magically retain the content. david is a fine prof. if you do the work and consult the syllabus you'll be a-okay.

AVOID HIM! The worst exam score in my undergraduate period. I withdraw this class since I cannot ruin my GPA. I even studied for hours every week to prepare for the exam. I took COMM2540 this semester and it actually a super easy class! He made the easy class much difficult! I am not sure what he want to achieve by making student miserable!

COMM 2540 with Dave was not difficult, though I think it was helpful to take it online. Exams make up 75% of your grade but are open note and aren't very hard. The application assignments sometimes take a long time for how much they are worth, but two are dropped. Dave was an entertaining professor that made me laugh with his use of sarcasm.

Took his class this past semester and it was the hardest class I'll probably ever take in college. I'm a junior. He's a tough grader on the application assignments. I struggled to get an 8/10 at best. I studied for hours for the final only to get a 64%. Lectures are boring and he explains them in the most complicated way possible! AVOID HIM!
Makes an easy class a difficult one.

I feel lik epeople who rate him low are either slackers or unreasonable and entitled, angry students who just don't get it.    David was a fair and reasonable professor, his lectures were involved and thoughtful.  Don't miss class. Take notes. Read. Study. Ask questions. Consult the syllabus. Stop complaining. Do work for your grade.

He tries to make simple content difficult, and he is a tough grader.  On top of being a tough grader, he gives no real explanation for why you missed points.   I really think that says a lot about a person; to me it is clear he doesn't care whether people pass or fail...

The class very boring and useless. You wont be able to pay attention in class because all you will be doing is taking notes. The information is useless to anything to what you want to do in life and David is BORING!!! I would not take his class ever again.

Received over 100% in Organizational Communication.  The tests are not difficult, you just actually need to go to class and read the book.  If you prepare and study the material you will be able to clearly note the "trick" questions on the exams.  Yes, it takes a lot of work to get a good grade, but it's definitely attainable.

Lectures are dull and unclear. Tests are nearly impossible and he pulls material out of nowhere. Thinks its funny to mess with students heads. I studied and read the book. I am an honors student and this class also ruined my GPA! Would never recommend him.

The worst professor I've ever had at Ohio State. Doesn't care about his students at all and it's blatantly obvious.  Very arrogant and like others said makes tests just to trip you up.  Would avoid him at all costs.

Do NOT take his class if you care about your GPA.  I'm a 3.74 honor student who ended up w/ a C-.  Went to every single lecture and studied my tail off before exams.  His exams are not meant to test your knowledge, it's meant to trip you up.  Hands down, one of the most pointless class you will ever take in college.  Have fun!

Honestly this class was ridiculous. As someone who makes the dean list every semester with a double major, working 30+ hours a week in a job and being involved on campus, I'm beyond upset that I got a 85% in the class. His tests are way harder than need be. He tries to trip students up with the stupid T/F questions. Worst class I've ever had.
NOT FLEXIBLE AND ACCOMMODATING TO STUDENTS NEEDS.

Class is fine then you show up to take a test and dude is like what terms can I make up that sound better than the strange theories I tought these kids. Just his tests are a joke they aren't ment to test you just trip you up.

So, I wll say that Deandrea is passionate about what he teaches. However, what he teaches, is the biggest waste of a Ph.D.  The class is terrible and useless. The first few front rows are lined like a Beatle concert with women who constantly strive to gain his attention. He also can be cocky and condescending.

David really tries. It's a big class, and most people are taking it as a required class, and he really tries to engage the class. That being said he is a little dry, as is the content. The notes are not posted online, and there are ( super easy) pop quizzes that determine your attendance grade. If you go to class, listen, and study, it should easy.

Class was easy, not very interesting. He doesn't post slides on Carmen (wish he did it would be helpful) but he gives good study guides for exams. Go.To.Class. Or buddy up with someone to take notes, you will need class content for the exams.

David is a really good professor overall and a cool guy! The midterms are fair if you go to class, and the quizzes are pretty easy! Watch out for the final paper though, he's a stricter grader on that then on previous material.

The material itself is pretty interesting. Like others have said, slides aren't posted online so you have to go to every class (or make a friend). The exam questions are pretty tricky (50% MC, 50% T/F). Four easy papers. Dave is awesome.. the class is interactive, we watched a lot of current video clips.  I would recommend.
David was a great teacher. If you go to class, pay attention, and take notes you should easily get an A. He doesn't put notes on Carmen.

Dave is laid back and friendly, and he gives the impression the first day that this will be a fairly straightforward class, but- the exams are pretty tricky. I think he's trying a little too hard to not be an "easy" professor, because the material doesn't seem too difficult. Zero tolerance for late assignments and no slides on Carmen.
Great class!

David is a really cool guy but, his class was pretty difficult. He doesn't post the slides online. He has a zero tolerance late policy for assignments. His exams are extremely hard and he forces you to know the material front and back. The first average for the 1st exam wa. below a 70%, but theres a bug curve, Wouldn't take him again...

If you go to class and pay attention you'll be fine. No he doesn't post his slides online, but it's easy to get them from a friend. You just have to actually study and open your book. He's really nice and willing to help anyone that comes to his office hours. His exams are a little difficult, but he has a huge curve.

There are three non-cumulative exams, two papers, and some quizzes. He never posted the lecture note on Carmen; everyone is busy to write down during the class. On the exam, there are a lot of questions about what we've WATCHED and DISCUSSED during the lecture. You will learn how to take notes effectively! I will never take his class anymore

There are three non-cumulative exams, two papers, some quizzes, and some survey for extra credit. He never posted the lecture note on Carmen. On the exam, there are a lot of questions about what we've WATCHED/DISCUSSED during the class. Probably you will learn the effective note-taking strategies. i won't take his class anymore.

Doesn't post lecture slides online, so if you miss class your screwed.  Lectures aren't terrible, he keeps it as interesting as possible.  Exams are very difficult, and it seems he attempts to trick or confuse you.  Probably wouldn't take him again.

Careful on discussion posts - seems like if your work doesn't align with her opinion, you get points off even if all of the rubric requirements are met. Exams had typos/bad grammar and you never get to see the answers afterwards... questions are repeated on exams too. Did way to much work for this class just to have nothing to show for.

For a GE course, this was a good online one to choose. 6/12 discussion posts and 4/12 quizzes were dropped, so once I got past the eighth week, I didn't do any more work for the class (besides the online exams). A big downside was she never allowed us to see our answers to exams, so I never knew what questions I was getting wrong for future exams.

The class is worthless, Shulman sounds like the weakest link of an MSNBC segment. The final exam was RIDDLED with typos and sentences that grammatically made no sense, as a junior, Shulman was by far the least competent professor I've had, I spent way too much time on this class and I have literally nothing to show for it.

Did not watch a single lecture and got an A. The discussions are full on 2-3 page papers so I did the first 6 and didn't do more because 6/12 of them are dropped. Taking tests for a GE on respondus lockdown browser was kinda whack but this class is just busywork.
Genuinely did not watch a single lecture and got an A. Once I did 6 discussions I never did another one because 6/12 of them are dropped, and the di
GE course with lockdown browser exams? The class is common sense and self-explanatory, though. She is very biased and makes her political views clear throughout the course.

The class was pretty easy but some of the quiz/exam questions had more than one answer that could fit. Does not accept late work at all but 6/12 discussions are dropped and 8/12 quizzes are dropped. The class was very large so TA's were responsible for grading and the one i was assigned to graded discussions pretty harshly.

Very knowledgeable about the topics she teaches, but is somewhat disconnected from the asynch course so she doesn't feel like a very helpful resource. Generally pretty easy content, and tests are open notes, but there are a lot of "gotcha" questions or some that could have more than 1 good answer. Also comes off a bit condescending at times.

Everything in the class is common sense, Hillary loses credibility when she writes "Democrats/Liberals are equally receptive to info that either supports or contradicts their ideology, Republicans/Conservatives more eager to accept
corrections if in line with their attitudes; less likely to accept otherwise". everyone is biased, not just one side.

Took as a senior for my final GE credit. Automatic 10 point deduction for going 1 second over 4 minutes in a discussion post. Only keeps 6 of 12 discussions but absolutely ridiculous. Emailed her saying there was nothing in the syllabus or rubric about the automatic deduction. She just said she'll make it clearer now. Love the retroactive work.

Easy content, just a lot of work. The quizzes had a lot of "gotcha" questions that tried to trick you, but it's pretty easy to do well in the course as long as you can tolerate a lot of busy work, like reflections and discussion posts. You can tell she really enjoys what she does, and she works hard to make the online content engaging.

This class is a cake walk! The exams are easy (open note w/ 2 attempts) & the discussion posts are graded lightly. I didn't read the textbook, but I skimmed it for the quizzes & exams. You won't need to put in more than like 2 hours each week. No reason to not end with an A.

Content was interesting and applicable to everyday communication. The exams were difficult with true/false questions. Professor was alright. Lots of people whined and cried on the GroupMe, but as long as you read the textbook and watch the lectures, you should be fine. Negative feedback comes from the lazy students, so do the work and get that A.

I really loved her as she made lectures interesting and fun. The semester-long project was challenging but not impossible. I would definitely recommend her and would absolutely take a class of hers again.

hillary is honestly one of the best, if not the best professors here at the university! she only gives out information in class, so you have to show up, but she's hilarious so its alright. her classes are always super interesting and engaging, would highly recommend!
Going to lecture, taking notes, and doing the online assignments is all you need to get an A in her class.

Hillary is such a great professor. I had her for Comm1100 and she made the class interesting and funny even though it was a huge lecture hall. Plus, a super easy A if you attend lecture and study enough for exams.

Hillary's lectures were generally enjoyable and engaging! She doesn't post slides online, so going to class is all but mandatory. The only thing to be wary of is that the exams were the bulk of the grades for her class (at least the semester I had with her). Pay attention in the lectures and study hard for the exams and you should do well.

Hillary was both the best professor I've had at Ohio State, but also taught the hardest classes I've ever taken. She wants you to earn a grade, not get one. If you pay attention and contribute (which she encourages) in class lecture, you'll be fine. Make sure to go to office hours for feedback on assignments as it proved to enhance my grades.

All questions you ask, she can answer as "IT DEPENDS ON YOU". If we know it, why should we ask her.  She always said" i am resource for you" but I did not see any benefits.  She graded every assignments as lowest as she can. Don't forget this is a group project.  Other groups have the same situation. I believe a lot of people will agree with me

Very condescending when speaking to students. She makes you feel stupid if you ask her to clarify on anything and then sort of laughs about it. When someone asked her how to write a business memo she responded with, "Google it." She is very knowledgeable about topics but forgets that we are not, and that she is responsible for teaching us.

Loved Kristie. I took her for public speaking and she is so chill. Attendance is taken but removed from your final grade. Absence will affect your participation though. This was by far my favorite class ever it was a lot of fun and you have a lot of creative freedom.
Prof Sigler was great and really cared about her students and her class. As long as you go to class and engage with your group, this class will not be too difficult.

Krisite is a very nice professor who genuinely enjoys working with students and wants them to succeed. She has a passion for public speaking, as well as teaching it. I really enjoyed taking her class and have learned a lot about public speaking as well as overcoming my fear! Definitely recommend!
I recommend you to not take it unless you want to devote all your time to this class. she's nice but she doesn't have any alternatives.

Professor Sigler is a clear lecturer, an empathetic teacher, and does a great job equipping her students for assignments. She's a semi-tough grader but she always makes her expectations really clear. She's very understanding, too - definitely a professor who will help you succeed in her class.

Kristie truly cares about all of her students and wants to see them succeed. She is always ready to offer help when needed, whether in the classroom or personal life. She sets very clear expectations and gives amazing feedback to help you succeed on your next assignment. The class was fairly easy but you get out what you put into it.
Easy enough class, and Kristie clearly cared about the topics and each student's success.

Great professor, a very nice person. Make sure to go to office hours for feedback on parts of the big essays. The test was open book, but you definitely need to study and take it seriously. It was slightly curved. The professor wrote the textbook. Do the work and follow the rubrics and you should be good. Finish strong. C-REP extra credit too.

Professor Sigler is an incredibly nice person. Her class is very righting heavy it is nothing you can't handle. gives very good feedback and is very detailed. you should never be lost in this course. if you get the chance, definitely take her class

Professor Sigler is an excellent and very understanding teacher who was extremely helpful and willing to meet for extra help on assignments. The class was a little bit tricky at first but the exam was curved. She definitely sets up a class very conducive to learning, and one that allowed you to choose a topic for assignments which is always nice!

Professor Sigler was awesome! She is willing to work with her students through any troubles and gives great feedback on all papers/assignments. There are a lot of papers but they all build on each other so the last final paper & presentation doesnt seem so bad. Definitely recommend!

Professor Sigler is a great teacher. She reminds students that they matter and their mental health matters. Her class was great and none of the work unreasonable, but I know I could have put in more work on my end. In my opinion, make sure you are working hard during the first half of the semester, since thats where most of your points come from.
Kristie is so willing to help! She made this class both informative and enjoyable. You will become a better writer after taking this class!

Professor Sigler will help you become a better writer. Her assignments build on each other and she grades fairly. I went to her office hours for every essay (I highly reccommend doing this) and got an A on each one. Overall, a pretty painless 2nd level writing GE.
The exams are a nightmare, but the papers and presentations are easy. If you have fun in the class, you will pass.

One of the best prof's I have ever taken here at OSU. She really loves what she does and she is really good about it. Prof. Sigler really knows her material and will do everything to make sure you understand and hopefully apply that material in the real world. Just go to class, listen, and take notes.

She is a really A good person and very helpful but, Too much work for a second-level writing course. She grades extremely hard, so you have to go to office hours or you won't do well. Tests are online but they are tough. Quizzes are online too but they are not that hard.

Kristie is easily one of the best professors I have had at OSU. She is extremely knowledgeable about the course material and communicates her expectations very clearly. While the course is writing heavy, she makes it very manageable and TRULY cares about students and their well-being. She is such a gem of a person and I would highly recommend her!

Best professor I've had in college so far! She is very laid back, caring, and really tires to get to know her students. Class has a good amount of papers, but the grading criteria is very clear and she offers a lot of feedback. Other than that and a speech, easy and fun class!

This class is more difficult than it used to be, but Kristie makes this class manageable. She is very passionate about teaching and she really cares about her students. There is one time that she extended her office hour for 2 extra hours just to give help to every students waiting outside her office. Definitely recommended!
She was a lot of fun in class, though the papers are a pain. They build up on each other which is nice, and she helps you out if you go to office hours which is really nice.

Kristie's class has been my favorite class I have taken thus far in my college career because it is super helpful and she is so awesome that it just brightens your day. If you are uncomfortable speaking in public/want to improve persuasive skills and give this class the appropriate time required for a 3 credit hour course you will be very satisfied

She is a really nice person and very helpful but, Too much work for a second level writing course. She grades extremely hard, so you have to go to office hours or you wont do well. Tests are online but they are still fairly tough. Seriously recommend taking a different class if u can avoid this one.

Be careful when you choose this class. Quizzes and exams are online but super tricky. Exams are a bit better. There are 3 quizzes and 2 exams (Subject to change). If you do take this class, go to office hour because she tends to give those people higher grades. Definitely not an easy A, take Criticizing television if you just want an A.

By far the best professor I've had at OSU. Professor Sigler is very caring. Her exams are a bit tricky, and there are a good amount of papers. However, if you go to her office hours and get her feedback, you should be fine. Overall an amazing person

Mrs. Sigler is great! There is a lot of speaking in front of the class but it is comfortable. Papers are lengthy and take some time but as long as you put in the work, you'll get a good grade. In Comm 2367 I had 5 papers, 2 midterms (online), and a few quizzes (online). Would recommend you buy the textbook for the midterms and quizzes.

Kristie is amazing! It is so clear how passionate she is about the subject, and how much she cares about her students' success. She is great about making herself accessible outside of class, and provides excellent feedback. Can't recommend taking a class with her enough! I genuinely loved going to her class every day.

Kristie is absolutely incredible. She is one of the sweetest humans and wants you to succeed. I dont think the material is necessarily easy but she makes the lessons fun which makes them easier to remember. She is such a genuine person who wants you to succeed she is absolutely incredible

I absolutely loved taking Comm2367 with Kristie. She's an amazing teacher and the class is not hard at all. Pass your papers by her before submitting them and you'll be fine. She gives great feedback, has lots of energy and cares deeply for her students.
She is awesome! Best professor at Ohio State, and that's saying a lot since it's the biggest school in the country.

BEST CLASS EVER. Super interesting and applicable, super fun. If you get your drafts read by her before you submit, you are in the clear. Very easy A. She is literally the nicest, most caring and organized, best prof ever. Enjoyed the class, would take again. You can miss 4 classes without penalty. Just make sure you read the book--it's fun to read
Kristie really cares about her students and is very passionate about the course. Loved having her as a prof

Kristie is a gem. She is very nice, humorous and knowledgeable. Her lectures are relatively short, which will not exhaust you at all. And she cares about your participation in lectures. Her exams are tricky and hard, but if you read the textbook, it should be fine.

Kristie is an awesome professor. She really wants the students to succeed. Plenty of readings, but the quizzes and exams aren't hard. The final speech is a little stressful but the process of getting there makes it a little easier. A lot of research necessary for success

Shes a great teacher, I highly recommend taking her! There are two exams and a few papers. You do have to do a couple speeches, so be prepared for that. Kristie is always willing to help when necessary, and going to office hours was a big help in getting an A. Study the notes, the exams follow those pretty well! And the lectures are pretty fun too!

One of my favorite teachers at OSU! You learn stuff that can actually be applied to the real world. Read all the material, go over the notes, and you'll be fine. She can be a tough grader at points, especially for papers but she's fair. She's really helpful during after hours and some of her classes can be a lot of fun. Highly recommend her!!

She is one of the best teachers I had in OSU. Go to class, read all the material and you will know how helpful she is. Try to talk with her as much as possible if you have ANY problems. She will be will very patient to answer all your questions. I messed up the exam, which made me get a A- in the end. The course is quite hard. But u can learn alot.
Teaches stuff that can be applied in real life. Highly recommended.
Great professor, very friendly and approachable while still teaching effectively, this class does include a major public speaking component but she made the classroom feel very comfortable

This is the best teacher I ever meet, she teaches me a lot and it is also easy to learn. The assignments is a little bit challenging, but still can handle if you put time on them. Anyway, she is really really nice teacher and always think from the perspective of students.
The level of effort you give on papers determines your grade, as well as your performance on the only midterm. Great class and very enjoyable
Such a sweet lady, I would definitely recommend taking her! Give a good effort on papers and you'll be successful
kristie is awesome. wished i liked comm more so i could see her again one day. def hot
Very enthusiastic about class and cares about students learning. Shes pretty hot for a mom.
Totally awesome professor, probably couldn't find a better one if you tried. Fun and friendly and always willing to help! Really cares about students.
Kristie is really good! She is an easygoing person and patient to the students. She always encourages the students to do their best.I like her!
totally worth taking her class. fun, easy, and she's totes laid back. a kid even ordered food during class and she was cool with it. ahaha

Kristie is totally down to earth - on top of being a great professor, she's a great person. Class is boring at times but she knows to keep it short or otherwise we start zoning out. Makes things fun and easy! The beginning of the quarter can be overwhelming, but by the end it's all worth it! ONE exam!
Kristie is great, seriously. Take her!

One of the two best teachers I've had at OSU.  Had class as a sophmore, now I'm a senior.  Wish I woulda kept in touch with her - always willing to help and make sure you understand.  Took some stuff that could have been extremely confusing and not fun and made it fun.  Helped make everything all easy.  Very cool woman, plus she's good looking.
I think this is the best professor I've had at OSU.  You wouldn't believe how helpful she is.  She makes the class VERY easy.  No joke
She is extremely nice and helpful!

Genuinely the best and most memorable professor I've had at OSU. What you put in to this class has an incredible ROI in terms of what you get out. On the other hand, if you don't do the assigned readings then pray to whatever God you believe in because you'll need it. Her lectures are always interesting and her quirky humor keeps you engaged

I respect the hell outta her, she knows her stuff. Ready to help you if you try in her class. Funny as hell! Great mentor, super lecture heavy, you don't see your grades in Carmen, tells you why and is correct trust her. Think critically and ask questions, YOU WILL PASS.

Not an easy class. She cares so much. Gives great critical feedback. Prepares you for realworld/grad school. This is a critical thinking class, will not spoon-feed you answers but loves to engage in relating material in class to real-life application. Extremely helpful to students who genuinely try and will clarify anything you ask about.

She is the worst professor in COMM. Thinks too highly of herself and talks down to students. Tests are extremely hard and she doesn't bother to explain anything in class related to the material. Condescending and rude too. I cannot understand how this person was hired for this position when she can't even teach. Waste of time and tuition. Beware!

Jesse is one of the worst professors Ive ever had at this university. This semester and this class have been absolutely awful because of her. She never grades assignments and doesnt respond to emails- a COMM professor who cant even communicate. She still hasnt even uploaded final grades and the deadline has passed. Do not take her class!

She is one of the worst professors I have ever taken classes from. She doesn't care about students and has the worst attitude. She basically thinks she is smarter than everyone else and therefore constantly puts down students. Her class is a joke because her tests and exams are unreasonably hard so she can show she is smart. Avoid at all costs!

I'm currently taking her class online, and it's by far the worst online class I've ever taken. We have a month left and she hasn't graded a SINGLE thing. She's teaching HCI+UX but is terrible with technology and doesn't know how to use Carmen. I've had zero problems with other online classes so there's really no excuse imo. Avoid at all costs

Jesse Fox is a very interesting and entertaining professor. However, her essays and exams are astronomically unreasonable. I understand she's trying to develop us for the real world, but her expectations  are way too difficult for such a class. If you care about your grades avoid this professor, although her class is enjoyable

Professor Jesse is a very clear, engaging, and witty professor. She truly cares about what she teaches and she does so very well. Too bad her expectations were so high for her writing assignments, because she is unnecessarily strict. If you care about your GPA, avoid her at all costs if possible.

Jesse is, by far and away, the best professor I've had at OSU. She is also the toughest professor I've had. The essays and exams are difficult, but not impossible if you pay attention in class and actually study. She is also always willing to give great examples to explain concepts, and gives wonderful feedback during her office hours.

Jesse is by far one of the most knowledgeable professors I've had at Ohio State and she does care about your grades. Though she was one of my favorites, she is tough. She really makes you work for your grade. No technology allowed in class, at first I hated it but I was able to engage more in class.

DROPPED THIS CLASS BECAUSE OF HER! She is an awful teacher who cares more about what makes her happy than helping other students. WILL NOT allow any use of technology and posts nothing online. Don't think about missing one class because you will be lost. Expects perfection and will take points off of papers for the smallest thing. Do not take her!!

Video games class about how to write properly and nonsense theories most of which aren't geared towards video games. Also no idea your grade until the last day and all of the grading was left to a T.A. Avoid if at all possible about half the initial class actually saw the class out.

Personally I found her class difficult even when doing the readings, seeking help from the TA to go over my exam, and attending every single class and taking notes. For being a class about video games I thought I would enjoy this more and at least understand it but her expectations are too high for a undergraduate course.

She's not mean, but she's strict. She takes her classes seriously and does her job professionally and expects the same from her students. She'll help you if you ask for it but she won't hand you the answers or the A on a silver platter.

Although she doesn't take attendance, she does not post the material online. you're not permitted to use any electronics in class &if you get caught the whole class has a pop quiz. I found the information extremely interesting and enjoyed coming to class. She plays funny videos and puts memes on the slides that keep it interesting. loved this class

Worst professor ever! Teaches the class as an English class rather than a video games class. She is uptight and the grading is subjective. Video games class should teach you about video games, instead of expecting you to be gamers. Sadly, even gamers hate her class! She is evil, boring, and will make you hate video games

If you put in the time, and follow directions, you will succeed. She is a tough paper grader, but it is because she expects more out of an upper division class. She is very reliable, and very helpful. I highly suggest taking anything from her, as she is a professor that will prepare you for Grad. School and beyond.

Good lecturer in terms of interweaving fun stories into lecture.  My experience is that she is pretty unhelpful on the individual student basis.  I feel she holds extremely dogmatic approaches to teaching some of the subject matter.  Just because the instructor believes a certain way does not make that absolute truth.

DMAC failed to show dedication based on his passive aggressive approach to criticism and lack of creative encouragement. I expected material to cover Media, Marketing, and Communication but was met with AI, Media, and more AI. I hope to see emphasis on student creativity instead of encouraging ChatGPT and more variation in course material.

We used AI way too much in this class, I get that its becoming more sophisticated but we used it so much that there was no intellectual stimulus required to complete a majority of the assignments. I also think there was way to many assignments given in this course for it to be considered one credit hour.
Easy class, David was extremely nice and wants to get to know his students. He made the class more fun by how he taught and his personality.

Ratings.comment: This professor never cares about teaching or students.

She was a fair professor overall. Material was somewhat easy, and there was a group project at the end that was done over Zoom. She took feedback on the midterm after seeing the low average but only curved one question. She seemed to genuinely like what she was teaching, and the assignments each week were easy. Exams were kind of difficult though.

SEI.Subject: COMM
SEI.Class Name: Health Communication in Mass Mediated Contexts

Ratings.comment: Dr. Kline is the most genuine and caring professor I have had at OSU. She expects the very best from all her students. She grades hard, but leaves line-by-line feedback and is very fast at grading (sometimes the next morning). You can revise anything you turn in, so if you put in some effort you will do fine in the class.

I took Professor Kline's class this semester to fulfill a GE requirement. I thoroughly enjoyed this course. While her lectures were often boring, they were relevant to what we were working on in class, and were helpful. Despite being a tough grader, she gives extremely helpful feedback. As long as effort is put in, she'll take notice.

Very helpful professor, but unclear at times. I had to work for the grade I received in class when I went in thinking that it would be an easy GE. She's more than willing to help and has open office hours and opportunities for revision, but she is a very tough grader and expects the most out of you. Get ready to work, but hard work pays off.

This class, Language and Social Interaction, was not at all what it seemed to be. It became a speech and debate class with over half of the coursework centered around our debates. She's a tough grader but gives the option to edit and revise your work. I didn't take away anything from this class and wouldn't recommend it to anyone as an elective.

comm3629 was absolutely not what i thought it would be... a speech and debate class. wasn't too thrilled about this, especially as dr. kline is a tough grader and the structure of debate makes little sense from her lectures. however, she always gives the opportunity to make up points, which is nice.

Dr. Kline is awesome. I got an A in her class and I am taking another with her! She is definitely tough - but it's college get used to it! If you are a Comm major she will be inspiring to you! She really knows what she is talking about and is VERY energetic. If you don't like to work for your grade, or don't like comm... pick another course folks.

This woman contradicts herself left and right. For a Doctor in communications she seems to lack the ability to communicate clearly and with a matter of consistency. I've gone in for help on more than several occasions for writing papers and each time she gives advice that completely contradicts her prior critiques.

She is a DR. in communication and is by no means a good communicator! She is not clear in her expectations about projects and papers, completely unorganized! Study guides for tests were enormous and not helpful. Exams are hard. She curves. TONS of reading. I felt stressed constantly in this class because I didn't feel like I understood expectations
Couple of reflection papers. Exams are hard but she curve.
She's awful. Unorganized, never bothered to learn my name and was terrible to listen to in class. Don't ever take a class with her!
unorganized, pretty weird, and impulsive.. dont take a class with her...EVER!
Class is 2 (easy) exams, 3 papers, and 2 speeches. Class requires a strong background in source-based writing. Overall, class was challenging, but work load was manageable.
Genius professor. I'll be taking any class she teaches. The material is challenging, but Susan's so full of energy and SO helpful that you really get into it.
do the reading for her exams

She's truly a marvelous professor. I got an A, but it is difficult. Homework is way easy, but tests are hard. Do the study guide, read all the chapters, and never miss class. AND, you MUST study the handouts. The essays for sure will come from these as will some others questions. I had no interest in org comm before, but she made me love it!

Very unorganized teaching style. I was lost most of the second half of the quarter. Tons of reading and notes/lecture notes/powerpoints. Tests are hard. She grades harsh on papers too. Would never recommend this instructor because of how unorganized she is... made me feel very overwhelmed.
Very interested in her topic. However tests were riduculous. 4 pages of study guide when only 5 topics were covered on the exam.

She's very into the topic and uses lots of examples to make sure you understand, papers are easy, tests are difficult but if you really study the notes that the ta posts the tests aren't so bad, very willing to meet if you need help and gives extra class time to discuse any questions you have concerning assignments
tests were unnecessarially hard, and the papers are graded very harshly.  not a good class.  I feel like I learned nothing.

She is so into this class and is very clear and uses lots of examples.  Readings not that important, but interesting.  Short papers are VERY easy just go by the notes she gives you, and final paper not as hard as it seems at first.  Take this class, she is a very good teacher and really gets you into it
best teacher in comm dpt. however hardest in comm dpt. learned most from this teacher, very helpful, very clear, exams were very hard though.
Susan Kline is a wonderful person and instructor. She is one of the remaining bastion of learned professors who are in it for the love of the profession.

I cannot think of anyone who does not adore her that has taken her class.  She is so energetic and full of interesting ideas.  That is not to say that she is easy.  You will learn a lot, and will gain a deeper appreciation about the many facets of COMM.

My favorite professor ever at The Ohio State. Sports Media Relations is a fantastic course for anyone interested in communications, sports, PR, etc. Tim cares deeply about ensuring we get the most out of the material and is willing to do everything he can to make sure you succeed. Three major projects but all are reasonable if you put effort in.

A great teacher and class. A lot of information to get through, but you'll be okay if you don't get everything done. It's an inverted learning style so  there's a lot to do outside of class time, but like I said, you'll be okay. 3 Major assignments to do, 2/3 are group. They are big but if you split them up you'll be ok. He cares a lot ab teaching

All semester, Graham's class has been the one I look forward to throughout the week. He is inspiring, caring, full of jokes, magnificently knowledgeable, and exceedingly intelligent. I could not recommend taking a course with him more highly.

Graham is so compassionate and kind, the man is an actual angel. If you have the opportunity to take a class with him, I guarantee you will grin the whole time. I could not recommend this course more.

Professor Dixon is one of the most passionate and engaging teachers Ive ever had the privilege of studying under. His lectures are both informative and entertaining, and hes just a generally interesting person. He has real experience in his field and demonstrates concepts in practical ways that make them easy to understand. Just do the assignments.

I took COMM 2596 with Dr. Dixon and loved the course and his style. I would (and am trying to) take as many classes with him as I can. Relatively few grades so assignments matter but he gives great feedback before grades so you'd have to try to do bad and even then it would be hard not to get a good grade with him if you just pay attention.

This class and professor were the most relaxed I've ever had. Lectures are always uploaded prior to the meeting time and attendance isn't mandatory. The movie review paper was straightforward and exams aren't too difficult. I definitely recommend this class if you're looking for something interesting and relatively easy.

Very easy and interesting class, Prof Nixon is really nice and accommodating. One paper as well as several weekly readings and lectures which are extremely manageable. Exams are very easy as well if you watch the lectures. Theres weekly assignments that are short and simple would def recommend this class.

Professor Dixon's erudition is wide. The components of entire course are simple. As long as you follow every of his lecture, it would be very easy to get an A. The lecture material is easy to understand, and most of the exam questions are based on his lecture materials.
One of the best proffesors I have ever had. He was very caring and understanding during this Covid-19 time. Definately reccomend!!

Graham is one of the best professors I have had in a while! He is younger, so it makes him more relatable. Actually enjoyed coming to class and listening to his lectures. He was really understanding with the whole COVID-19, and made online class a little easier on us. He is passionate about teaching and wants the best for his students.

Graham was a great professor. I learned a lot from this class. He is very knowledgable about a lot. He also really cares about his students and wants to see them succeed. He was also always so excited to teach this class which made me excited to go to the class.

Professor Dixon is one of the most chill professors I've ever had at OSU! He cares so much about his students and always makes time to help if needed. His lectures and in-class assignments are super interesting and he always knows how to make the class enjoyable. Readings are all online and can be lengthy. Show up, take notes & study  A or higher

I'm taking Comm & Decision Making right now and it is hands down one of my favorite classes I've taken at OSU. Professor Dixon makes funny remarks throughout the class, which makes it enjoyable to go to. The attendance is based on random in-class assignments, which are always interesting. He is relatable and gives great examples for course topics.

I was very bored by the content taught in this class but this is because I took it as a GE, I am not interested in communication. Graham is passionate about what he teaches and grading in the course is very easy. Attendence (in the form of participation grade in class activities) is 25% of the grade.

This is by far my favorite COMM elective I've taken so far. You can tell that Graham really cares about the material and makes it interesting. 3 exams with your lowest score dropped (most people only end up taking the first two) and 1 essay toward the end of the course. If you're looking for a comm elective, take this class! Really enjoyed it

Graham is great! You can tell he really cares about what he's teaching, and although his lectures consist of a lot of information they always seemed to go pretty quickly. The class is only graded by a few tests, in-class assignments, and one big paper at the end, but he drops your lowest exam score which makes it pretty easy to get a decent grade.

Professor Dixon is a very dry lecturer and data is not current. He is funny at times. He is new to the University so it could have been nerves. He is generous in his grading. He does in class activities that are worth 25% of your grade. These are chosen at random. I took this class as at GE. Provides Exam study guides.

SEI.Subject: COMM
SEI.Class Name: An Introduction to Health, Environment, Risk & Science Communication

SEI.Subject: COMM
SEI.Class Name: An Introduction to Health, Environment, Risk & Science Communication

SEI.Subject: COMM
SEI.Class Name: An Introduction to Health, Environment, Risk & Science Communication

Ratings.comment: Could not recomment Dr Cho more. She is amazingly kind, which shocked me as a non-communications major. Everything you need to pass quizzes and exams is handed to you. Just make sure to do the readings and go to class and you're set. I got a perfect score on the midterm with a day of study.

I could not recommend Dr. Cho more. She's a tough professor but she isn't unfair. ATTENDANCE IS GRADED! It was a little challenging but going to every lecture made the class much easier. I also suggest rewriting the concepts in your own words. It'll make them easier to remember.

I didn't understand what was going on the first day of class and remember being worried about what the rest of the semester would be like. As it turns out, Professor Cho is amazing and a great teacher! She doesn't try to trick you on exams or assignments, but genuinely wants to know that you understand the content and are learning.

Dr. Cho is a great professor. She really cares about her students and her class is very easy to navigate and understand. The weekly workload was more than manageable, the readings were relevant and useful, and the concepts from lecture were applied outside of class. Do your due diligence in this class and you will learn some great information!

Professor Cho is awesome! She is so interactive and makes it a goal to know everyone on a personal level. I loved her class and it was super interesting to take during the corona crisis. I highly recommend her, her exams are easy, her lectures are straight forward and she is awesome!

AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID. professor potocki might be hands down the worst professor I have had so far at OSU- I took this class for general education credit, only to find out that she is allergic to giving any student anything above a B+ on essays (the bulk of the test). This class should not be difficult online, it's the professor herself.

I took this course to fulfill a GE, but if you don't have to take it I recommend finding something else. She was such a harsh grader for a 2000 level course and gave little feedback. You pretty much work on small essays over the same topic throughout the entire semester then do a final speech over that topic. Overall I would not take this again.

Do not take a class from Bridget Potocki. Her grading is the harshest I've seen, and yet her feedback is incredibly unhelpful. None of this course comes from her. She sends out YouTube links to random people's videos explaining content, gives you textbook pages to read, and calls it a day.

This is one of the worst professors i've had in my whole life. For not being an upper level course, she grades so hard. It is basically impossible to get a 100 on anything. She outlines assignments very vaguely so you don't know what she expects at all. 
Overall assignments weren't hard, don't recommend that a GE find another class.

For some reason this class is WAY harder than what it should be. It was my lowest grade cause she's a very hard grader. The work volume is manageable if you keep up every week, but she's the worst grader ever and that's the only reason why my grade was so low. I would recommend finding an easier class to fulfill GE if you can.

Overall horrible professor. I took her communication class 2367 and definitely would not take again. She does not provide good feedback. In fact I took it with my roommate and she would give us the same feedback for both of our papers. She also a strict grader and never really gave anyone a 100 on any assignment that is not a discussion post.
Lot of busy work, but nothing too difficult. Concept maps were pretty strictly graded, exams were difficult as well. Required studying and planning ahead.
Overall, this class wasn't awful. There was a decent amount of papers and 2 speeches that you just recorded online. Clear guidelines but doesn't always give great feedback.
She assigns homework over break... AVOID!

Just read the syllabus and do the work the professor tells you to do and you will be fine, the class is not that bad at all. It can be a lot sometimes but overall if you keep up with it you will be chilling. The professor is okay, but it is hard to judge how good she is with an online class cause you barely see or hear from her.

Lectures she posts aren't her own, and the material is very heavy for an intro-level class, so be ready to be confused at times. Assignment descriptions/rubrics can be confusing. On some assignments, we would lose points if we were not "top of the class," even if the graders themselves acknowledged we had met all the requirements in the rubric.

I honestly do not know anything about the professor, as the lectures are not hers and she directs us to the TAs for help. The thing I dislike most about this course is that assignments are due during breaks. This is the only course I have ever taken that requires you to work during your break.

She actually uses someone else's lectures for some reason, so she's not the one teaching you the material. The quizzes, projects, and activities aren't hard. HOWEVER, Her tests are very difficult for no reason, and are worth a majority of your grade. If you have to take this class choose someone else! The average for tests is a D, with a curve B...

I think this class was pretty easy, not as stressful as my other classes. Although she is a tough grader on the papers she gives you the option to do revisions on them. As long as you do the work and don't miss any assignment you should get an A. Overall she's a good prof who cares about your overall grade and wants you to do well.
literally impossible to do well when she gives barely any information on papers and then slaps a C in your face for every single one. Good luck, you'll need it, that's all I can say.

The class was asynchronous when I took it. She did not create her own recorded lectures or questions and did very little work for the class. She was not very communicative, and when she did email you back, she was rude about it. Very unprofessional. Exam averages were very low, and navigating the course online was not easy. Would not take again.

Wish there was more consistency with the Intercultural Communication course with grading and timing on grading. Tough grader on writing which is fine, but wish she was clearer with what she wanted. Seemed frustrated that students didn't understand her method of writing. Was nice enough in person.

The class was decent. Sometimes when it comes to writing her responses can be rude and she doesn't offer much feedback to be better, yet says she wants us to improve our writing. Lectures were not straight forward and seemed all over the place. Felt like she wanted us to write like her. Class was okay overall

Mrs. Potocki is just a fine teacher in my opinion. The class is super boring and at times can be unclear. The exams are not very easy and navigating the tri-weekly group projects can be very confusing. I would say just try and be familiar with the course page on Carmen and read her directions very carefully. Not super helpful when you email her.

Not forgiving by any means. Does not teach any of her own lectures nor does she create any of her own material. Requires more CREP credits than there are available CREPs and does not provide an alternative. Unhelpful and mean when you email her for help. Most people struggle in the class and the exam average is around a 40%.

Bridget was super patient with me while I had a meltdown throughout spring semester. Let me turn in things super late without judgment, but please don't take her leniency for granted. She's an absolute queen and was a godsend to work with during the pandemic. 10/10 would work with her again.

As long as you were a decent writer this course was pretty smooth sailing. Prof has a dry sense of humor which I enjoyed, but was a bit difficult to reach outside of class. Would recommend this course to anyone as the assignments were pretty minimal (3 small-ish ones each week) and there were no formal exams.
Class is an easy GE. Prof is accessible but a bit rude and dismissive with feedback and accommodation. Just skim through and do the modules on time and you'll likely be okay.

The class is not too hard. A few papers and speeches, but she is willing to help. I always wrote my papers ahead of the due date and went to her office hours to discuss them and I always got A's. I got the book and used it on the online exams because she does not really go over that information. Overall pretty easy class.

Take this class if you can! You get real world experience with a real client. The class is a lot of work and a lot of out of class time work for your group project. This class will look great on a resume.

I learned a lot of practical skills. Did not love the group project due to my group but the class will not be completely ruined if you have a bad group. Mary is great at offering help and advice, for both inside and outside the classroom. I highly recommend taking a class with her.
I absolutely love Mary! She has incredible experience and knows how to best prepare students for the professional world.

This class was hard and your group can make or break it. It can feel overwhelming at times, but other times there is not much work to do. I really loved how Mary laid the class out and broke things up into sections. She is also super helpful and personable. Truly the best professor I have ever had!

Mary is by far one of my favorite professors I have had at OSU. She genuinely cares about all of her students and gives them great advice relating to both in class materials or a future career. This is my second class I had with her and I recommend any student to take at least one of her classes.

She is very knowledgeable about media planning. Is very helpful with group work and feedback. Weekly book quizzes that are open note. Exams (2) are difficult so make sure that you study. Has connections to possible future media jobs as well.

Mary is super nice and caring. It is obvious she wants her students to succeed and gain real world experience. I will say her reading quizzes are super difficult but it won't bring you down too much since there are so many points in the class. Overall, I would take Mary for 4337, she makes a difficult course enjoyable.

The entire semester was a group project-you have no say who is in your group. You do peer evaluations but I think it's just to make the students feel like the ones who slacked got a lower grade, but they aren't in the gradebook. I had taken her courses before and liked the structure-very straightforward. This class not so much. Quizzes 10x harder.

Great professor, learned a lot that from her that i can use in a future career. She is extremely caring and wants you to succeed, but you must be at class to do well! Weekly quizzes so theres no exam at the end so make sure to stay on top of those.

There are no exams in this class just weekly Proctorio quizzes that are very detailed. All the questions are meant to trick you and don't go into the concepts learned but rather the irrelevant details. The Proctorio quizzes are in place of an exam and if you do poorly on one it really hurts your grade.

Mary is a good lecturer but her quizzes and exams are extremely difficult. All of her questions are meant to trick you and are very detailed. If you don't know every concept word for word out of the textbook you won't do well in this class. Assigned weekly readings are impossible to keep up with and way too long.
Best lecturer of Communication major!

Mary is a terrific professor! I liked her a lot. She gets to know students well and is very caring. If you show up to lectures and participate, she will teach you what she is expecting from you in terms of assignments. Great class and a great atmosphere to be in when she's teaching. I would definitely any of her other classes again!

I liked Mary! She seems to really care about her students and she is a fair grader. You just have to follow the rubrics and what she teaches in lecture to get an A. Don't miss class much because there are participation assignments for points that she doesn't let you make up. The online textbook is short and painless to read for the quizzes.

Mary is a good teacher. This class revolves around a group project which can be very confusing and a lot of work. Her exams are somewhat hard. Her grading is fair, but rarely gives perfect scores even on things you worked long and hard on. Overall I enjoyed taking her class.

Mary is a great professor, she takes time to get to know her students and makes the class extremely fair. attendance is mandatory but she keeps you very engaged making class time go by quickly. lots of opportunities to receive and make up credit. one of the first professors ive ever had. i learned alot from her
great teacher

Comm 3160- silvia is an awful professor. she has a german accent which makes some things difficult to understand, her lectures are SO dry. try at all costs to avoid. class content wasn't too difficult but it's not worth the stress.

I've had her for 3 classes so far, & even though I used to think she was a difficult professor, I finally realized she is my favorite. She is tough, you have to study, but I never used a book. I just studied the notes &got good grades. She seems to care about her students, and wants to know everyone's name. Not perfect english, but understandable.

I found Dr. Knobloch-Westerwick's accent and tone are very hilarious. The lectures are boring and long. An 80 minutes lecture feels like a year. It seems like she doesn't want to teach much but keep asking if we have any comments. However, the tests are easy and the textbook is very useful.

I personally did not find her rude or unhelpful, she's just extremely confusing and doesn't teach much honestly. This class was basically ALL group work. We had one big final project that was terrible & her grading scale and rubric were confusing. We also had 3 tests that weren't too bad though. Go to class, she has attendance/participation.
Want an easy grade? Take this class. Other than that, don't expect to be learning anything. Confusing, hard exams and boring lecturer. Tons of group work.
She was awful. Rude and unclear in lectures. Don't take a class with her. She doesn't care about students
Class was easy, she was not helpful at all if you did need help. Researcher posing as a professor.

Instructor was genuinely interested in helping students with concepts and theory. Relevant, well-chosen course materials. Fair grading. Gave students plenty of opportunities to collaborate and learn as a group.

I was really excited about taking this class but to find out the way it is taught by this professor is an extreme bore.  If you just go to class and fill in the blanks on the slide and use her study guides for the tests, you can get an easy A.

I really enjoyed her class. As long as you attended her lectures, paid decent attention, and took a few notes you were basically guaranteed an A. She was always generally helpful and understanding and graded her exams fairly. She even made the content interesting. I am definitely going try to take another class with her.

Never work with her. She will send ask the hundreds of survey taker send answers to your email! Ask you to do things in a quarter that you are not her TA, and then she will report to the department saying you do an awful job. My dear OSU TAs, never, ever...

2 multiple choice exams, but she tries to make them confusing. She also rambles a lot. The material is interesting, she just makes it take too long. FYI: She never referenced it or quizzed us on the readings in the course packet- if I could go back I wouldn't buy it.

I can't stand this professor. Her tests are awful because she doesn't write in English well. Her lectures are bad because she can't convey ideas. I found her to be rude to students. This is NOT a grad level class. Try and find another professor for this class!

Lectures are boring, but the material is interesting. Very nice, my only complaint is that she refused to change our Thursday final after we explained that no professor gives a comm final during finals week.

I am a dedicated student with a 4.0, I study and do the work. Dr. Hayes was a TERRIBLE instructor! His "study guide" was a joke and the wording on his exams is confusing. I swear he wants you to do poorly! The final paper was great (I love doing research) but his exams and his attitude are horrible for a teaching environment. Avoid him if possible.

Took this class a while ago. Andrew is an amazing scholar and teacher. You people bashing him should stop complaining and start putting in required work as students. Jeez! Yes, his classes are tough, but I got a TON out of them. World class expert on the subject matter! Great guy! Super clear! Expect to be doing a lot of work!

This course was a glorified stats class on COMM steroids. Worst class I have ever taken in my three years at OSU. Hayes has no interest in teaching and it shows. TA's were just as clueless as him. Impossible to pay attention to. Avoid taking this class if you can.

Arrogant. Poor test writing skills. The TA Laura gave wrong answers for the study guide (contradicting my correctly filled out study guide,)making an already very poorly worded test even more of a nightmare. When I approached him after class with questions the first week he was very dismissive- did not appear to have much interest in students.

Horrible class. Honestly was just a stats class on an ego trip. This professor obviously does not really want to be teaching us low life undergrads, but just does it because he has to. Study guides were hilarious, So useless.In some sort of joke to mess with my mind I got an A on the 15 page final paper (which we had in addition to a final exam!)
Horrible, horrible class. Exams are impossible to pass, nobody gets an A on them. It's outrageous.
He was def tough. He wasnt too boring, but I found it really hard to WANT to go to class. He is very full of himself, as well.

Very boring teacher. He spoke in a mono-tone voice every class and his lectures were pointless. I think i took a nap each time. You will NEVER need the book, so don't waste the $100. So boring avoid at all cost.

I can not figure out why people say this man's class is easy. Dr. Hayes sucks. He is the worst teacher I have ever had. He is arrogant and going to his class made me want to die.

The tests were ridiculously difficult and they were worded very poorly. His classes were boring and neither he nor the class wanted to be there. I dont know how but I managed a B and i'm glad i don't have to sit through that again.

worst prof at osu. only word to describe his classes: painful. he is so so so so so so boring, i have never seen more than 3 people awake in any lecture. dont even bother with office hours unless you want to feel angry and insulted. i am a straight a student and this class was impossible. .

Dr. Hayes' lectures are pretty boring but he does take random attendance in class which will help him determine grades. The exams are extremely easy -- he passes out the test questions beforehand and the research project is fairly easy as well.

Seriously, this class is so easy.  He givves you all midterm questions in advance, so there is no reason why you should do bad on examsThe paper is not too bad and niether are homework assignments.  He isn't the nicest guy in the world, but that doesn't matter because everyone should do well in this class.

very easy!! exam questions passed out before test and they were exactly the same and he drops one of three midterms. if you go you will get an A, sometimes boaring but who cares the class was so easy,

This was the hardest class I have ever taken. The midterm was extremely painful (it made me cry)! However, Andrew is a fantastic professor and he really knows how to teach this stuff. People are so full of crap. this is the EASIEST class I've taken at the school. The lectures are clear and he gives out all of the exam questions days before the exam. Great class, would take it again

Definitely a researcher... not a good instructor, but only because he's not helpful at all. I had little to no problems w/ him, but I've definitely heard other people's horror stories.  Too bad this class is required.

he is a bad communicator, can not get his points across. He confuses students rather than clarify materials.

Mr. Hayes is very talented as a researcher.  His communication skills are better than the day he started, but he has problems socializing and sharing with others.  He is funny at times, and I can see that he is trying.  Much like Dr. Glynn, he is somewhat

amazing teacher!  always willing to help and totally flexible when things come up
Steve is amazing. Best teacher at OSU. The class is hard, but worth it. Favorite OSU experience hands down.
Steve is the man. I loved him and loved his class. Very helpful and actually cares about his students.

Horrible prof, like others said he read directly from the slides. He was very rude via email when asked for help not only with me but other students. Test are cool if you study, the presentation project is a COMPLETE waste of time, and it's only worth 10 points. I hated everything about this class. So I could be biased.

I don't like this class at all. It is so boring. He does nothing but reads off of the slides which he also puts online. I don't think I learned anything in this class.

Terrible class. Very unorganized and extremely tough grader. Doesn't post grades to Carmen. He does news quizzes every week but doesn't tell you which news sources to look at. Had to drop this class. Take this class with a different professor.
Hated this class.

I had him for Media Ethics; a great course and one that pushed the boundaries of how we think/react with media. That is all thanks to Professor Schwartz. Some may find him difficult or dull, but he knows his stuff, has been around, and is more than fair. Just do not be predictable and hackneyed in class comments and papers and you'll be JUST FIIINE

Phenomenal instructor. Really knows what he's talking about. Critically engages with students, despite the course being heavily lecture based. You can tell he wants his students to do well. Take his class if you're genuinely interested in learning about Media Law but not if you want an easy A.
Interested in teaching real skills. Will help students who want to learn

News Quizzes and Style Book quizzes are easy points.  Does not lecture really.  Just has students give mini presentations per chapter. A LOT of busy work. Very hard to understand exactly what he is looking for in papers. Fails to clarify about each assignment. Write everything clearly, exactly to the point. No fluff, no fun.  Tests 50 T/F Hard

Very boring! but not too hard if you write exactly how he tells you to, which is very dry and stale. doesnt really seem very interresting in helping his students, only likes to tell them theyre wrong because they don't write word for word how he likes.

Not too bad. He has news quizzes from current events out of the news that will have you reading 3-4 newspapers a day, which is time consuming. If you want an A, go to class, talk, and write the way he wants you too. Even tho his writing method sucks and is boring, if you want an A go along with it. I did learn from him though.
Tough teacher but he grades fairly.  He is concerned about how well you do in the class and out of it.  You have to work hard, go to class, and participate, but you'll learn a lot.
No Comments

Interesting guy.  He can be pretty funny at times and I buy that he's interested in helping students.  He's a little weird, but I suppose who isn't.  Class on the other hand is a pain in the ass, way more work than they indicate before you take it.  Most stressful class of my college career.
This teacher is genuinely interested in teaching and doesn't mind helping his students at all.  He knows what he's talking about.  Amazing professor overall.

tough guy, but very fair. also, very willing to help with any type of questions regarding careers, internships etc. definitly wants you to succeed. he seems like he would help you with anything if you just work hard. nice guy too
very tough but fair
Very helpful to anyone who takes the time to go to his office hours.
Toughest professor I ever had. Also the best.
This class is interesting for anyone interested in law, just go to class
Boring lectures and ridiculously hard tests.
Makes the material fun and interesting.
Great professor. Grades kind of hard, but worth taking.

Jen is a very fair professor. Attendance is required and you can't use electronics in class, however she's pretty clear on expectations. If you do what you're told you'll get a decent grade. Attend class, clear presentation topics with her, and meet the basic requirements as outlined and you'll do fine. Note: Didn't open book and got A-.

Terrible professor.  Show up to class or she kills your grade.  Tests are insanely hard, she words them where you don't understand it. She's awesome. Truly one of the good people. Too bad she's only a grad student because she tops real tenured professors.
shes great take her
she is very nice, not great at returning emails or posting grades. class was easy and no exams.

class was easy. no exams, just a few papers and quizzes. and you learn a lot and get to discuss a lot of interesting news. And she is by far the cutest teacher ive ever had. every day i look forward to seeing her.
difficult class, but very worthwhile. cute, too!
Very tough, but super rewarding. Will repeat +1. Totally hot, too +10 chili pepper.

Very helpful and enthusiastic teacher. Made the class enjoyable. Grading was very fair.
Great guy. Very enthusiastic and fair.
Awesome teacher.  He really cares about his students doing well.  You absolutely have to read before class, but its very easy to get an A if you do the work.

Jim is the greatest teacher I have had the pleasure of having. He is so knowledgable and interesting it makes you want to succeed even more. There are no lectures, it is just a short quiz where you have to answer 10 out of 15-20 question right to get a 100. Reading is a must because after the quizzes it just class discussion. Very fun class.
Jim is an amazing teacher! Very helpful and I highly recommend him. If you work hard, you will do well. The midterm is hard, so just study for it. You'll be fine!
This professor is one of the best ones I have had hear at OSU. Very willing to help and boost your grade any way he can, generally cares for his students. GREATTT

Jim is a rare teacher at OSU. His primary concern is to help you become a better public speaker and truly wants you to do well in his class (will help you with extra bonus points to boost your score). Take this class if you wish to become a better speaker. STUDY for the midterm!!It is challenging but there is only one and that's it- Great class!

If you're looking for an easy class with decent instructor, Dr. Kam's Comm368 is the way to go. She tries to make the lectures interesting with viedo clips and personal examples, but the bottom line is that material just isn't very interesting or challenging.
so so...

When she walks in the room you're shocked that this liberal old lady that wears the same thing everyday is teaching you communication and popular culture. And then she begins to speak. She encourages you to engage in dialogue. And if you are engaged, you just might learn some incredible things from her that will truly change your life. Take her.

Dervin is amazing. If you take her class, you're learning from the absolute best. She's in the top 1% of all communication scholars (VERY well published) so in all honesty, while it may be a 'different' kind of class for you, it's actually a real honor to learn from her.

Dr. D was an incredible, helpful professor and the class has propelled my career in journalism by leaps and bounds. The syllabus is spelled out in extreme clarity.  Deadlines were flexible and attendance was only required 50% of the time.  Extremely helpful course, would recommed to all journalism students. My interviewing skills have benefited!

She's crazy.  She loves to talk about herself and you never really learn anything.  Do the work, don't waste your time on buying the books, go to class just to figure out her book of a syllabus and get your participation.  No way to not get an A if you do the work.  You can keep on turning in assignments until you get the grade you want.

this woman is insane.  i'm pretty sure she makes up stories.  you will spend the ENTIRE quarter going over the 22 page syllabus and even on the last day you will still be confused.  If you want a good laugh and stories to tell your friends, i would suggest taking her.  with that said, avoid at all costs.

You will learn how to get the most out of an interview from Dr. D. She is charming(& a wee bit quirky). She is clearly dedicated to teaching and to Sense-Making Methodology.   She teaches didactically (ie, by discussion rather than lecture) which makes the time fly. The assignments are not due on a strict schedule, so self-discipline is essential.

Dervin's pop. culture course is much easier than her interviewing course, largely due to the content of study. Dervin's classroom is a fun atmosphere for learning. She offers great insight into the larger world of Comm. The go-at-your-own-pace structure made balancing my class work a breeze (don't procrastinate!) Excellent course and professor!

Dervin's class is not easy for many students because you actually have to THINK. I thought it was appropriately challenging and uniquely rewarding. Dervin goes the extra mile to make complex information accessible to students and she is continuously offering help. This is a teacher who loves to TEACH, not just to lecture from a power point.

Dr. Dervin's class is not easy! That being said I can't think of too many negative things to say about her.  She makes her students challenge themselves and work hard. To be successful in the class students must be organized and set their own schedule.  Some may not like it, I did, because I feel it will be useful to me in the real world. THANKS!

Although she has intellectual and intriguing things to say, her ways of saying them caused me to disrespect her.  She is very self righteous and bashes the university whenever she can find the chance. An intellectual of the highest level. Amazingly articulate, very thought-provoking professor. If you didn't 'get it' . . . it's not her fault. She's as clear as can be, and worth listening to.

One of the rudest people I've ever come into contact with.  Speaks often of her openness and acceptence of all but shows just the opposite.  She honestly thinks she invented critical thinking to which I would ask her to think a little more critically.
Rough exterior, but awesome teacher!  Loved her interviewing techniques.  GO to class and pay attention to details of required assignments and you will do well! NO books! NO exams! BUT A LOT of work!

This class is great. If you go, you will have no problem whatsoever...and If you don't go...you will still not get anything lower than a B. She gives EC and second chances on exams...take this class!

Friendly, exams straight forward, just show up to class, shes a fun professor, down to earth. Would recommend/take her again.
