Take a class with Morgan if you can!!! She's one of the best COMM professors I've had so far. Weekly quizzes, discussion post and replies (all easy if you read book and watch lecture videos). No exam but a big final project. Definitely recommend!
Super nice and always posted clear, easy to understand lecture videos for each week. Good teacher overall!

It's been almost two years since I've taken his course. I'm about to graduate this upcoming May and I can honestly say that he is the only professor that challenged me. His class is the only class I took anything away from during my studies here at OSU. The comm department should model themselves after Dan.

Dan is the best professor I've ever had. Journalism is my passion, and it's so clearly his, too. He gives great feedback, brings inspirational guest speakers to class, and forces students to be the best they can be. If you're a journalism student, he'll change your college career - in the best way possible.

Dan is a professor that will push you past your abilities. You will become a better writer regardless of your current writing ability. He is a tough grader and expects professional quality but is fair. The only professor I've ever had that will give extra credit upon request. Highly recommend.

If you're not a journalism major, run for the hills.  This class was very interesting except he graded us like we were writing for the Columbus Dispatch (this class was a Communications class NOT journalism).  Harder for COMM students.  This class is clearly biased towards journalism majors.  Harsh grader.  Prepare to work or continue running.

This class requires a lot of work but it is all worth it. Dan is hard but you can tell how much he cares about helping you succeed. He has plenty of real world experience and brings in helpful speakers. Bends over backwards to help students who show they are trying. If you want an easy A dont take it but if you want to learn something take it.

Dan is awesome. His class literally changed my life. Dan clearly loves journalism, and he makes you want to love journalism too. Taking his class opens you up to incredible opportunities to write and meet people who are doing what you want to do. I would recommend that everyone take one of Dan's classes before they leave OSU. He is awesome.

By all means he's not the easiest prof but if you take him, you will become a better writer and a more civically engaged person. He's honest, fair, objective...he cares about his students actually learning practical skills in 423. He's a good guy and I recommend taking him.
He's super interesting

He is truly one of the good people. If you work hard in his class, you will learn a lot and be graded fairly. If you slack off, he won't brush it off. His experience speaks for itself...you're learning from a guy who was a leader in his field...now he's teaching OSU students and advising The Lantern. The kind of professor you won't forget about.
He's a great talker and an awesome listener. He isn't easy but he works well with the students.

If you're trying to just get by with minimal effort and a decent grade, don't take him. If you want to learn a ton and be challenged, take him --his lectures are engaging and he tells stories of when he worked at the Associated Press in Washington D.C. He's a class act and in my opinion he's hands down one of the best professors at OSU.

If you feel like you're not actually learning anything meaningful in your other classes -- take a class with Dan Caterinicchia. For example, he makes his students read newspapers/watch TV news because it makes them more engaged with journalism issues...it's amazing how just by consuming news you gain a stronger sense of self and he makes it happen

Incredible instructor - you leave this intro level course feeling significantly more prepared for professional and news writing. It will not be the easiest course you have ever taken, but you will WANT to work hard to learn from this guy - he has a phenomenal journalism resume, and wants to share his experience with you. Take this class.

This guy is definitely someone who expects excellence in everything you do with a minimum amount of help from him. He has a huge ego and a lot of self-interest, but the man knows what he is talking about and can teach a lot to those who are self-reliant enough to keep up. His style is a bit subjective and can take some getting used to, though.

Dan expects each of his students to deliver professional journalism. For prospective journalists, Dan's teaching style is one that will definitely help build your skills. He knows his stuff and he's tough but fair. Students do 4 articles, AP Style quizzes, news quizzes, and in-class exercises.

Very challenging but once I adjusted to his system everything was great.   I learned more in this class than any other class I took.    He really cares about helping students succeed.    He even helped me with my law school application a year after I took his class.  Very knowledgeable and funny.   You will love this class, but be ready to work.

I have now taken two classes with Olga, and both were mediocre at best.

One of my favorite professors so far. Gives extra credit! Goes over alot of material but the exams are very fair and if you go to class they are an easy A. Not alot of homework or readings outside of class. 10/10 would recommend.

I have had Olga for 3 classes now and I love her classes. Her lectures are fun to listen to especially since she uses real world examples that are a big help when it comes to exams. I was freaked out when I read the comment about her. I am glad that I didn't drop her class. I've been taking two classes with her, and the structure is the same. 4 exams (drop 1), watch documentaries, papers, EC. She gives detailed study guides for the exams. There are also simple class practices where you need to attend for participation points.

so when i read all of these reviews, i thought i was screwed for the class. honestly, you don't need to pay attention in class (you can just cram the night before) and not even have the textbook (paid $350 for it and never ONCE opened it) because you can just make flashcards based off her lecture notes. yes, it's super boring, but not difficult!

Yes, her lectures are dreadfully boring. However, I never struggled in her classes. I'll say textbook isn't required, I pulled a good grade out of my ass without it. You can find all answers to her study guides from the slides. Lots of information in every lecture. I don't mind being in her class.

I've been doing great for all of my semesters but she screwed my last one. I haven't been bothering to attend classes because it's a complete waste of time since she only read off slides. I did well for exams because I studied the textbook, which means the slides were completely useless since I didn't even go through them. My only B in 4 semesters!

If you don't want to mess up your GPA, then stay away,  I would not complain about a hard class; however, her lectures and PowerPoint don't  help with the test. Questions are not clearly worded, nor she is any help outside of class. Any sentence in the book is open for fill-in the blank. She read and explain what was on the PowerPoint and that it.

Reads straight off the powerpoints and often sounds confused as to what she is talking about. So much information on each exam and each exam's average is around a 60% because she does not teach very effectively for how difficult her tests are. I am a straight A student and am struggling to get a C in this course. Avoid her at all cost. Thick accent

I love Professor Nisbet's sense of humor. I thought his lectures were very interesting and I like how he combined the material with modern-day issues and events. I also felt the class itself was very difficult, thankfully the lowest test grade gets dropped (including the final exam itself) and there are many chances to get a higher grade.

Nisbet has a great sense of humor which made this class only somewhat enjoyable. Otherwise, the material is dense and boring. There is SO much content on the tests that it's hard to study for the exams because it seems like it covers EVERYTHING. My biggest advice is to go to class and do all of the extra credit that he provides, especially CREP

He's hands down one of the best professors in terms of his humors. Isn't so hard if just listen in class. Little bit of review before the midterms would be enough. Not so hard class with a great professor. The content is a little boring but Erik makes the class light and funny that I don't, like sigh when I go to class. Go for his class definitely

Erik was a good professor. He tried really hard to interact with the class and to get us all to engage in conversation, but it was an 8 am so that didn't work too well. He is really funny though! 3 exams and a final. Exams were tough but if you did well on the exams, the final was optional. He also rounds your final grade up. I enjoyed his class!

Erik is a very nice professor. This was a mandatory class for me, and I am happy I had him as a professor. He makes lectures fun by engaging with the class. He genuinely likes teaching, you can tell through lectures. His exams and tough but he does give the opportunity for 3% extra credit which REALLY helps your grade! He is always willing to help!
Eric mainly gives information that is already in the textbook. However, if you go to the lecture you will find the material for the class easy to remember due to examples he gives.

I took this class for my major and it was really boring, but very straightforward. Majority of the content on the tests is presented in class, and also posted on Carmen. I didn't go to class and I still managed an A. Erik will answer questions if you have them, and he rounds up your final grade which saved my life (92.5 becomes 93).

The exams cover most of the lecture that he posts online on Carmen, but there are a few questions straight from the book. If you can get a class google doc going for each midterm, it will be super helpful for everyone in this class.

Erik is really great. He teaches every lecture with no notes and likes to engage the class. He also shows funny/relevant clips and lots of movies. The only thing is that his exams are impossible. Also, they are pretty badly timed. The second exam is so so so so so hard because there is so much material but there is basically nothing for the last.

I LOVED this professor. He was hilarious and made class very easy. You just need to keep with the notes and go to lecture. Only downside to the class was I didn't need the textbook for it, and it cost $160 used. I would just copy the sections you need and forget about the book.

Boring class, but the professor was lively and kept things pretty interesting. He went too fast for notes, though, and I HATED that he gave us a group assignment in a senior GEC course. I had such a hard time being able to make time to meet my partner. Nix the group project and I'd reccomend this class.

I'm in the science comm. class (I'm an ENR student). I didn't find him snobby at all like the other posts and I didn't get the impression he thought he was better than everyone. He is very accepting and helpful to everybody. There is an attendance grade and most assignments were pretty easy if you put in effort. My favorite class this term.

I would recommend this class with Erik. If you read and pay attention in class its pretty simple and easy. Three exams, two writing assignments, easy online quizzes plus attendance for only 10 of the days.

Great and interesting class! Even when the material is dry, he shows youtube clips on a regular basis to liven it up! He lets you out early, his exams and quizzes are easy, you have xtra credit opportunities, and you don't have to buy a textbook! = AWESOME class :)

The class is unbelievably boring, however Erik made it palatable. He understands there is a lot of material and it is dry. He peppers in entertaining clips and lets the class out a little early. There are 2 homework, 3 tests, attendance an 6 quizzes. The prof. is not the problem its the class that sucks. Recommended.

This is the second class i have taken with Erik and again I really enjoyed it.  He keeps his lectures interesting and engaging.  However, attendence was required, but led to easy points! weekly quizzes and 4 exams, but you get to drop the lowest one.  Overall, intersting class and not to hard if you pay attention and do the quizzes!

Class is not as hard as everyone makes it out to be.  If you ATTEND lectures and study the main points of each theory you will be fine.  You have weekly online quizzes that you get 3 chances to take i reccommend taking them WITHOUT your notes at least one time becuase the quiz questions are a lot like exam ones and let you know what to focus on

His midterms and finals are very difficult. Class average on them ranged from a D to a C. Remember, this is a basic GEC. He did though give Extra Credit to make up for his hard exams, that still did not give me an A.

he is terrible! he lectures the class and it is very difficult to take notes and understand what he is saying. he issues weekly online quizzes that are cake. his midterms and finals are so difficult that is nearly impossible to get even a b- for a midterm or final. he makes you a study guide but the exams do NOT relate to the study guides at all
worst communications professor i have had so far. wont answer emails and makes study guides that dont halp with exams
Exams can be kind of tricky but not if you really pay attention to lecture and follow up with reading the book. Online quizzes will let you know what to focus on for the exams.

He is a terrible teacher. Just because he is from Cornell, he thinks he is above the world. Lectures are boring and pointless for comprehension given that he doesn't give any outlines and flies through slides with a lot of info on them. AVOID at all costs!!!

This teacher gives only two tests (midterm and final) which are 80% of your grade and online quizzes worth 20%. The exams you should expect no higher than a 70% after studying for 5 days all night at the library. His lectures are boring and all he does is show youtube videos that dont help when exams come. Thinks hes better because of cornell.Avoid
If this guy says Alright? one more time after a sentence, I'm gonna throw my $90, piece of $h!t book at him!!!

Few assignments, so grades are worth a lot. However, he gives little feedback on papers and grades harshly. Lectures are boring and only saved by constant Daily Show clips. Seems pretty snobby when it comes to teaching, like since he is from Cornell, he is better than everyone. Useless class content is treated like the be-all end-all of journalism.

50 pg review sheet for our 1st midterm! Don't give us one at all.  And if anyone is studying strategic communications, then you know it is very descriptive. He wants you to know every little aspect about it on the exams. And might I remind you this book was 21 chapters, we went over all of them, and they were 40-50pgs long ea. Awful class all over.

I have never enjoyed an 8:30 class more than the one I took with Dr. Ewoldsen. HIs lectures are interesting, motivational, and I guarantee you'll leave with laughing at least once. Dr. Ewoldsen also really cares about his students and is more than willing to sit down for a chat whenever. Exams are easy if you go to lecture! It's worth it anyhow!
Great teacher

Took it as an online course. Very bad experience. Weekly emails always had sass or attitude in them. Don't think Prof Ewoldsen realizes everyone took his class for an easy A and no one really has an interest in actually learning. Tough grader and makes exams fairly difficult.

He is honestly the best instructor I have ever had in my educational history. He's passionate about not only what he teaches and researches, but also in constantly telling students they can make a difference. Go to class because he takes questions that are only in lecture and read the book, as he takes questions from only the text as well.
The best professor I've ever had, hands-down.

The tests are composed of material that's only learned in lecture as well as only in the reading so it is important that you read both. The notes are always posted online however. There was the opportunity to complete more CREP studies for up to 3% extra credit

One of my absolute favorite professors. Has a tremendous amount of belief in his students to do great things. Even in a lecture hall of 300 students he can still engage and entertain them. Learning is organic and easy. Has high expectations, but not outrageous. Attend the lectures and crack open the textbook once in a while and it'll be an easy A.

Great teacher who truly believes that his students can change the world. The book really helps you to learn and understand his lectures, and I used it to help study for his difficult exams. If you go to class and use the book to study, you can easily get a higher grade.
Take this online it's really easy and flexible. Go through the slides which are very helpful If you participate as you're meant to, you'll get an A.

Dr. Ewoldsen is one of my favorite professors EVER. He is witty, honest, and sometimes inappropriate (which is hilarious). He is inspirational and again and again reminds us that he believes we can have an impact on the world. I wouldn't say his tests are easy per say, but they are fair. Study, go to class on a semi regular basis, & you'll be fine.

There was not a class I enjoyed more than this one.  Dr. Ewoldsen teaches with such passion that you have no choice but to be engaged in his lectures.  I felt like he truly loves and understands what he's talking about, and he really cares about students and their success.  I would recommend him to anyone.

Dr. Ewoldsen teaches with such passion and that is what I absolutely love about him. I actually looked forward to going to class. He teaches the material in a way that made it interesting to me, and I believe if I had the class with anyone else, I would've fallen asleep. He is phenomenal. He didn't only teach me about COMM--he taught me about life.

Great professor, he defiantly teaches with passion and that's what i love about him. He isn't afraid to tell you about his point of view on things but he also respects your views on topics. He opens your eyes on being vocal with what you believe in and that the world isn't going to change if your not willing to change it yourself.

He was basically a flawless individual. He taught the class with such passion and was super interesting. He was hilarious and a super cool guy. The class is easy if you pay attention and read the book.

One of my favorite professors so far. He was very liberal and will speak his mind, but allows you to have your own opinion as well. His class was always interesting and the exams weren't difficult once you learn how to study his material. I would definitely recommend this professor!
Extremely easy. Never attended class and all his questions come DIRECTLY from his powerpoint, no surprises.
Interesting guy, VERY liberal. His ideology kind of affects how he presents the class material.
He was an awesome professor! Super interesting, finny, and passionate about what he does. His exams are super simple, especially if you do his study guides. Most definitely can get an A!

He's hilarious! And really knows his stuff! Powerpoint Slides are posted to Carmen prior to class, so you only need to write what you see as important. Skim the book to reinforce theory. Midterm was take home. The longest paper you write is 5 pgs. You get attendance points with the possibility of extra credit. Final was a short speech on any topic.

He is a great teacher and you can tell he loves the subject. The midterm was take home and the final is a speech. There are several assignments but hes the only english teacher that prefers shorter papers since he hates grading. Great teacher, loved the class!

Our midterm was take home and the "final" was just a project that we got to choose ourselves. As long as you used the theory explained in class and had sufficient evidence and showed up (you got 50 pts just for going to class!), you should easily get a B at the lowest. Essays weren't hard, just time consuming.
Cool guy. Attend class or read the book to get a good grade.
Fairly easy class, great professor! Such a great guy; super encouraging! Yes the class is a bit easy, but I thought it was interesting and he was very engaging! I highly recommend him!

Easy A. 6 online quizzes each with a week to complete. 3 exams. 3 hours of research participation (only worth 7% of your grade). All you really need are the power points (online) and google, but the book helps if you never go to class (like me). Cake walk.
Very unorganized and takes a decade to grade anything. Would not recommend.

Overall, he was fine, but his style just reminded me too much of a high school teacher. He gets mad at people who have their phones out, and he says things like "see me after class." I thought we were way past that. Also, the way he graded participation and attendance was a little strange.

David is a great professor.   His class was easy.  It's a hybrid class so the lectures and materials are primarily online.  He asks you to buy a book, but that's it, a $10 book that you will need for quizzes.   You'll need to show up for class, and you'll want to.  It's a very discussion heavy class but David makes it easy to give input.

She did a really good job making the lackluster content of the slides easy to manage. The class ends with everybody giving a presentation and writing an 8-page paper, but she made it easy to tailor those projects to cater to our interests which made the whole process way more enjoyable.

Seems like a difficult class at first, but she explains it very well. Although I asked many questions about the assignment, she responded with patience. She is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the subject. Additionally, she made use of real life examples based on her political science background which was very interesting.

Very nice and helpful. She is not an easy grader but papers and projects are easy to understand. All in all, she is an easy and helpful professor. As an international student, I receive too much support which I have not received in other classes.

She is a nice lady but EXTREMELY tough grader. She is a grad student so you would think she would understand the struggle. But no. You do A LOT of papers, and still have two midterms. She's very particular about what she wants and to get an A you have to learn the way she likes things (papers, projects), and do it that way.

While professor Ross had good intentions, she did not make class exciting and often would lecture on things that were not very relevant. She gave options for extra revisions and would help point out certain mistakes to get a higher grade, but many times she would still deduct points for things that she did not mention during revision sessions.

Felicia was a good professor for this class and made it very easy to be successful in the class. It was not particularly challenging, but she is very good about giving feedback and making it extremely clear as to how to be successful. If you show up and listen to her feedback, it should be easy to do well in the class.

Felicia structured this class in a way that makes it engaging and interactive. Unlike other professors who put up a power point and blabber on for an hour and a half, she creates an environment where students are encouraged to participate in discussions. Also, the subject matter of the class is pretty simple, would recommend this class for others
Does not sound intelligent

Not a bad class or professor, but most of your grade is based off of a group project you spend the whole semester working on and you have a paper for it due every week. It's not bad, but it felt like a lot of work and instructions weren't always clear. He does give you pop quizzes but you can use notes and he gives extra credit.

She is my favorite professor at this university. Her lectures are informative and easy to follow. She doesn't have final exams-- instead giving you a final project. So long as you do the work it's an easy and fun grade. Make sure to know your classmates as she loves giving extra credit on tests asking you to name classmates or where she is from.
worst professor ever. If you take online you get more questions on the exam than you do time. AVOID !!!!

I had Lance Holbert at Temple University for CSI 2112. He is not a bad guy, he is actually very bold and funny. He uses very heavy language and can be hard to understand, but if you get a hang of his grading style you will do fine. He is not out to get anybody. GO TO OFFICE HOURS!
Very good class. Presentations were given in a format helpful to students, and discussions were had to make sure students understood the concepts.

He is a fun guy but material is very boring. Way too much reading in my opinion. Exams are extremely difficult. I filled out the study guide to the best of my ability (10 pages worth of information) and only managed to get a C. Don't recommend as an elective.

I highly recommend taking this class with Lance! His class is not too bad. His exams are a little tough but he gives extra credit. In order to be successful you must read, go to class and study. I wouldn't recommend as an elective but if its required, take him! He is bold and funny! Overall, great class!
This guy is horrible.  It is like he wants you to fail.  No info on study guides for exams covered on test.  Unless you memorize everything you will not get a good grade.

Good professor. Fairly entertaining because he occasionally cusses like a sailor. He's openly liberal, I don't know why someone posted about him being conservative. Definitely need to work hard for an A, must study, gotta go to lecture, and must keep up on the readings! Recommend!

Buy the book b/c minor stuff from the chpts will appear on the test. try to keep up on the readings & attend lectures b/c he will test you on examples from class that you will only know the answer if you went. Also, if u don't like politics I would take this class a different quarter w/different teacher. Hes a republican & is proud of it & shows it
good teacher and a good guy but the class wasn't so good... i got an A+ but i definitly had to work for it...

Good Teacher. I thought this would be a slacker class but in order to get at least a B you must go to all lectures, read notes, and BUY the book(questions will appear from the chapters) I liked how he lets u retake the exam and avg's the score if you didnt do well or take it on the second exam date if u missed the 1st exam date or not ready.

very nice guy. I ended up with a B in the class, but i went to his office hours, got to know the TA's worked with him and I needed an A and got it. If you are willing to put in the work and go over what you missed he is willing to work with you. Class is hard but not terrible. We had 12 pts extra credit, exam and final were curved.

Very good teacher, you will truly learn alot from him if you go to class! However, the grading scale is tough but he is one of those teachers that dont bore you to death, which in my opinion is a rare find.

It consisted of 40% midterm, 50% final, and 10% pop quizzes.  The reason it was hard was because the lecture notes were very abstract and hard to study.  The exams took tiny details from the book and had questions on them.  Good news is there is a curve and lots of Extra Credit! There was 9% added this quarter.
Great teaching ability with a passion for the subject material.

This class is an absolute BEAR! it consists of 2 tests worth 35% and 55% of your final grade, the rest made up of 10.1pt pop quizzes...Lance does allow for a lot of extra credit points (I had 11 this qtr) He is a very nice and very funny guy who is passionate about teaching but is too smart for his own good.
The class grade is made up by 10% participation, 35% midterm, and 55% cumulutive final.  Have fun!  No, you won't.
Class grade is 10% participation, 35% midterm, and 55% cumulutive final.  Have fun!  No, you won't.

Professor Holbert is very passionate about his classes. He encourages his students to think for themselves. The class was moderately difficult, but he was a lot of fun in class. Cusses like a sailor sometimes though.

Professor Holbert was awesome! He always had material to go along with the lecture. Very passionate about what he is doing and does a great job getting the material across. The best part is that he can tell when the class is getting tired of the lecture and he will stop-he doesn't over lecture. He is a really solid guy and I recommend him!

Locks the door to class the minute it starts. The class is about MEDIA terrorism but made it terrorism heavy. Asked things like when to call an act of war, which is something a comm student isn't trying to figure out and everyone had limited answers for. The class falls flat in actually covering what you signed up for. Find a different professor.

Worst instructor I have ever had. He would give terrible feedback on papers and talk in circles. The final group project was defining terrorism and it only caused people to get upset and defensive, including the instructor. He says you need to be able to write well but doesn't proofread his own comments. Tedious papers for low points. Cold calls.

Nathan was very knowledgeable and passionate about this subject. Even if you do not have a background going into this class, he covers all grounds that will catch you up to speed by the time you are discussing major concepts that you need for the test. His test was very fair and so were the assignments, just make sure you keep up and put effort in!
Makes lectures fun. Loves memes. Relaxed, but will nitpick you to make you a better writer. Solid choice.

She is strict but always fair. When circumstances out of my control made my assignment late she did not penalize me. If you have a hard time not being on your phone do not take this class. She will penalize your grade for it but she is very up front about that. She is a bit difficult to understand. Lots of in class activities for easy points.

Very helpful when it comes to criteria for papers and feedback. Only two exams but make sure you study. A lot of papers so get ready to write. Carefully read the rubrics; she explains exactly how to get an A and gives examples. A lot of work for a GE.
Very accessible. Lots of group discussions.

Dr. Kosicki is a great guy, he knows a lot and will talk with me after class for awhile! Heavy liberal agenda but is really focused on educating and opening students minds. Public Opinion can be a pretty common sense class but he brings historical and current issues in to connect the ideas.
Awesome guy, took him to lunch, very knowledgeable about the subject. Made sure that we understood the subject matter, and did so in a variety of ways.
Awesome class and professor.

His class (lectures) were so boring! His exams were kind of tricky and not as clear as his lectures and what you studied or read out the book. This class was a requirement and couldnt get around it. But if you're not into research then dont take it. It also reminded me of a STATS class!
Great class. Easy to get an A if you keep up with all the assignments. Very flexible with assignments and the material is interesting.

I was surprised that I enjoyed this class. He posts power points online, but don't let make you wants to skip since he takes attendance every class. You have to write three papers that are about a weeks readings. The quizzes and midterms are also online. He grades accurately and if you have questions, he's very quick to respond.

Dr. Kosicki is extremely bright and well informed, as any professor should be, but I felt like he was always talking down to us. At one point, he told the class that we're known as "the dumbest generation" and he consistently raises his voice because he's angry/irritable. However, it's been a rather easy semester in 4820. Attendance is taken daily!

Very boring lectures. Assigns 3 one page papers over readings of your choice. Midterm was take home essay, and final is online. Also required a group paper and presentation. Gets upset easily and rants about political issues every class. Very grumpy and doesn't like when his grading is questioned. Refuses to give full credit on any assignment.

A very intelligent, caring professor, although he may not come across this way at first. Lectures can be boring, but if you can try hard to pay attention, he has a great deal of interesting information to share. I'd suggest getting to know him & attend an OH or 2 b/c he can be very understanding & flexible w/ assignments if he knows you.
Prob the most liberal teacher I have ever had.. Easy class! Be prepared to write alot of papers at the end of the semester. Class was painfully boring!

Very knowledgeable and passionate about his work. Lectures are mandatory, but the slides are online. Four online quizzes make up the midterm. He gives you plenty of time and you can have the slides up, so it's super easy. Take home final. Ten page paper and 15 minute presentation are the only bummer.
Great instructor, however, it would of been nice if not so much reference was given to a prevailing medical problem during the lectures.
The lectures were difficult to stay awake in, but helpful. The debates were not too bad. Takes attendance, so plan your absences accordingly.

Dr. Kosicki is probably one of the most well informed and intelligent teachers I have had in my four years at OSU. He understands the material and puts all his slides on Carmen. You learn a great deal from the debates which are a lot of work but end up being fun.However, his lectures can get pretty dull! Recommend for sure though :)

I had 3 classes with him and he really is a nice, helpful professor. I will say he was more approachable in 567 than the other classes bc he was more interested in the topic. The debates were very informative and fun, but you have to get back the boring discussions first. Respect him and you will do just fine.

Not very informative when it comes to assignments.  A lot of the midterm questions were pretty obscure, and the final was take home essays which once again were fairly obscure.  It was an incredibly boring class that was supposed to be discussion based but he just talked the whole time.  The debates were at least interesting. I would not recommend.
Professor is genuinely interested in teaching. He does not have in-class reminders so you need to be on the ball with the syllabus.
class could be boring sometimes but mostly a good easy class and professor is genuinely interested in teaching; extremely helpful if you use office hours.
Great, very informative class in which I learned a lot. Prof is very helpful with debates and other things; really cares about students.

Clearly knows the material, lecture just overall boring.  Attendance mandatory.  Debates more interesting, makes 2nd half of qtr go more quickly.  midterm was online, final is take home paper.  most information overlaps with other comm and poli sci classes

The debates are really a great way to learn, especially for com majors.  Class is not dull, it just isn't flashy.  If you pay attention you really will learn a lot.  He may look grumpy, but he is really very approachable and accessible. He is very passionate about this subject, and will teach you a lot if you are receptive.

Very boring class and he was very boring as an instructor.  Was grumpy alot of times and seemed visably upset with people in class when no one would participate.  His debate projects are a plus side though.  Just get used to a very very dull 2 hour class.
Have never learned more in any college class than in this one. Class debate project is awesome and made me think about things in new ways.
Awesome class! I never thought about these topics in this way before. Very caring prof who tried to help in every way in and out of class.
Extremely helpful, stimulating class in which I learned a lot. Prof. Kosicki helped me a lot with my term paper and I'm now submitting it to a major conference.
Excellent, caring man who is very helpful if you bother to get to know him.

I had Dr. K for a couple of courses years ago as a grad student, and I easily got past the exterior noted here and learned a great deal. He obviously has a keen interest in his field, and was always willing to discuss issues during office hours. But journalism was my life; if you have little interest in it, you might see it differently.
No Comments
Advice: To communicate with him, e-mail or call on the phone to get his full attention. He is very grumpy in person and whines a lot. He's personable as long as it's not face-to-face.

Exams were 50% lecture 50% reading. I did not read many of the assigned readings. He points out exactly what his exam questions will be like and what they will cover. There will be no surprises on the exam. Anything on the exam from the reading will just be the graphs and findings, none of the extra fluff. Super fun class as well.

Dr. Huskey is a cool California dude. He's a researcher so his class is very chill. Clear cut grading and willing to work with students. His exams are exactly how he describes them to be. Make sure to READ the research papers, thats 50% of the battle. Exams are memorization, not meant to be tricky. Take him if you can!

He graded three papers in September and then didn't upload any other grades until after the deadline in December. Doesn't answer emails, doesn't communicate well since it was an online class, and was a very tough grader even though he didn't provide feedback for 3/4 of the semester.
He made this easy course really hard and he is tough grader. We can't get high score .
Really tough grader
For a 2000 level class, he makes it harder than it should be. Is also a very harsh grader. Would not take with him if you have other options.

She is an amazing, helpful and caring professor. She does everything she can to make sure students do well in the class and understand material. Her lectures are pretty interesting. Come to class ready to have small group discussions and participate. The class isn't much work, just stay on top of assignments and you'll do great.

Shelly truly cares that her students succeed and learn. If you show up to class, you will do well. Her exams aren't meant to trick you. She incorporates modern movies into her course material that you can watch outside of the classroom instead of showing up to class- movies that are actually good. She's always there to help you and grades quickly.

Shelly was not my favorite professor. She has a no technology policy which is strictly enforced, you're only allowed a pencil and paper. Her lectures are very long and boring, she does not interact much with the class. Her grading is stingy and had a lot of assignments. Sometimes I felt as if I was in middle school in her class. Would avoid.
READ THE RUBRICS FOR THE PAPERS, That will help you get a better grade.  She outlines EVERYTHING you need to include in your paper.  There are a few in class assignments, but not many.

Ratings.comment: Had him for 2nd year writing. Hes a good teacher and definitely cares about you understanding the material. However, we did take a couple multiple choice exams that were a little difficult and I have no idea why exams were given in a writing class. Overall though taking Silver isnt a bad choice.
Very good
Toughest class I have ever taken in my entire life, and it is a course for first years...

Very chaos. The instructor always forgets to put the materials and the links to the folders. I had to send a lot of messages and emails to ask about it. Tough grader too. Very disappointed. Will never attend her class again.

This class is fairly easy, just read the assigned chapters and then would go over them in class. Speeches are quite easy too, as long as you prepare for them. She will help you in any way you need! Pop quizzes and exams based mostly on information from the text, and not really lectures. So when studying you for those you will want the book.

I love Stefanie. She's so honest and real and I feel like she teaches me something but also respects each and every student. I find it so important to feel respect in order to feel engaged in a class and in my lecture every single student seems to feel valued and part of the conversation. Not to mention that she always makes me laugh.

She constantly forgot to put up assignments until the entire class reminded her about it. She didn't start grading anything until week 11 so the discussion posts we had been doing for the first 11 weeks turned out to be all wrong (which are worth 50% of the total grade) so the entire class started failing. She would also constantly be off topic.

She's funny and unique. I like her a lot, and classes are fairly easy. I had her for persuasive and org comm. To get 100 on her quizzes, you'll probably have to read the textbook, you'll be able to do fine without the text though. No big exams either!! Definitely recommend her.

I had to miss a few classes and cleared it with him beforehand, but I guess he either did not care or forgot. I lost major attendance points and he graded my work very poorly (a C on my reflection paper!) even after I met with him for help. I did not feel he was very understanding or flexible, so just be careful to go to class and pay attention.

One of my favorite classes! Group project throughout the semester but graded on just your work. Exams were easy and I actually learned beneficial information. Extra credit given and no HW just reviewing for quizzes (not hard).  Would recommend to anyone who needs a 2nd level writing course!!

COMM 2367 with Jon Anderegg was a pleasurable experience. The class was not difficult, but that is because Jon is an amazing teacher. I took this class for my second writing because I do not like writing classes, but Jon made the class fun and not too difficult. Would highly recommend.
Very easy class and helps make a comfortable atmosphere for public speaking. This class is less about learning material and more about gaining practice and confidence with presentations. Easy A!

Took him for Strategic Writing - he gave us double the course work as friends Strategic Writing class, and graded very harshly. He rubbed me the wrong way, came off as a pretentious guy who only is a professor so he can get schooling for free and get papers published. I passed his class - not making this out of spite. But I'll never take him again.

Awesome professor! Really wants students to take away a real world application of the class, definitely helpful before/after class and in OH, super funny, and also fun to look at. COMM 3554 was great too--no textbook but nightly studies to read with very simple reading quizzes in class (he tells you what to focus on), and a paper in lieu of a final

Best teacher I've had at OSU so far. He's super helpful and makes all the information easy to understand! He's also hilarious, so that's definitely a plus. I'm definitely hoping I'll have the opportunity to take another one of his classes.
He is funny and interesting. He is really helpful with assignments as well. felt like he could be a friend if he wasnt my teacher :)yummy
Really helpful with the confusing assignments and it doesn't hurt to have to look at him twice a week for 2 hours
Really nice guy and not too bad looking either! ;)
Managed to make mundane lecture material interesting.  Always willing to give feedback and offer help.  Found the workload fair, got a good grade, and left feeling I learned valuable material.
easy A, material is so easy

If you need to take a GEC, take this one & take it with Kelly. She keeps things pretty chill and wants you to have fun while learning something. If anything she gives you tips on how to survive college and get a decent grade in class

Kelly cares about her students and the material. I liked how not one thing was going to sink my entire grade - points were spread out. Do the readings, she may not cover it all in lecture. Attendance helps, trust me!

Kelly is really interesting and makes class enjoyable with jokes, videos, etc. Go to her review sessions- casual atmosphere where she will tell you what is on the exam! Pay attention to details in class-it will help on the attendance quizzes. She also loved student input on social media.

Very good teacher. She took the time to memorize our names ( I know...this is rare) and was always very approachable and willing to help out. Not a hard grader and I actually learned a lot from this class for public speaking!

Kelly has a tough class to teach; this course covers everything from AM/FM radio to satellites and social media. It's somewhat boring but Kelly tried her best to make it fun. DO THE READINGS! They help so much.

The content is really dry and Kelly tries to spice it up as best she can with some videos and humor. Pay attention to the details since that's where the test and quiz questions are. Her review sheets and office hours will help you on your grades.

I took this class for a GEC and actually got something out of it. Kelly is clear in her expectations and gives you plenty of  opportunities to meet them. She mixed things up a bit and I might have finally gotten over my nervousness about speaking in public. If you have a choice, you'll do well with her.
She was the TA to fill in for the regular prof Dimmick. Very fair grader, wants you to learn as much as you want to pass. She finally let us use Carmen and other online stuff - the other guy didnt

Alex was a very good teacher. Yes, the material is pretty easy to grasp and sometimes lectures run a little boring, but he's a nice guy and very reasonable. Be prepared for a big group project that involves public speaking, for which you'll have to write a lot (no surprise from a second writing class). I would take him again, though.

Hedstrom is a really nice guy, and he tries really hard to make students understand the material.  But the material in the class is VERY easy and boring, so class can be tedious sometimes.  It's a super easy class, an easy A.  The final exam is a 'reflection paper' over the semester, so that's always good.

This was the bane of my existence. Didn't know what I was getting myself in to with the web design stuff. Constantly had to ask for help.  Pingree wasn't very clear during the lectures, but he was so nice and helpful during the lab portion of class. Really nice guy and super knowledgeable, just not the most interesting teacher
Ray was a very good teacher. I would definitely recommend him to anyone. I didn't think I would like this class because I'm not big on politics, but his information was very interesting.

The class overall is very interesting and not too difficult as long as you pay attention. Attendance was taken, usually in the form of an in-class short written response and the midterms are not terribly difficult. The readings are online but are not required as you will cover all of the material in class. Overall the class was well put together.

Prof Pingree is awesome. Took this class the first time it was offered, and he was very open with it being a new class and willing to adjust material as needed. Complete study guides were given before every exam, and exams never varied from guide. Readings are given but all exam material is covered in class/slides. EC given!

Very great & nice professor. Really tried to help students understand. Exams were very fair & straight from lecture slides. No need to read or purchase textbook whatsoever. Class is interesting and not painful to attend! You're allowed to miss a few lectures which is nice. Highly recommend Ray and this class!
Really nice professor. We watched The Office a lot too. Good guy
Professor Pingree is an okay professor.  He goes pretty fast but you can tell he really cares and like what he does.

Ray Pingree is seriously so incredible! He couldn't possibly make the concepts any easier to understand. He loved showing us episodes of The Office, which related to many lectures. It's just an easy laid back class. No comprehensive exams, which was AWESOME. I highly recommend taking his Organizational Comm class.

Dr. Pingree is a great professor! All of the slides are posted online, but I highly recommend attending class. He has great examples that make the information really easy to understand. The class is fun and interesting.
He makes all of the material extremely easy to understand. Related concepts to TV shows and movies and frequently show clips. Made class exciting enough so you wouldn't dread going.

Ray is an awesome professor!  He's so down to earth and really understands people.  A lot of professors lack that connection with their students, but he has it.  He made, what could have been, a dull class very interesting. I wish I needed more classes that he taught.  Classwork wasn't too much, it was laid back, but I learned a lot. Take him!
Genuinely cool man. Made class fun and was extremely willing to help everyone. Even made us delicious cookies.

Always made an effort to make class fun and interesting, and tied whatever we were learning in class with current trends, or added a funny video to our sites while coding. Very knowledgable and helpful, while also being very fun and kind. Definitely recommend him to any student.
Topic was difficult but Ray kept it interesting and fresh; helped a lot on an individual level and even brought in snacks sometimes!

Although the material wasn't exciting, Ray kept it interesting with in-class activities and discussions usually accompanied with humorous clips from The Office. It was clear that helping students do our best is important to him. From my experience, he responds quickly to emails and answers any questions you have thoroughly.

Ray is a newer professor but he was extremely fascinated by the topic and willing to explain things in depth if you emailed him. He made class fun by showing clips of The Office to drive home points and we even watched Office Space. Exams were worded a little tricky, but he ended up curving them for us.

Ray is a newer professor but is very excited about teaching and very willing to clarify or give examples. He will answer any questions right before the exam. Material was relatively easy, I did not buy/use the book.

The best Comm class I've taken. The topic sounded boring and I thought I would hate it, but Ray makes it interesting and really cares about students. Attendance is only mandatory for 12/18 classes, you get extra credit for attending more. He was extremely helpful with exams - took the final today and he answered ?s for 20 minutes before we started.

Hard to hear sometimes, lectures and slides were fairly hard to follow. Tests were pretty easy, this class was very fair. I thought it was pretty boring but the best helper was video examples. The information is also very important for handling the job world. I realized how unfair my jobs have been to me because of what i learned in this class.

Ray was an awesome professor. I am really sad I didn't take this class on semesters so I could have it longer. You are able to skip a couple classes and it won't count against you, but I discourage it. He stresses what is on the exams in class and the content is interesting, plus he shows clips from The Office. Favorite class so far!
He's really into what he teaches.
I enjoyed the class overall.  There is no busy work which is always good, but the exams might be a bit challenging.
Overall professor is doing a good job in teching and communicating the material clearly
real cool guy. if you like a class where you analyze clips of "the office," this one's for you.
I think he is a nice guy and I dont think the tests are extremely hard. If you come to class you should be fine

GREAT professor! Everything you learn in class is on the exam. If you go to class, you will do fine on the exams. His exams come directly from the powerpoints. Attendance isn't mandatory but get class participation points from The Office clips and writing an example of comm methods from the clip. Fun class and I learned a lot! Would take him again!

Power point slides are SO boring. He is SO boring. Prepare to memorize every slide for the exam. He creates tough and tricky questions for the exams. Dreaded this class! Only plus is you watch The Office a ton.

if you like being a student, I mean actually like to learn, then this guy is tops.  he just loves to teach.  I think that goes a long way in classroom settings.  it was very clear that his goal was too inform students, not fail them.  I'm no super geek,  he's just a good professor.  if you want an A or B, you should have no problem earning one.

Ray is a really great guy. He is super nice, but can tend to be monotonous. He is intelligent and he'll throw a curveball at you with his humor and wit. I've had two classes with him. He is very helpful. If you do the work, you'll succeed.
He is a really intelligent guy. You will learn really broad and abstract theories that can be applied to politics and a ton of other comm courses.

Ray is awesome. Super laid-back teacher and 100% willing to help you learn and do the best you can. If you do not do well in his class it is your own fault. He is not strict on deadlines and his tests come straight from lecture and reading. Do the readings, go to class, participate and you will succeed. You are in college act like it and youll pass

Really nice guy, laid back class, he shows really funny videos and is extremely helpful. I dont even like politics and this ended up being my favorite class, I would definitely take a class of his again. GO RAY!
Class was pretty easy but interesting.  He tried to keep the class fun with use of videos and movies.  The study guides apply directly to the tests.
Good guy. Tests are extremely easy if you study his power point slides.

Ray is awesome, no doubt about it.  I've had him for 614 and 325, he is super helpful and overall a great guy.  His tests are only challenging if you haven't done the reading/studied.  You're in college, that is your responsibility.
Study his slides and reorganize your notes. Don't expect easy exams. Overall, really nice teacher and wants students to do well.

He kept assigning readings from leftist scholars. nice guy, but he does a poor job organizing the class. If you dont talk in his class your grades will be punished. If there is an alternative to him take it. His tests are extremely brutal and remorseless

He was awful! The class was about org. comm. but we ending up being taught about computer programing (?). He was horrible at lecturing; he didn't explain anything well. His notes were terrible. I personally wrote him a nice email asking him to change some methods (like slowing down). He said thank you and changed NOTHING!

I had Ray in his first qtr of teaching. He presented way too much information and his tests were brutal! When he saw the class struggling he changed his grading procedure to make it a little easier to do better in the class.He was reaally nice and always willing to help out when he could. I would reccomment doing to lecture in order to do well!

Ray He presented way too much information and it wasnt always clear. He is new at teaching but he is very nice and helpful when you are struggling. His tests are very hard and his grading methods at first were a little brutal. He saw the class was struggling and was willing to lighten up. Showing up to lecture is importnat but overall very nice guy

This professor is new and it shows! This class was a constant strugle!!! It did not matter how much studying I did, I could never get past a D and I am an A, B student!! The course itself is boring but the professor just did not explain anything well! IT WAS AWFUL! and half of the students in the class gave back bad feedback on evaluation day!!

A really challenging class.  Learned a lot. He's really good in that although he had lofty expectations starting out, he adjusted his teaching methods when he realized we were all lost. Fair, accomodating, and very helpful. I would definitely recommend taking this class if you have any interest in learning web design

Tabitha was awesome! She made a confusing and intimidating course load very clear and less intimidating. She expected quality work from the class and made herself available to help if needed. She has been the best instructor I have had at OSU.
I will actually take the things that she taught us and use them. Turned a mandatory class to an enjoyable one. So funny.
Literally the best prof i've had at OSU and I'm ending my junior year. Only weakness. . . kryptonite?  Even the slower material was okay because she is sexy.
Tabitha is the best! She has a great sense of humor, which makes her class more enjoyable. Take every class you can with her, it'll be worth it!

Awesome teacher. Super laid back, entertaining, and makes the course material tolerable. Three of my roommates and I took this class at the same time but with different teachers -- they all had pop quizzes, improv speeches, and harsh grading. I highly recommend Tabitha if you end up taking this course.
Tough grader but explains exactly what she wants. Showed lots of videos to give real world exaples.
would help me edit my papers before i turned them in- really nice
Super, super easy class. Read the rubric closely and skim over the lectures, which are online, for the multiple choice quizzes.
very funny, short classes, loved his sarcasm
Changed my view of the world. I am now a more wholesome individual after listening to Scott's insightful lectures. Awesome job!
short classes, lectures kind of boring but he's informal and funny, helpful if you ask questions especially with emails
great class. some stuff was boring but she made it fun.
really helpful over email, obviously knowledgeable, She wants you to do well in the class and uses lots of good examples to help keep you awake and interested
It's a pretty boring class. He posts all the slides on Carmen and the exams are pretty straight forward. It should be an easy A!

His lectures are pretty boring but his exams have alot of questions pertaining to lecture. He puts all the slides on Carmen so lecture is definitely not mandatory. Exams are fairly easy if you go over the lecture slides and go over the key terms in the textbook.

If you have to take History of Communication, I would definatly recommend him. His tests are easy, they require an average amount of work but not more than should be required for a 100 level class, and he's easy to understand and approach if you have to.

This guy is not helpful at all. Also, he tries to force student to attend and focus on his boring lecture. For example, he even gives exam questions about videos we saw in class. It is not easy to get high scores in exams, but I have to do many extra credit study.

His class was very easy. I needed it as a pre-req b/c I was thinking about majoring in Communications and b/c of his class, that's what I chose. Very fun lecture, which is surprising since there were more than 400 people. Read the textbook as needed. Loads of extra credit!
Very easy class. He made an effort to keep lectures interesting. No reading required. Tests are easy. I felt that he was overall a very nice guy.
Easiest class ever. Nice guy. Very not personal class.
The worst class ever! Don't the class! Trust me!
Lectures are pointless. He is an ok guy. Easy. Boring.

Class is discussion based. Very redundant and non informative. Class has 3 take home essay midterms. Discussion is student led, prof mccluskey hardly does anything other than grade midterms. Weekly reading quizzes. Grading is vague and inconsistent. Overall very poor experience.

McCluskey is a jerk!! Whenever I went to speak to him about class he was rude and unhelpful. At the end of the quarter when I went to talk to him about my borderline grade, he was insincere and rude. The class was not that hard, but he is an awful teacher and a rude man!!
The way he and his TAs graded the exams and essay made me lose hope in Communication major as a whole. I changed my major because of him!
Most boring class I could possibly imagine.  Attendance wasn't even close to necessary to pass the class with a good grade, which I guess is good, but the lectures were too boring to deal with.
Pretty boring in lecture, but the slides are clear and most of the material on the slides is on the exams.  Online book quizzes are easy. Exams aren't too bad... easy class overall.

This class is the biggest joke of all time. I literally never went to class and aced it. All you need to study is powerpoints online for the exams. Don't buy the textbook either. I can't really tell you about the class (because I never went), but I highly recommend this class, if you can even classify this as one.

Thought this class would be terrible, but it ended up being pretty interesting. He was extremely knowledgable about communication law. It's not a really difficult class, but there is A LOT of material to memorize for exams. The powerpoint notes are pretty vague- you have to go to class and take your own in order to do well. Recommended professor!

It should be considered a feat how boring he is in class. However, his lectures are very straightforward and if you study the notes, read the book and attend class even sporadically you should get an A without any problems.

Very easy class. Online quizes are simple. He can be monotonous but the lectures are very clear and very organized and mostly from the book. He seems like a really nice guy. I would recommend him as a professor

She is an excellent instructor! Her mixture of sarcasm, humor, intellect, & knowledge of the field makes for a fun and informational course. She doesnt make you work beyond your comfort level and is very approachable and helpful. I hope she graduates from her grad program so I can take a higher level class from her in the future! Take her classes!!
Instructor was prepared and passionate about topic. Always prompt on returning emails. Always willing to help. Very low key class that was great to go to.
Awesome class. Very enthusiastic professor, presentations offered in format helpful to students, and exams are relatively easy as long as students pay attention during class and study beforehand.
Brandon is awesome and very helpful. His tests are harder that one expects, but if you go to office hours beforehand, it helps A LOT. There are a lot of opportunities for grades.
some of the content is tricky, but brandon does his best to help. TA was helpful and approachable. textbook isn't helpful - rent dont buy.

Don't buy the textbook.  Class got very boring as the year went on.  Exams were a little tricky, just make sure you do spend time studying.  There is always a curve.  Class consisted of 100 points.  5 for attendance, 40 for assignments, 55 for exams.  Go to study hours if you need help or get to know your TA.

This class is really easy. 4 Assignments for the whole class, and they give you a guideline of what needs to be answered in the assignments. The exams are a little tricky, but with a bit of studying you can definitely pull of a good grade

This class is pretty boring, but Brandon is really excited about all the material which makes it more interesting. The tests are harder than you think and I would definitely suggesting going to office hours for help. But overall, if you study it is not a hard class. My friend got a 105%..
He tries really hard to be funny, but the lecture is really boring. And this course is kinda useless, i won't take it if it's not my major requirement.
He doesn't explain concepts he uses on test. His exams are tricked, even good students really struggle with him. Extremely low A average.
Tries to hard, makes easy concepts into things they are not. Exams questions are intended to trick.

Why did people like him? Had to have him as a teacher 5 times, he wasted class time on Eugene, Oregon, played favorites with hot girls/PRSSA members in class, embarrassed non-favorites in front of the whole class, shared grades out loud to all. Tests didn't mirror material given. Unrealistic teaching style. Osei Appiah was a much better professor.

Dan is a GREAT teacher. I've had him for two classes and you can tell that he is genuinely interested in helping his students. He would provide opportunities for students to take trips to gain insight into the PR field. Yeah, he talks about his job a lot (esp in 431) but he's a fun teacher and if you do your work, you should be able to get an A.

Dan was by far the most influential and helpful professor I had at OSU. His classes were practical and he always combined theory with real world examples. I would not have chosen PR as a career if it had not been for Dan.

He tells stories rather than class material. His exams are very tricky. He states questions oddly, and then the answers are all very similar, making you second guess yourself. I wish I had had a different teacher.
Such an amazing prof! You will learn so much from him!

I'm surprised that so many people like Dan. Although he is nice, he plays favorites very obviously.  He loves football players and PRSSA members.  Dan was unrealistic, having us work in groups of 7-10.  We aren't in a work setting, we are still in college and have to work his class around all others.  However, Dan is a nice guy outside of class.

Dan is by far the best professor I have had.  He is really easy to talk to and makes learning enjoyable.  It's nice to notice that a professor enjoys their job and cares about helping students.  If you have to chance to have Dan for a Comm. class - take it.  I have learned a great deal from him and his stories which prepare us for the future.
Great guy, learned a lot in his class. Tries to get to know everyones name, very interactive with the class. Not a real traditional teaching style.
Great instructor, offers a lot of out of the classroom help. Considered about his students and always wants to help them with internships and out of the classroom related items.

tests don't reflect what he's taught in class, likes to talk about himself, only likes students who are in PRSSA or athletes, doesn't belong in the classroom - should go back to the professional world

I agree with the other comments: if you're not in PRSSA/an athelete/one of his favorite, you might as well be invisible. His class is very dry-Often goes off into small talks: some were amusing - majority of them were useless/pointless. Had a bad episode one week and went off at the students (still very upset at how unprofessional he was).
No Comments
No Comments
what an annoying teacher.

EWwwwww if you're not in PRSSA, or a football player, he won't like you.  I couldn't stand his class b/c he spent so much time talking about what his precious PRSSA club was doing.  If you're not a favorite of his, don't take his class.
best prof. ever!

Very interesting, good stuff to know to prepare you for your career. He's got connections to help you in the future for internships.Nice guy, attempts to get to know a good chunk of 200 ppl in the class. some class discussion. 1 midterm, 1 final and a couple assignments. not hard..if u go to class

Fantastic prof. Tells corny jokes, but funny enuf. He prefers girls, but if you are a guy he doesn't hate you, in fact he will be nice, but just pays more attention to the ladies. VERY interesting subject matter that he teaches. VERY helpful to know after you graduate to help land a good job.
Dan is a cool guy, but he is definitely a PROFESSIONAL and not a PROFESSOR. He needs to improve his style to fit academia.
Very easy class.  if you show up you should do great!
Good guy but his class was kind of long and he talks non-stop!

Too much small talk, not enough attention to the class material. The exams were not difficult but tricky. By the end I was counting down how many classes were left. Also I thought this would be a small class and there were about 200 students.
Dan is a great professor! His class is tricky but if you come to class and do the assignments no one should have a problem acheiving a great grade.
tough class but interesting. nice guy but kind of corny

Dan is a great teacher at what he teaches.  Its no cake-walk, though, and you have to apply yourself.  It also helps if you find some way to take a personal interest in the class material.  Honestly, his class is the only one I've never skipped in 5 years
Dan really knows his stuff and is quite entertaining.  However his class was pretty hard for me.
interesting class, lots of info, but Dan is very practical in teaching it
No Comments

Terrible teacher. He gives everyone the same grade in the class for the research project, which he divides up the work for unevenly. He gives absolutely no direction on this, and when asked in class for more, he says that he will talk more about it later (which he never does). Boring and dry lectures, avoid if possible.

Incredibly boring and inconsiderate teacher. He was rude to the class and his TA. Tests were a complete joke and often had little to do with lectures. His experiences in the field are outdated (he was in radio) so he has trouble relating to the modern world of communications. He uses an expensive textbook from 1989 to teach.

Such a boring old guy. His lectures are short but so boring and scripted. His TA when I had him was completely useless. He yelled at students for coming in  3 minutes late on the first day of class!?! WTF? His tests are lame and the book is from 1980s yet it cost $90 then you cant even return it. This teacher blows and so does his class. Avoid if p

He teaching style is uninteresting and really lacks any enthusiasm. It's sort of like listening to someone read off a phone book generally. He has a great deal of knowledge and gives good examples but it's a challenge to stay awake when he is droning on about some random theory...
HE IS THE WORSET TEACHER IN OSU. I REALLY RECOMMEND STUDENTS TO NOT TAKE ANY OF HIS CLASSES ESPECIALLY IF HE IS TEACHING RESEARCH COURSES.
Very dry sense of humor, but clearly knows his stuff.  Weekly quizzes on the readings, exams can be hard but there is a curve
Such a funny, weird old guy!  He does keep lectures short which is great, and if you do the reading you will do just fine.  I ended up really enjoying the class!

He seems gruff and like he doesn't care about students in the beginning.  It turns out he is a very nice man with a great sense of humor.  Class isn't that easy which is good for the communication major.          Keeps class periods short but offers a ton of good information.  He knows what hes talking about.
Boring lecture and exams ask the pickiest, irrelevant questions.  At least there was a curve.
You think it is going to be hard, but you atill get a good grade.
he was easy, funny, and everyone did pretty well in the class in the end. if you do the reading, you'll easily get a good grade in his class.
He was very unclear on what would be expected on exams.  I felt like I didn't learn anything, and only went to class because attendance counted.

Seems grumpy at times, but you really come to understand him as a person and how genuine he is.  He has a funny sense of humor once you get used to it.  His bark is worse than his bite.  I think he is fair.

Dr. Feaster is one of the best professors I know. He explains the material very clearly and if you study before the quizzes you will get an A. He is super approachable and willing to discuss your performance. I highly recommend him!!!

This class was the easiest I had ever taken.  Unlimited extra credit opportunity really allows you to get the grade that you want to work for.  Exams are moderately hard, but quizzes are all on carmen and John posts all the notes online after class, so there is no need to ever attend.  Got an A in this class.  Recommend him to your friends!
He is THE best prof (TA) i had. he is awsome.. very helpful. His class is fun and i learn great deal from this guy.. HE IS JUST AWSOME

You would assume that you would be able to easily understand a communications prof, but this isn't the case. He's hard to understand because his accent is so thick. Other than that, there is a lot of information that is needed to know for the exams, but weekly quizzes are helpful. Lectures drag on and are very boring.
Very easy exams, you study the lecture notes, easy A.
he's a cool guy and makes the information really easy to understand. the class is easy overall and I found most of the class interesting

This class was my easiest A if you read all the chapters, if not, his lectures will help adequately. He's a nice guy who tries to joke around. Class is not mandatory, though he gets offended if you leave early. Plenty of extra credit, easy exams and open note online quizzes.

Overall C101 wasn't a bad class, but the lectures were very long and drawn out, which resulted in them being boring. 2 Essays are required, but they aren't bad. Weekly quizzes help you if you are not a good test taker. 4 Tests, takes the best 3 of the 4 (final is the 4th test). Textbook is heaviy used.

He was very helpful with every aspect of the class. Due dates on assignments were pretty flexible too. If you needed an extra day or two he just had you e-mail it to him. Only bad thing was sometimes there would be multiple assignments going on at once and it got confusing as to what concepts applied to which assignments. Overall he was good.
The exams ask you bogus questions. I would study forever for one exam and get the same grade on another exam that I didn't study for. The class is not hard to get a B in its just the exams are bogus.

He is not a tough teacher the class itself is pretty hard because there is a lot of information to remember. attendance isnt mandatory but highly recommened. take all the notes and do all the quizes and essays. there is a lot extra cerdit so that helps

Basically this is just an easy GEC class.  If you can average 3 B's on the tests and do all the Carmen quizzes, 2-3 papers, and complete the extra credit surveys you can get an A- and not take the final.

This teacher is Just difficult you don't understand what he wants all his exams are difficult and quizes are even harder there are some extra points that are never going to help please don't take him if you want an A or B I cared about my grade more than the class and that's not me...
sexy
very interesting
Prof. David is the Man....his lecture isnt as bad as people say, and he is very dedicated to keeping you informed on CARMEN and there is plenty of extra credit to make up for poor quiz scores
This class was okay. Reasonably easy just study the slideshows from the book and pay attention to the random notes he gives you and you should be fine. Good guy though.

Easy class. All exams are about 90% from book and 10% from lecture.  The info that is on the pp slides are also in book, but he will test you on the ADDITIONAL info that is only in the book. You are better off to read ALL chapters along with the pp slides, and fill in the extra info yourself.  Does not test on #'s. Good Prof, take him.
Class is pretty easy.... sometimes he's kind of un-prepared... just read the book and goto class and you should get an A.. but sometimes you will be like "really?"

This class was easy. People complain about boring lectures, but I don't think there is much you can do to really 'spice up' the material we had to learn. And he does try to make it a little more interesting. Mr. David is extremely sincere and does try to make the exam grades fair. I would recommend his class as an easy grade and a caring professor.

this guy is so boring, you will hate coming to class. he keeps you there for the maximum amount of time, even though you shouldnt have to spend more than 20 minutes going overthe stuff. easy if you go to class. but easier if you can stay awake.

Very clear professor, and lets you know what is one the exams and how to do well.  He gives a curve at the end if necessary to boost grades.  A couple pop quizzes and you have to go to class to fill in the notes, or you will not do well.

Overall, a pretty easy class, just make sure that you get credits for all of the assignments. He does give a couple of pop quizzes for a pretty big part of your grade. very good professor and is willing to work with students who need a little extra help
Nick was a great professor.  He was to the point but made the lectures interesting.  He used many online examples and did take attendance everyday!  The class was cool overall.

Nick is an extremely funny guy. I had him at 8:30 so I was tired but going to his class always kept me active. Not that hard if you are good at journalism. Kind of a nerdy guy, but it makes him funny.
He was a very easy going guy. Attendance isn't mandatory and it sometimes makes it hard to attend. He is a pretty easy grader. You don't need the text. I definitely recommend him as a teacher.

One of the few journalism classes that is worth taking at OSU. I learned so much, and Elise is a great teacher, who is always more than willing to give feedback as many times as you want. Is it an easy A? No, you have to work at it, but I learned so much from Elise, I wish OSU had more teachers like her. Go Elise!

Elise is so cool! Super easy class, 3 midterms (and 1 gets dropped).  Lots of extra credit and easy in class assignments.  Go to class, get good grades on 2 of the tests and you will have an A w/o any problems.  Her class wasn't terribly boring either, fun video clips from Office Space and what not, and good real life examples.  Highly recommend!

She is super nice. She brings in a lot of clips from movies and shows to illustrate course concepts, which keeps you paying attention.
